column2: 1969 - the moon landing and Woodstock were one month apart, right? I wonder that no uplifting connections have ever been noted or even considered.
column3: I was actually out of touch with both those events and areas of interest. But 50 years later, I'm delighted with all the coverage.  Thanks, Sherna Stewart  On Aug 12, 2019 3:17 PM, "Monitor Daily" <daily@csmonitor.com> wrote:  [image: The Christian Science Monitor Daily]  Going beyond the headlines with the ideas driving progress.  August 12 Full Version <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?cmpid=ema:ddp:20190812&src=email> [image: headphones icon] Listen <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?cmpid=ema:ddp:20190812&src=email&id=full-audio-block>  Welcome to your Daily. Today we look at U.S. guns crossing borders <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?src=email#1093943>, a risky repositioning in the Mideast <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?src=email#1093888>, new perspective on Guatemala <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?src=email#1093946>, how Woodstock <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?src=email#1093947> still reverberates, and what’s up with 5G <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?src=email#1093948>.  But first, a look at perseverance and adaptation.  Thursday’s report <https://www.ipcc.ch/report/srccl/> from the U.N.’s Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change did more than lay out the sobering scope of desertification and land degradation and the implications for feeding the world. It also hinted at hope.  “The good news is [that] there’s ample room for mitigation,” Michael Mann, a professor of atmospheric science at Penn State, told CNN <https://www.cnn.com/videos/world/2019/08/09/amanpour-michael-mann-ipcc-climate-crisis.cnn>. One key piece, he and others say: coaxing more productivity from land. Technological innovation will help <https://www.csmonitor.com/Commentary/the-monitors-view/2019/0808/Climate-gloom-and-innovation-bloom>. Both consumer and land-use practices will need to shift worldwide. What about local action?  Last fall, the Camp fire burned more than 153,000 acres in Northern California and erased the town of Paradise (most of its population remains displaced <https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2019/07/11/paradise-california-population-camp-fire-california-wildfire-fund/1710525001/>). But as Martin Kuz reported in May <https://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Society/2019/0403/After-California-wildfires-what-survivors-say-they-gained-from-loss>, some residents emerged with renewed purpose.  And more recently, ecosystem restoration there has become hands-on. In pockets, reports Yes! Magazine <https://www.yesmagazine.org/planet/california-wildfire-survivors-recovery-permaculture-20190723>, residents are trying permaculture. In its fullest form that’s an approach where native crops and animals are positioned to help one another thrive – think nut trees surrounded by farmed pigs. The self-sustaining, soil-enriching cycle that results can dramatically boost per-acre yields <https://charleseisenstein.org/essays/permaculture-and-the-myth-of-scarcity/> .  “Welcome to the experiment!” Matthew Trumm, founder of the Camp Fire Restoration Project, tells those who have turned up to help. (His own work was inspired by an agronomist’s mid-1990s project in China.)  Already taking root in parts of Paradise: a constructive outlook to pass along.  “Because you’re bringing the next generation [into] thinking about this stuff,” said Mr. Trumm, “you’re healing that next generation.” ~ [image: https://images.csmonitor.com/csm/2017/06/1034591_3_illustration_clay-collins_standard.png?alias=square_400x400] <https://click.cssubs.com/?qs=94b76946b672381ab9f862a7a8330823dae9e85f9eda0548f1833d328765739550de375f8f57c26f894ffdda246c045b00197a421e84b288>  Clayton Collins  Director, editorial innovation  [image: twitter] @ClayCollinsCSM <https://twitter.com/ClayCollinsCSM?cmpid=ema:ddp:20190812&src=email> [image: Daily facebook share] <https://click.cssubs.com/?qs=94b76946b672381a2e991ff17725879154c8e08a636ff1c10e602a64d42aa0767526370206b0358f030805f4494efd6d3b23d52f4ff95a6e> [image: Daily twitter share] <https://click.cssubs.com/?qs=94b76946b672381afcf012962b05c3f72801e8b12cbd0b3dfe43bb1dff8f603a816aefeb96492c3160559c4f9a6c7c3e40dc78335f4ef23a> [image: Daily email share] <?subject=I+think+you%27ll+like+this+article+from+the+Monitor+Daily&body=Here's+the+article+on+CSMonitor.com:+%0A%0A+Growing+back+better+after+an+epic+wildfire+%0A%0A+https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812/Growing-back-better-after-an-epic-wildfire?src=shared+%0A%0A+You+can+try+the+Monitor+Daily+free+for+a+week:+https://www.csmonitor.com/dailyfreetrial> 1. Illegal border crossing: How U.S. guns wind up in Canada and Mexico <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?cmpid=ema:ddp:20190812&src=email#1093943>  Security is a two-way street. The cross-border movement of migrants gets more media attention because of its direction; we asked our reporter to look at reactions to traffic in U.S.-originating guns.  – Clayton The 30 Sec. Read  Guns bought from vendors in the United States and then smuggled illegally abroad are a fact of life across the Americas. But the mass shootings in El Paso, Texas, and Dayton, Ohio, this month have emboldened foreign stances against lax U.S. gun laws and shifted conversations about what that means for crime and safety north and south of the U.S. border.  Weaker gun regulations in the U.S. have long undermined Canada’s much stricter rules, as guns get trafficked north. The U.S. massacres came the same weekend as 17 shootings in 14 different incidents across Toronto. Border Security Minister Bill Blair said Canada could reduce violence with more money toward stopping guns from the U.S., which he called “the greatest arsenal in the world.”  Some 70% of guns recovered by law enforcement in Mexico and sent to the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives (ATF) between 2011 and 2016 were originally purchased from a licensed U.S. dealer. And of course, more than a third of those killed were Mexican citizens – prompting a withering response from Mexico.  President Andrés Manuel López Obrador urged U.S. leaders to reflect upon the “indiscriminate sale of guns.” Foreign Minister Marcelo Ebrard went further, threatening to open up a terrorist probe across the border.  By *Sara Miller Llana*  By *Whitney Eulich* Read 6 min. <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?cmpid=ema:ddp:20190812&src=email&id=1093943>  ( 1429 words ) [image: Daily facebook share] <https://click.cssubs.com/?qs=94b76946b672381a4dbfb637a2ac1ce477f0fc9c0d2a20a4bcd22c9671d222658703c431cbfa03a2ea4deb6dec7892d9ef5bdc7044a6234e> [image: Daily twitter share] <https://click.cssubs.com/?qs=94b76946b672381aef92db7820bd2726ed351ba5d964b5dcca8dd52e8ead2f18edd58b10b5fa78dcd00d1522d729f3f065448c1d4bf525b3> [image: Daily email share] <?subject=I+think+you%27ll+like+this+article+from+the+Monitor+Daily&body=Here's+the+article+on+CSMonitor.com:+%0A%0A+Illegal+border+crossing:+How+U.S.+guns+wind+up+in+Canada+and+Mexico+%0A%0A+https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812/Illegal-border-crossing-How-U.S.-guns-wind-up-in-Canada-and-Mexico?src=shared+%0A%0A+You+can+try+the+Monitor+Daily+free+for+a+week:+https://www.csmonitor.com/dailyfreetrial> 2. What Russian deal? Israel and Jordan cast wary eye toward Syria. <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?cmpid=ema:ddp:20190812&src=email#1093888> Ammar Awad/Reuters  The setting of hard lines, with consequences, is as standard in foreign policy as it is in parenting. As one analyst says, citing southern Syria, it’s also “a game of brinkmanship where you can lose control.”  – Clayton The 30 Sec. Read  Russia, the main power broker in Syria, pledged to both Israel and Jordan in 2018 that security arrangements for the south would keep Iranian forces 70 to 80 kilometers from their borders. Israel and Jordan took that pledge to include Iran’s proxies, especially Hezbollah.  But one year later evidence is solidifying that the Lebanese Shiite militant group has become increasingly entrenched in the area. Former Free Syrian Army rebels who have returned to their hometowns in southern Syria after an amnesty agreement with the Assad regime say Hezbollah is effectively “governing” several towns and villages.  Now concern is growing among Israel, Jordan, and regional analysts that an unintended and potentially “devastating” escalation may be around the corner. “Russia promised that the Iranians and militias would be driven out from southern Syria, and Russia did not deliver the goods,” says Ely Karmon, at the International Institute for Counter-Terrorism in Herzliya, Israel.  “We want the U.S. to maintain a presence in Syria, but also to provide diplomacy to give everyone an off-ramp,” says one Arab diplomat, who requested anonymity. “If the U.S. does not create that ramp, we don’t know who can.” <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?cmpid=ema:ddp:20190812&src=email#1093888> Jacob Turcotte/Staff  By *Taylor Luck* Read 6 min. <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?cmpid=ema:ddp:20190812&src=email&id=1093888>  ( 1250 words ) [image: Daily facebook share] <https://click.cssubs.com/?qs=94b76946b672381a230f5947679cc76d03f6313cc8fe9e58565facfb9cbd63bc6b91f3ea7b07f3cb516ecf15d1b00840e0a64f3f4f20bd1d> [image: Daily twitter share] <https://click.cssubs.com/?qs=94b76946b672381af6a695af038cee6a42cc3fb6e7326a3416f3f104e39a5643008eae488c7f924e38ee45d2672a40c421f04630d0a026fe> [image: Daily email share] <?subject=I+think+you%27ll+like+this+article+from+the+Monitor+Daily&body=Here's+the+article+on+CSMonitor.com:+%0A%0A+What+Russian+deal?%20Israel%20and%20Jordan%20cast%20wary%20eye%20toward%20Syria.+%0A%0A+https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812/What-Russian-deal-Israel-and-Jordan-cast-wary-eye-toward-Syria?src=shared+%0A%0A+You+can+try+the+Monitor+Daily+free+for+a+week:+https://www.csmonitor.com/dailyfreetrial> 3. Why Guatemala’s next president is already bound by Trump <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?cmpid=ema:ddp:20190812&src=email#1093946> Santiago Billy/AP  Stop migrants, or pay a price. That’s more or less the choice the U.S. administration has given Guatemala. But will it reduce migration – or just change whose problem it is?  – Clayton The 30 Sec. Read  Guatemala’s new president-elect, Alejandro Giammattei, won’t actually enter office for several months. But one day after the election, he’s already inherited a hornet’s nest from his predecessor: an unpopular migration deal with the United States.  Threatened by President Donald Trump with possible tariffs, taxes on remittances, and a travel ban, current President Jimmy Morales agreed to require asylum-seekers traveling through Guatemala to apply for asylum there, effectively cutting off requests from Salvadorans and Hondurans at the U.S. border. The U.S. administration has pressured Mexico to sign a similar agreement.  Critics argue that Guatemala, which is the No. 1 country of origin for people apprehended on the U.S. border this year, is in no position to give safety, or much opportunity. Last year, the country’s asylum system processed only 262 applications.  In the border region of Huehuetenango, a highland state that has one of Guatemala’s highest migration levels, Helen Mauricio Palacios sat on a motorbike outside the polls with her 5-year-old and her groceries, deciding whether it was worthwhile to cast her vote – whether either candidate would bring change.  “If we were a safe country, there would not be so many people migrating from here,” she says. “If people could find the success here that they’re searching for elsewhere, they wouldn’t leave.” <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?cmpid=ema:ddp:20190812&src=email#1093946> Karen Norris/Staff  By *Maya Averbuch* Read 6 min. <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?cmpid=ema:ddp:20190812&src=email&id=1093946>  ( 1267 words ) [image: Daily facebook share] <https://click.cssubs.com/?qs=94b76946b672381a9b9489529f0578155257ebe4710b6457431df260d8e4f84233c30fd11093604e3fd927adf1cf5230198ab3a278c8143d> [image: Daily twitter share] <https://click.cssubs.com/?qs=94b76946b672381a3e02dd10e84d13e462b234aec56396e52b66cd894c2243fa9ae178921d76b8d7d3e8c9f7d38d12e1ebb2c8465b29529a> [image: Daily email share] <?subject=I+think+you%27ll+like+this+article+from+the+Monitor+Daily&body=Here's+the+article+on+CSMonitor.com:+%0A%0A+Why+Guatemala’s+next+president+is+already+bound+by+Trump+%0A%0A+https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812/Why-Guatemala-s-next-president-is-already-bound-by-Trump?src=shared+%0A%0A+You+can+try+the+Monitor+Daily+free+for+a+week:+https://www.csmonitor.com/dailyfreetrial> A deeper look 4. Woodstock at 50: How it shaped a generation <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?cmpid=ema:ddp:20190812&src=email#1093947> Melanie Stetson Freeman/Staff  At a time of upheaval, one music festival defined an era with its counterculture spirit of protest, peace, and equality. Fifty years later, in the midst of similar unrest, its message, and mythology, endure.  – Clayton The 30 Sec. Read  Many Americans would dismiss the gathering as a bacchanalia in the mud – three days of drugs, nudity, subversive music, and psychedelic indulgence. But 50 years ago, Woodstock became a cultural touchstone that defined an era. A number of social protest movements of the 1960s – opposition to the Vietnam War, a push for free love and personal autonomy, a clamor for civil rights and equality – seemed to converge in that field in upstate New York.  Nowadays, the hippie is an endangered species and the idea of music as a counterculture movement doesn’t resonate with a younger generation. Yet in some ways, there are parallels between the idealism of the Woodstock generation and the so-called woke generation. Like their grandparents, the millennials and iGen display a zeal to change the world. Like their forebears, they’re willing to eschew some of the status symbol comforts they grew up with, like cars and homes.  David Crosby, a musician who performed at Woodstock, says the meaning of the festival remains with him. “Woodstock was a glimpse – a momentary glimpse – into what’s possible. Into us being able to live with each other decently and peacefully.”  By *Stephen Humphries* Read 15 min. <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?cmpid=ema:ddp:20190812&src=email&id=1093947>  ( 3370 words ) [image: Daily facebook share] <https://click.cssubs.com/?qs=94b76946b672381ae7a57477642e8939f90f05dad3db22713bdb3be84b50d9a38c4c0efebb7ddef18c03ae248cf86631d46c2aeb4f46f58f> [image: Daily twitter share] <https://click.cssubs.com/?qs=94b76946b672381a1d5241154621449bf2958b350bbb9a255488a129ece877fe1dc0705ec34b9e621072c540308fc8fd15ead4da3fcb10c5> [image: Daily email share] <?subject=I+think+you%27ll+like+this+article+from+the+Monitor+Daily&body=Here's+the+article+on+CSMonitor.com:+%0A%0A+Woodstock+at+50:+How+it+shaped+a+generation+%0A%0A+https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812/Woodstock-at-50-How-it-shaped-a-generation?src=shared+%0A%0A+You+can+try+the+Monitor+Daily+free+for+a+week:+https://www.csmonitor.com/dailyfreetrial> The Explainer 5. What is 5G, and how will it affect me? <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?cmpid=ema:ddp:20190812&src=email#1093948>  The tech industry touts its next-generation cellphone network as a giant leap in capabilities. But the industry jargon does little to explain it to consumers. We look at what “5G” really means.  – Clayton The 30 Sec. Read  The name 5G stands simply for the fifth generation of cellphone service. In practical terms, that means a superfast and much more reliable service – plus the potential for the rise of an “internet of things” where items like home appliances are increasingly web-connected.  Some analysts worry about drawbacks. Rising prices are one issue. Also, 5G carriers will have to build a much denser network of small transmitters to complement today’s cell towers. Some critics have raised concerns that exposure to so many radio waves could have health effects. The industry says no studies have uncovered any problems. The other big concern is privacy, as more data goes online and is tracked.  The positives: Download speeds will ramp up, so you could download a full movie to your phone in seconds rather than minutes. Wireless companies could begin competing with cable firms to offer home internet and TV service. Your city’s traffic grid would communicate with cars and vice versa to reduce bottlenecks and improve safety. All this won’t happen at once. By 2025, just under half of Americans will have 5G connections, according to Deloitte.  By *Laurent Belsie*  [image: twitter]@lbelsie <https://twitter.com/lbelsie?cmpid=ema:ddp:20190812&src=email> Read 3 min. <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?cmpid=ema:ddp:20190812&src=email&id=1093948>  ( 589 words ) [image: Daily facebook share] <https://click.cssubs.com/?qs=94b76946b672381ad677faddaa7f999ba6071959671d84c23e0932f7947fbb59a3779b169679721aa2642fd5bf26371124f9ad5eee4e6e21> [image: Daily twitter share] <https://click.cssubs.com/?qs=94b76946b672381a78ba4f47947e4c2fe31c1da1089f9cdc7dcae2a5b33f66a09814e650daea66be3e10b6f036ea32c29f043bdddd5ae494> [image: Daily email share] <?subject=I+think+you%27ll+like+this+article+from+the+Monitor+Daily&body=Here's+the+article+on+CSMonitor.com:+%0A%0A+What+is+5G,+and+how+will+it+affect+me?%20+%0A%0A+https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812/What-is-5G-and-how-will-it-affect-me?src=shared+%0A%0A+You+can+try+the+Monitor+Daily+free+for+a+week:+https://www.csmonitor.com/dailyfreetrial> The Monitor's View A seed for society’s safety: Gun buybacks The 30 Sec. Read  Since July 13, more than 7,000 gun owners in New Zealand have handed over their firearms to police under the country’s first program to buy back guns. “We have to do for the greater good of our society,” said one man as he handed over his AR-15 firearm.  The voluntary nature of gun buybacks gives them a special place in the worldwide debate over gun regulations.  In the United States, buybacks have been very popular since the 1990s, even though most scholars say they do not curb gun violence over time. In the U.S. presidential race, several Democratic contenders now advocate for buybacks after the recent mass shootings in Texas and Ohio.  Yet about 70% of gun owners say they could never imagine themselves not owning some sort of firearm.  Buyback programs help bring gun owners in contact with police and others in a community, fostering a dialogue about the ways to keep everyone safe.  While criminals or potential mass shooters are very unlikely to turn in their guns, their ability to find guns or their willingness to see gun use as normal can be diminished if enough owners decide society would be safer without guns.  By *the Monitor's Editorial Board* Read 3 min. <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?cmpid=ema:ddp:20190812&src=email&id=1093824>  ( 641 words ) [image: Daily facebook share] <https://click.cssubs.com/?qs=94b76946b672381a5ac7dd91812c21646547655916681ae634f143e8cd901268f3b6ba86298775ac8e32f199416d87a8ded44e2688dceb7b> [image: Daily twitter share] <https://click.cssubs.com/?qs=94b76946b672381add1892da161a6c583b558c941c8521107561a54afb30df3bee6d55a8f3c76b24ec731c1b79f16551e43fd211a096f19e> [image: Daily email share] <?subject=I+think+you%27ll+like+this+article+from+the+Monitor+Daily&body=Here's+the+article+on+CSMonitor.com:+%0A%0A+A+seed+for+society’s+safety:+Gun+buybacks+%0A%0A+https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812/A-seed-for-society-s-safety-Gun-buybacks?src=shared+%0A%0A+You+can+try+the+Monitor+Daily+free+for+a+week:+https://www.csmonitor.com/dailyfreetrial> A Christian Science Perspective ( About this feature <https://click.cssubs.com/?qs=94b76946b672381a13e5804b6c60fac2c28a618a77164ae3a983173e0590006a97ffc8f45a93b9514f5a5d370212d5f7d37638a84cd11158> ) What has infinity got to do with healing?  Understanding the concept of infinity plays a key role in the practice of Christian Science, as one man found out when he prayed for a horse in need of healing. As he turned to God for inspiration, a powerful sense of God’s goodness as infinite came to him. That changed the way he saw the horse, which was soon free of all the ailments.  By *Mark Swinney* Read 3 min. <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?cmpid=ema:ddp:20190812&src=email&id=1093825>  ( 616 words ) [image: Daily facebook share] <https://click.cssubs.com/?qs=94b76946b672381a75cfe41c6d450225808378f8bbeaf9caab553d1ec0f8ad759325b7ba2c365bff7eb534be5902b11c3780fb3bd410d56d> [image: Daily twitter share] <https://click.cssubs.com/?qs=94b76946b672381a44fbd05d23cc46ba22eb39e3ee9850a64125c2e0803adeceeb0765c5f696dc0f5a3f9d8c4dba0b9d8e0c7fa3ce9c8497> [image: Daily email share] <?subject=I+think+you%27ll+like+this+article+from+the+Monitor+Daily&body=Here's+the+article+on+CSMonitor.com:+%0A%0A+What+has+infinity+got+to+do+with+healing?%20%20+%0A%0A+https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812/What-has-infinity-got-to-do-with-healing?src=shared+%0A%0A+You+can+try+the+Monitor+Daily+free+for+a+week:+https://www.csmonitor.com/dailyfreetrial> Viewfinder History, in midair <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190812?cmpid=ema:ddp:20190812&src=email#1093826> Simone Biles competes on beam at the U.S. Gymnastics Championships Aug. 11, 2019, in Kansas City, Missouri. She became the first gymnast to land a double-double dismount on the beam and a triple double (three twists and two flips) on the floor exercise in competition on her way to her sixth national championship. The last (and only other woman) to be a six-time national champ was Clara Schroth Lomady in 1952. Charlie Riedel/AP ( The illustrations in today's Monitor Daily are by Karen Norris. ) A LOOK AHEAD  Come back tomorrow. Harry Bruinius is working on a portrait of a youthful bloc of voters in Queens – one with a distinctive take on how democratic socialism could look at the local level. column2: BIG Thank you!!
column3: Greetings, jsh online editorial team—  fellow spiritual adventurers &spiritual  activists!  Here’s a long overdue thank-you to all jshonline editors and team members for the beautiful  new website formats and design  concepts that highlight the timely curated focus features  each week .   I look forward to these articles (online and in print)  as well as  the Sentinel Watch programs, which are all stepping up to bring  fresh perspectives, fresh inclusive language ,  to meet global humanity’s needs and in people’s lives today, as reflected in news (and hey, the Monitor ’s recent re-do is wonderful, too!!!)  I particularly like today’s (Aug. 16) "Daily Lift"— the video on “You are the reflection  of God”  —  a big WOW for me .. because  it came as answer this morning as to how to share a video message about CS  (yes, SS videos are great, too)  with my grandsons in another state  who only occasionally attend   a CS Sunday School.And who are starting back to  (regular) school now.      This Daily Lift video format  is so easily shareable  for so-called non-readers or those who feel too busy  to take in much printed or even oral information… (Let’s see more of these video Daily Lifts, Marla Sammuli ? Amy Richmond? Thanks!!!)    I also find that the Sentinel articles, themes, (because of the caring editorial oversight  for providing spiritual meaning and depth  in contemporary, easy-to-read- and- understand terminology,   insights from authors’  personal stories-- in a friend-to-friend conversational way , and references to timely  books, news stories, etc.).  are  more easy for me to share, offer with those who may be new to or unfamiliar with CS.   I was grateful to see the editorial, “Prayer as activism” by guest editorial writer Mimi Oka, on July 8.  I thought.. YAY At last we  are acknowledging that prayer is truly the basis for citizen/community activism . Prayer  fuels all right action…to bless all mankind.   The article shows that  Jesus and Mrs. Eddy were “spiritual activists,” and we can be, too.  Thanks!  (And maybe jshonline Sentinel editors will consider curating some future focus articles that feature “Spiritual activism”  — there have been quite a few actually, and it is a fun exploration!)   I especially want to send huge thanks to Tony Lobl and Rita Polatin, for the more informal,  (spontaneous—“ live") conversations on Sentinel Watch programs. These podcasts are getting better all the time in speaking  the language of everyday folks about their concerns and sharing the practicality of CS  approach to such issues.  I shared the  interview( with Bill Moody on democracy, government )with a neighbor who is totally opposite and sometimes aggressive in her political views and choice of news sources,  but who is increasingly interested in CS Monitor articles I’ve shared, and who loved the Sentinel Watch interview, saying. “I wish everyone thought this way.”)   And, another shout-out --of YAY,  hallelujah!  thanks—  to new Associate Editor Larissa Snorek for your recent Sentinel editorials, but especially   “The healing touch of humor.”(Aug. 12) and one I just read yesterday, coming out Aug. 26 issue, “Out of darkness into light.” Nothing connects with me faster than music and humor to cut through the fog of animal magnetism.   And humor is something that is SO needed today  lighten , enlighten, and lift “tired”  humanity  out of the plodding sense of burdensome beliefs, the “mantle” of “seriousness” instead of the "garment of praise" and “songs of everlasting joy.”…  joy with each one of us. Everywhere. Always.   Also, hey Larissa…  you delivered your lecture, “The Healing Power of Stillness” in our Washington DC metro  area over last couple of years, and I gotta say,  you are right-on in selecting this topic. I note that in your online intro to upcoming CSJournal (Sept. 2019) you also  mentions the idea of stillness . Thought you’d like to know , since  I work as writer with our DC CSMedia Committee...  (we are working on new digital marketing to support  CS lectures in the area —for  some 22 churches — and also in progress now of designing new website), Lari, YOUR TOPIC of “stillness” received the most clicks  from responsive truth-seekers (everyday searchers on Google Adwords topics)  which took them to ur  CSDC website ,  in the online digital campaign we  did last spring.   So, bravo! The topic  of “mindfulness,” finding peace, stillness, is a BIG draw these days!!  And what a treasured Resource we have to share!  **(I did not write this letter to share for publication, but if any nuggets from this may help other readers  ,  ok, I guess feel free to edit/use.)   Peace, joy and good stuff to you all,  Clare Grosgerbauer Fairfax, VA claregros@erols.com

column2: Share your comments with the Journal Editors [#2550]
column3: Title * Christian Science lectures: Breaking collective hypnotism Author from the Christian Science Board of Lectureship Web Address (URL) of page https:/journal.christianscience.com/issues/2019/8/137-08/christian-science-lectures-breaking-collective-hypnotism Name *    Karin Bäckström Email Address *   karin.backstrom.choir@gmail.com Share your Comments: *  After reading this article many times I would like to express my gratitude for this insights. The wakening up from all kinds of hypnotic beliefs about CS movement as a whole is certainly an eye-opener. God will continually help us disguise all kinds of thoughts that belongs to the induce-department. This means that God has not gone "out of fashion" for modern man.  C S is not difficult and intellectual, in fact it's only natural and reveals what's really going on beneath the surface of mortal existence. Something I recognize as an ongoing process in todays society is the longing for sustainability. We know that sustainability never can be found by material eyeglasses and that true sustainability lies in discovering the spiritual reality which are independent of so called material laws. Thank You again for this article that already now inspires me to see through mortal minds subtle attempts to induce me in my life.    Comment Publication *  I give permission to publish my comment. column2: Fwd: Princeton CSRR Graphics Design need
column3: Hello, I am writing in regards to a request I got (below) to create marketing materials for the Princeton Reading Room. As a class taught Christian Scientist and member of the Mother Church, I want to be absolute sure that I am following all rules and permissions in regards to marketing materials.  Can you tell me if I can create marketing materials using the Daily Lift logo and the Sentinel Watch logo? If so, do you have a high res logo you can send me? If not, do you have a template of marketing materials for these products that this Reading Room can use?  Thanks so much! Amanda     Begin forwarded message:  > From: Reading Room <readingroom@csprinceton.org> > Date: August 14, 2019 at 6:27:21 PM EDT > To: amandacaswell@gmail.com > Subject: Princeton CSRR Graphics Design need >  > Hello Amanda, > So sorry for the delay in getting back to you.  We've had a few issues to address here...but ready to move forward now. >  > Our need is for two different designs, each to be printed on 4"X5.5" card stock.  These fit into a "take one" box mounted on a window glass outside the RR front door. >  > 1) DAILY LIFT CARD:  This card should include the Daily Lift logo/icon design found on the Daily Lift website: http://www.yourdailylift.com, or www.christianscience.com/dailylift. > Here is some copy that can be placed according to your inspiration: >    > "your Daily Lift.  Bite-size inspiration.  5 days/week.  2-min podcast.  listen at christianscience.com/dailylift.  Or by phone:  617-450-3430.  Free online!" >  > Here's a sample of a recent card, which doesn't show a web address or telephone number. > We like the the old logo, but feel it's right to use our current one.  I like the peaceful background to the Daily Lift logo shown on jsh-online.com at the bottom of the page.   >  > 2) SENTINEL WATCH:  As we discussed, this can be a template to which we can add the dates & topics each month. column2: Editorial comments and corrections
column3: The following information was collected:  Name: Jason Sell  Email: jdsell@hotmail.com  Subscriber: No  Subject: A Christian Science Perspective  Product: csmonitor.com  Message: Hi, I was just curious why A Christian Science Perspective, which I guess is nested under Commentary, on this web site, doesn't show up on the left side top menu bar, at all. It only seems to appear at the very bottom of the page menu. Just curious. Also, when you do click on that link at that bottom, it goes to a home page that is purely only black and white (until you scroll down further on the screen and one Photo of the Week can be seen. It doesn't look at 'updated' or 'fresh' as some of the other Monitor pages, even though there is a new article posted daily. Don't want to sell the Christian Science part of The Christian Science Monitor short, in presentation, when it's impressive the work that must go to feature a new article every day. Just thoughts -- I got on the site to share Stephen Humphries Woodstock article on social media, since I regularly view the Weekly edition, and saw it there today. Thanks :-)

Thank you Margaret   ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Editor, CSMonitor <editor@csmonitor.com> Date: Sun, Aug 18, 2019 at 1:11 PM Subject: We're dedicated improving the world by uncovering progress. To: <pbabcock46@gmail.com>   Subscribe to see how Monitor journalism shines a light on the good that's happening thanks to thinkers and doers like you. How can you see the good in the world without ignoring global challenges?  The Christian Science Monitor serves people like you, those dedicated to improving the world by uncovering the good in it.  Former Monitor editor Kay Fanning once said it's possible because “We do believe that there is good everywhere, and we’re dedicated to improving the world by uncovering that good.”  Uncovering the good leads to progress. You can get journalism that uncovers the good every day with a subscription to the Monitor. column2: Reading Room received mail from "Christ for All Peoples"
column3: Email Address: lindamgreen927@gmail.com Subject: Reading Room received mail from "Christ for All Peoples" Message: I got a call from our Reading Room librarian about package received today from "Christ for All Peoples" including DVD of 3 Jesus movies, some information about a few books, including, "Mrs. Eddy, the biography of a Virginal Mind" by Dakin.   The information said they were sending out millions of copies.   I suspect this material is derogatory toward Christian Science and thought you should know about it, as many Christian Science churches may be receiving this material.    Category: General question Name: Linda Green

column2: hymn download problem
column3: Hi! I purchased the "Embraced" CD a few weeks ago, and I am just now sitting down at my computer to download the files. However, it appears that I had already used up the 10 allowable downloads on 3 of the hymns. I think it might be showing this way because I had tried to stream them on my phone (since I had not yet had the opportunity to download them on my computer). Is there a way I can be allowed one more download so I can truly download them on my computer? Or do I need to repurchase those three individual hymns? My order # is 5500028540. See below for a screenshot of the download page. Thank you for your help! -Eliza [image: Screen Shot 2019-08-18 at 9.01.59 PM.png]  Eliza Stewart 314.691.8663

column2: Re: Bible Lens online: Deepen your study of the weekly Bible Lesson
column3: Good morning,  Would it be possible to put a hyperlink to the BIBLE LENS on JSH  along with other featured links?  Thank you for giving this thought!  Joan Bradley  > On Aug 12, 2019, at 4:00 AM, JSH-Online: Tip of the Week <weeklyupdate@jsh-online.com> wrote: >  >  >  > This week's tip:  > Read the Christian Science Sentinel’s Bible Lens on JSH-Online. >    > August 12, 2019 > Want to enhance your study of the weekly Bible Lesson from the Christian Science Quarterly? Then the Bible Lens is just for you. It provides a helpful mix of information about Bible verses—history, context, and verse translations—and enlightening word studies, all designed to help you understand the Bible better. > The Bible Lens appears in the printed Sentinel as a section you can remove and keep wherever you study the Bible Lesson. You can also access the current week’s Bible Lens via the block on the Sentinel homepage or find it in the table of contents of the latest issue of the Christian Science Sentinel. column2: Per Capita tax forms
column3: Dear Clerk,     Since we have moved  and have a new address, we have not received our per capita tax forms.  Would it be possible to email the forms to us, as the postal system here is unreliable?       To confirm, our new address, which I sent to you is:   5 Daedalus Reef Road, Seaside Longships, Plettenberg Bay, Western Cape, South Africa.  It could be that they have been sent and have not yet arrived.        Many thanks, and best wishes     Glenda Gage and Bryce Gage

column2: Brockton Native Trains to be a U.S. Navy Future Warfighter
column3:
Hello, we at the Navy Office of Community Outreach travel the globe to collect Sailors’ stories and distribute them to their hometown media. These articles are great for running as news items or simply creating a social media post that increases engagement with your communities.  

_____________

Brockton Native Trains to be a U.S. Navy Future Warfighter

For Full Story: http://navyoutreach.blogspot.com/2019/08/brockton-native-trains-to-be-us-navy.html

GREAT LAKES, Ill. – Sailors are some of the most highly-trained people on the planet, according to Navy officials, and this requires highly-dedicated training.

At Naval Education and Training command, instructors at advanced technical schools teach sailors to be highly skilled, operational, and combat ready warfighters, while providing the tools and opportunities for continuous learning and development. 

Seaman Apprentice Dave Dupie, a native of Brockton, Massachusetts, is a student at NETC, learning the necessary skills needed to be a culinary specialist.


______________

****PLEASE let us know if you run a story or photo, share a post so that we may make the sailors families aware****

INTERVIEW INFORMATION: While not always possible, if you desire an interview, please let us know and we will work diligently in order to provide you with interview opportunity.  
______________

Thank you for supporting the men and women who serve in the Navy our nation needs.

Join the conversation with our social media:

Facebook.com/NavyOutreach

Twitter: @NavyOutreach

Instagram: @US_Navy_Outreach

 

Very respectfully,

MCC (SW) Jeffery Tilghman Williams

Navy Office of Community Outreach
Media Outreach Department
Millington, Tenn.
www.outreach.navy.mil

column2: The American Workplace Still Won’t Accommodate Pregnant Workers. Plus: Paid Family Leave Is a Game-Changer for New Parents’ Health.

A new mother herself, Covert is available for select remote interviews. column2: NEW Poll: Millennials Lead CBD Use, But the General Public is STILL Confused on What It Actually Is – Experts Available
column3: Hi Stephanie?,  According to a new poll on CBD use (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQBx8-2FbEVQek3HfcoUcv6EnbsgElKoyAPwuPgHtXsDjcUw7i6EId8fF-2FnN3pM4kUG2mkc1Y2NTH9qmSJe4vguSriA-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs2BiozNoJJNl2ubOInicE35KntxpGKrwqGYsM7rt2-2BPOeb4fMa4oCBw7ynXpPwy2HFy0F0arhiunGhFNy8gzaxrW9THyOfB6hxFfelwyICHZEPBqwZWTcSPoC9jieGS3qwVBqmlAcaL1V1-2By8Wx-2FDdRFG7JN4SAKUdXt7YhdTkLWtiZwk5KGwTarGAUEjP2TJeoIZAHkVL2eYg-2BDZNSjdzZvz7kEqmUQpKFOIPIyQ-2FMDxow2mDgmcCwLKPHaKHvudo-3D , about 1 in 7 American adults use CBD products, with the highest percentage of usage coming from the 18-29 age group.  However, the poll also found that about 35% of those surveyed say they are still unfamiliar and uneducated concerning CBD products.  This information proves that CBD is booming, especially among millennials, however it also shows that a big chunk of adults are unfamiliar with exactly what it is and what it can help with. Which leads to the pressing question: With the explosion of CBD, why are so many people still uneducated?  If interested for a “CBD 101” story and where we currently stand with legislation and FDA progress, I represent CANNOVIA (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=84Em28S1K9SvtzcUtu04EhO2mmcknxIlloRBICyG-2F5s-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs2BiozNoJJNl2ubOInicE35KntxpGKrwqGYsM7rt2-2BPOeb4fMa4oCBw7ynXpPwy2HFy0F0arhiunGhFNy8gzaxrW9THyOfB6hxFfelwyICHZKx0hbeKxdL6egahKF4RgnGj-2BV1KKnyZYwWTe9siOM4Cbwv-2F9PaPi2yP6TSXAXYz-2BeGYM-2FcxfXKV0yeGu9Xsn48000oape4l-2Fp2MZJ54sdL9QqHD6RUG-2B2Bk97JXyjIgsnSmjmk7eY7S24mTzHKWwsc-3D – a CBD industry leader and can offer the CEO, Brian Baum, along with medical expert, Dr. Pat Hezmall who can comment on the below:  · New poll results: is it surprising millennials are leading the CBD consumption craze? · Why is there so much confusion and misinformation in the CBD industry? Does it have to do with lack of FDA regulation and enforcement? · What is legal and illegal when it comes to CBD? · The importance of quality product and how consumers can ensure they are getting their money’s worth · Potential benefits: what are the potential medical benefits that consumers are seeing with CBD? · More  Please let me know if you’d be interested in covering this new poll or any of the above story bullet ideas.  Thanks!  Tori  About Brian Baum, Cannovia CEO  Brian works across all areas of Cannovia on corporate strategy and development. He leads the business of Cannovia, manages business relationships/partnerships and coordinates the team efforts to capitalize on the CBD opportunity.  Brian brings a background in healthcare, most recently the founder/CEO of vitaTrackr. In prior work as the President of Stayhealthy, President of US Preventive Medicine, founder/CEO of the Health Record Network in collaboration with Duke University and Medical Center and Chief Marketing Officer of Ernst & Young’s Health practice, Brian has always enjoyed working with people to create value.  Howard Patterson Hezmall, MD  Dr. Hezmall completed his urology residency at the University of Texas Health Science Center in Houston and also served the National Health Service Corps as a Lt. Junior Assistant Surgeon. After three years, he felt it was time to start his own practice in Arlington, Texas. In partnership with Dr. John House, Dr. Hezmall founded Urology Associates of North Texas (UANT) which grew to be one of the largest urologic practices in the country.  Additionally, Dr. Hezmall was a founding member of USMD Inc., a physician-led, integrated health system committed to exemplary patient care. He has always been interested in organized medicine and has served on various committees in the Tarrant County Medical Association (Texas) including past secretary/treasurer, Vice-President, President-elect and is a delegate to the Texas Medical Association. He has been active in the Texas Medical Association since his residency serving as a delegate, committee member and council member.  With 27 years of experience in clinical practice and broad business and management, Dr. Hezmall offers a distinct skill set to Cannovia LLC.  Tori Sichta  5W Public Relations  Account Supervisor  646-632-4571  tsichta@5WPR.com (mailto:tsichta@5WPR.com)    ______________________  If you would rather not receive future communications from 5W PUBLIC RELATIONS, please go to https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=NBhTsVIXpTHrhf0NvhZzDd-2BIuOQfkp6rENL5eiggmwgjfXorV-2Bb730JV2hl5MB8DXkiybrA0Ttl8FPJi1USeQN-2F-2Bux8xfYPFi98mghOaj2NJv5kOY1XBEH5i6IBNVmvc1NSVWZ2-2F-2F6Oa4rpLZasvEAnEm0-2BrOOV51Phhyx4o-2Fl4-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs2BiozNoJJNl2ubOInicE35KntxpGKrwqGYsM7rt2-2BPOeb4fMa4oCBw7ynXpPwy2HFy0F0arhiunGhFNy8gzaxrW9THyOfB6hxFfelwyICHZBz0uaBPJvXwe-2FLt-2FmWxMza-2FIeJse10QRO5ytnqCgGgeXb9xw7To9SQ7TFownfAKqwcxqQ81-2Bkenauxq1zpR3QbGMxZfYHysBUrn0t6vY4UNlkubvlT-2Bgg8du-2FNKT6wOgu2mUYvrvh3ZnzOLr5dTTyw-3D  5W PUBLIC RELATIONS, 230 PARK AVENUE, 32ND FLOOR, New York, NY 10169 United States  --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to customerservice+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: White Privilege, by Shannon Sullivan  -   (REVIEW COPY? INTERVIEW REQUESTS?)
column3: Publishing November 3, 2019   ** ------------------------------------------------------------  Some embrace the idea of white privilege as an important concept that helps us to make sense of the connection between race and social and political disadvantages, while others are critical or even hostile. Regardless of personal views, it can be difficult to agree on what 'white privilege' even means.  Philosopher Shannon Sullivan cuts through the confusion and cross-talk to challenge what ‘everybody knows’ about white privilege. Using real-life examples, she offers a candid assessment of the advantages and disadvantages of the term, to present a better understanding of how race functions in our societies. She argues that white privilege is about more than race, that not only white people can have white privilege,and that feeling guilty about privilege can have a negative effect on the very people you feel guilty towards. In the end, she offers practical solutions for eliminating white privilege and building a fairer society.  Sullivan's forcefully argued book will inspire you to think again about white privilege and what it entails.  The Author:  Shannon Sullivan is Professor of Philosophy at the University of North Carolina, Charlotte. column2: Your account was under attack! Change your credentials!
column3: Hello!  I am a hacker who has access to your operating system. I also have full access to your account.  I've been watching you for a few months now. The fact is that you were infected with malware through an adult site that you visited.  If you are not familiar with this, I will explain. Trojan Virus gives me full access and control over a computer or other device. This means that I can see everything on your screen, turn on the camera and microphone, but you do not know about it.  I also have access to all your contacts and all your correspondence.  Why your antivirus did not detect malware? Answer: My malware uses the driver, I update its signatures every 4 hours so that your antivirus is silent.  I made a video showing how you satisfy yourself in the left half of the screen, and in the right half you see the video that you watched. With one click of the mouse, I can send this video to all your emails and contacts on social networks. I can also post access to all your e-mail correspondence and messengers that you use.  If you want to prevent this, transfer the amount of $500 to my bitcoin address (if you do not know how to do this, write to Google: "Buy Bitcoin").  My bitcoin address (BTC Wallet) is:  3GqNx1o9trJ89Qwn8mSn1nZVnV42b1Lzib  After receiving the payment, I will delete the video and you will never hear me again. I give you 50 hours (more than 2 days) to pay. I have a notice reading this letter, and the timer will work when you see this letter.  Filing a complaint somewhere does not make sense because this email cannot be tracked like my bitcoin address. I do not make any mistakes.  If I find that you have shared this message with someone else, the video will be immediately distributed.  Best regards!  --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to daily+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: Request For The Guest Post
column3: Hello Csmonitor Team,   My name is Prakash and I am into recruitment and I’d love to share some of my opinions and thoughts with the readers of Csmonitor which cover the same topics I am very keen in writing about.  I'm interested in contributing content to your blog. The articles which I will be providing will be 100% unique and Copy Scape Protected (Which will increase credibility of your blog). The article will be related to your niche and will be appreciated by your readers.  I look forward to hearing back from you, would be pleasure working together and contributing valuable content.   Kind Regards,   --        *Prakash Sharma* Recruiter at, Alliance International  www.allianceinternational.co.in/ | Call: +918980018741 <https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/#SignatureSanitizer_> <https://www.facebook.com/Alliancerecruitmentagency/>  <https://www.linkedin.com/company/alliance-international-consulting-firm/>  <https://twitter.com/career_alliance>  --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to customerservice+unsubscribe@csps.com.

For two days only, The Pilgrim's Progress movie will be shown to viewers around the world for FREE!  If you missed John Bunyan's epic masterpiece come to life in theaters, or would like to see it again, this is your opportunity! Register today to watch The Pilgrim's Progress online August 25th and 26th only.  One of the best-selling books in history is as important today as when it was written over 300 years ago. Now it's presented for a new generation in a feature-length animated movie! The Pilgrim's Progress can give our kids and grandkids the strength to walk on the King's road, in a culture that often stands against them!  Register now for the online Christian movie event of the year!  REGISTER FOR THE PILGRIM'S PROGRESS ONLINE EVENT  Watch the Official Pilgrim's Progress Trailer  REGISTER FOR THE PILGRIM'S PROGRESS ONLINE EVENT  Copyright © 2019  Dove.org 2555 Northwinds Parkway, Alpharetta GA 30009   View web version  You’re receiving this email because you’ve signed up to receive updates from Dove. Thank you! To unsubscribeUnsubscribe Link

Top up fast from only R2.65/GB.     [http://webafrica.fstracker.io/email/track/click?hash=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7Im11c3RoIjoiaHR0cDovLyMiLCJsaW9uIjoiN2U0ZiIsImdvcmlsbGEiOiI3YWU5MDQ4NyIsImRlZXIiOiI4NTU2MjcyMiJ9LCJpYXQiOjE1NjU4NDcyODJ9.Pska_l1ERMSCjJApwskQI3zzMWtLXrvYRkYU0eIyJbc~eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImhvcnNlIjoiY2xlcmtAY2hyaXN0aWFuc2NpZW5jZS5jb20iLCJjYW1lbCI6IjgzZjQ2ZDk0In0sImlhdCI6MTU2NTg0NzI4M30.OV7PELGZRGsAbnTaQeDaNC_Az3FTL1p461oIW61VYcI]      FREE-TO-USE ROUTER   All of our Telkom LTE packages come with a premium free-to-use router.                 DELIVERED TO YOU IN 3-5 DAYS   We aim to have you up and running within 3-5 business days of placing your order.          LTE MOVES WHEN YOU DO   Telkom's LTE network reach is wide. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  A Message from CMM's Executive Director, Rev. Dr. Rodney L. Petersen ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  Religion and Citizenship Among the challenges for nation-states in the twenty-first century is the degree  of allegiance citizens give to local, national, and international participation. Summertime politics have revolved around the implications of these interlaced spheres of allegiance and identities called into question. In its own way CMM's Interfaith Youth Initiative (IFYI) serves to help youth navigate these relationships. The concept and practice of citizenship emerged out of what it meant to be part  of a tribe, to be a "subject," or even a "national." The aftermath of the American and French Revolutions in the eighteenth century saw the emergence of civil citizenship.The idea of political citizenship can be seen to have arisen in the nineteenth century, that of social citizenship in the twentieth century. Following this sense of evolution from narrowly defined loyalty to greater civic tolerance, the idea of an emergent global citizenship with religious rights and responsibilities has arisen as a growing social reality. Programs that alert us to voter and other rights grow out of these political realities. Sociologist Elise Boulding connects the evolution of political consciousness with the principles that led to the emergence of the United Nations. She argues that  a new model of citizenship that is multicultural - involving respect for all groups within the state - multinational and multidimensional is on our political horizon: a threefold citizenship to local community, the nation-state, and global agreements. In this context, religious citizenship is a dimension of citizenship at each level. Rather than regressive in its commitments, religion offers deep meaning, the energy for moral vision and a means to reconciliation and peace that is increasingly recognized. The idea of faith connected with social justice is central to CMM's vision of social engagement.  Interfaith Youth Initiative (IFYI) 2019 Slideshow [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001L69_DcJLlMA1vY5Vqv4CdGYVxn-truGTm49nUGcyuu2XbqAv2Td0vh_9EDvEzDb4hp3kz7_Ru8QbBhSayYl-GIh5hYGhk2hGOi40wZZ8HI5to9pHXJkPwyf8XtUcKpecVEtEDdWP4qv6TICAJ3S6m10ED50kdrGdEPtHtCVJeSZJxsTfHDmlSg==&c=7peiuDi1j8Xf92pMfHpfG-MOCw9xSJP5wyINNOKIup85Kcx3WgdubQ==&ch=koM39g182vHVtiIRvzJjSxIydvfnEr-Ys_TXp1_1Gf2ZlBRZXqrB7g==]  Interfaith Youth Initiative (IFYI) 2019 Slideshow ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  Upcoming CMM-sponsored Events ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  2019 Al Filipov Peace & Justice Forum Sunday, September 15, 2019, 4 - 6pm Al Filipov Peace & Justice Forum 54 Walden St. Concord, MA 01742 Facebook event [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001L69_DcJLlMA1vY5Vqv4CdGYVxn-truGTm49nUGcyuu2XbqAv2Td0vh_9EDvEzDb4VStSb8BuRR8tHvkmU-lEoH8iNE0iiO93_AlzbbZtHxUPVoaL2_HXgsiGq7J5GBG2OPwWdYZ6znC8mB1zChSmrenTNnhIaGqqzpa6oK2tFxXkPKlDAyRfTuVDci-tJY1szdviuujkdzL7IXdmI5XcKQ==&c=7peiuDi1j8Xf92pMfHpfG-MOCw9xSJP5wyINNOKIup85Kcx3WgdubQ==&ch=koM39g182vHVtiIRvzJjSxIydvfnEr-Ys_TXp1_1Gf2ZlBRZXqrB7g==] Mark your calendars! The 2019 Al Filipov Peace & Justice Forum will be held Sun,  Sept. 15 4pm. Lois Gibbs will be honored for her tireless efforts and leadership in environmental justice beginning with Love Canal Disaster in 1978. Join us for  a discussion with Lois and representatives from youth organization, Zero Hour,  about environmental and climate justice. Event will be held at Trinitarian Congregational Church in Concord. Please share! The theme draws attention to the importance of combatting climate change as a way to protect and promote peace throughout the world. Join CMM, Friends Meeting at Cambridge, Bethel Lowell Church, along with other partners, on the Boston Common in a day of music (starting at 1:45pm), dance, song, poetry, artwork, facepainting & activities for children, and peace  education, followed by a walk to the Garden of Peace. Proclamations from Mayor Walsh's office and Governor Baker's office to be read. Speakers include Rev. Vernon Walker, Dawn Duncan, Kevin Peterson of the New Democracy Coalition, with many others to  be announced. Music includes Building Bridges Through Music, Rob Bethel, David Doms, Kaeza Fearn, Toussaint Liberator with many others to be announced. Presented by The New Story Group of Friends Meeting at Cambridge and Cooperative Metropolitan Ministries (CMM) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  Upcoming Interfaith Community Events ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  MA-Boston-August Recess Rally Sunday, August 18, 2019, 3pm Boston City Hall Plaza 1 City Hall Sq Boston, MA 02201 Every day, 100 Americans are shot and killed and hundreds more are wounded. The  impact of gun violence goes beyond mass shootings; in recent weeks gun violence  has devastated communities across the country including Baltimore, Chicago, Gilroy, Canoga Park, Brooklyn, El Paso, Dayton and many more. It is past time for Senators to listen to Americans, and pass laws requiring background checks on every gun sale and strong federal Red Flags legislation. Join MA Moms Demand Action Members and  community partners for a rally thanking our MA Senators for all their support and urge the Senate bring these bills to a vote. Cooling the Climate Mess: Soil, Water, and the Power of Nature Monday, August 26, 2019, 6:30 - 8:30pm Cambridge Public Library 449 Broadway, Cambridge, MA 02138 Facebook event [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001L69_DcJLlMA1vY5Vqv4CdGYVxn-truGTm49nUGcyuu2XbqAv2Td0vh_9EDvEzDb4OzOf7wS8MB5cmMBMU_rWhRyeSAYz75ZthmAKr-YLokt5-xHrqv_OfsCnWKTrLXC53KpKL8oy6q6PrPXLCbMDMxwZ7gCcCQbTLvbLoXbAmA0VuyfxCFfoFbpZQuvQkyUs3-nq8D5vYrkb9lOtNGrkrQ==&c=7peiuDi1j8Xf92pMfHpfG-MOCw9xSJP5wyINNOKIup85Kcx3WgdubQ==&ch=koM39g182vHVtiIRvzJjSxIydvfnEr-Ys_TXp1_1Gf2ZlBRZXqrB7g==] Walter Jehne is an internationally known Australian soil microbiologist and climate scientist. He is passionate about educating farmers, policymakers and others about "the soil carbon sponge" and its crucial role in reversing and mitigating flooding, drought, wildfires, and searing global temperatures. He shows us how we can safely cool the climate and restore essential biodiversity by repairing our disrupted hydrological cycles. We thus return excess carbon to the soils, where it can build a sponge that soaks up water and revives the biosphere! Join us on Monday, August 26 from 6:30pm to 8:30pm at the Cambridge Public Library, 449 Broadway, Cambridge MA. Biodiversity for a Livable Climate is a small non-profit so a $10 donation is requested. Students have free admission. Hearing on Gun Violence Prevention Legislation Wednesday, August 28, 2019, 11:30am MA State House Room 222 to meet before going to the hearing in Room A-2 RSVP here [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001L69_DcJLlMA1vY5Vqv4CdGYVxn-truGTm49nUGcyuu2XbqAv2Td0vh_9EDvEzDb4KGYBaGrHNrHNzT6UQ7BnCJpLVwbU1Ksh-IGuFS8kZgeSbcSVzrmW4RyRdGcIefu3ZzW1UFHZ43QnLSxQMqvJNR0ogakUgR5IDO_DoZi3-_fKIynwIJs32qTJ2jdllTUiJXWIGZ6TrW86Pl7a_D27j5ASScHG7IN79f3JVEmqcRUfurYAd2hXlNl8q5m7jO1EoLNczXjgtl_Vw4AM56GIbqzRi2lXWfhh&c=7peiuDi1j8Xf92pMfHpfG-MOCw9xSJP5wyINNOKIup85Kcx3WgdubQ==&ch=koM39g182vHVtiIRvzJjSxIydvfnEr-Ys_TXp1_1Gf2ZlBRZXqrB7g==] Join the MA Coalition to Prevent Gun Violence at a public legislative hearing to  support our top legislative priority, S.1388/H.2045, An Act Relative to Crime Gun Data Reporting and Analysis [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001L69_DcJLlMA1vY5Vqv4CdGYVxn-truGTm49nUGcyuu2XbqAv2Td0vh_9EDvEzDb4cklOWKWiscV2FcrCIoruhaQHMp3eYUa-lheR-IhLYnsu3IErLJjvQe1TRRD1ORH0EPVNm_qr39fMdFTYa1rwIAVDMmugjt9dztrVknhs5SDhtseTFcwWf2P9k2eiKEJyd60TN7Ul3zM=&c=7peiuDi1j8Xf92pMfHpfG-MOCw9xSJP5wyINNOKIup85Kcx3WgdubQ==&ch=koM39g182vHVtiIRvzJjSxIydvfnEr-Ys_TXp1_1Gf2ZlBRZXqrB7g==]. Be sure to wear your Coalition shirt to turn the hearing room orange! MAY WE FOREVER STAND": MASSACHUSETTS COMMEMORATES 400 YEARS OF BLACK RESILIENCY The year 2019 marks 400 years since the first enslaved Africans set foot in Jamestown, Virginia. Since then, Black communities have demonstrated remarkable resiliency  in the face of cruelty, terror, and systematic oppression. African Americans have not only created pathways to survive but, in many instances, to thrive. Through  it all, the Black Church has endured as a beacon of hope and testimony to resurrection. On September 20, 2019, people of faith will gather to honor ancestors, commemorate 400 years of resiliency, and pray for an end to systemic and racial injustice. BECOME A SPONSOR AND LEARN MORE INFO [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001L69_DcJLlMA1vY5Vqv4CdGYVxn-truGTm49nUGcyuu2XbqAv2Td0vl24z0qU5BWQQPd8FRErh6kMnEAh5ULIxHmKzvpulZn0TlI5CmOCA1kkcv3EkaC_4BzSxzl28ELTxxlIEWAectxPr1C-Ty1d43yZkqwIrlWmmzrKSq10M5k0EOLuw5LJC9OlCdqfv4y_-soJnmCjntw=&c=7peiuDi1j8Xf92pMfHpfG-MOCw9xSJP5wyINNOKIup85Kcx3WgdubQ==&ch=koM39g182vHVtiIRvzJjSxIydvfnEr-Ys_TXp1_1Gf2ZlBRZXqrB7g==] Preaching Black Resiliency: A Master Class with Rev. Dr. Leslie Callahan Friday September 20, 2019, 12pm People's Baptist Church 134 Camden Street, Boston, MA 02118 Preachers are invited to attend this homiletic master class on preaching black resiliency. Rev. Dr. Leslie Callahan serves at the first female pastor of St. Paul's Baptist  Church in Philadelphia, with degrees from Harvard, Union Theological Seminary and Princeton University. Space is limited. Lunch will be served and tickets required. "May We Forever Stand": Worship with Bishop Claude Alexander preaching Friday September 20, 2019, 7:30pm Greater Framingham Community Church 44 Franklin St, Framingham, MA 01702 All are invited to attend this ecumenical worship service for the praise of God  and the celebration of the Black Church. Bishop Claude Alexander has served as the Senior Pastor of The Park Church in Charlotte, North Carolina for the past 27 years, with degrees from Morehouse College, Pittsburgh Theological Seminary and Gordon  Conwell Theological School. Cuba Delegación 2019: Healing Our Land, Healing Ourselves December 11 - 20, 2019 Witness for Peace New England - H.E.R.O (Healing, Empathy, Redemption, Oasis): On this delegation, social workers, educators and first-responders--those who experience and hold trauma--will exchange with Cuban organizers, healers and nature lovers  to learn about and share strategies for healing, community organizing, environmental justice and nurturing. We will connect peace-makers, healers and community leaders from the United States and Cuba, focusing on the effects of the US blockade and  related policies as the primary deterrents to peace on the island. A clear focus  of this delegation is to explore the factors, such as capitalism, imperialism and environmental racism, that inhibit peace and justice across the Americas, and create communities of well-being and nurturing that enable economic and food justice for our movements in the US and our allies in Cuba.  * visit a homeopathic pharmacy / create and apply herbal remedies * exchange with an energy healer and medical practitioner * learn about long-term climate adaptation and resiliency plans * confront the realities of US intervention abroad at a historical memory museum * tour multiple urban and rural agro-ecological projects * understand the impacts of US policy and imperialism on the Cuban economy * interface with youth permaculture organizers and promoters * meet Afro-Cuban popular educators and share cultural organizing strategies * bask in numerous ecological reserves and protected landscapes * work a day on a sustainable family farm * explore a UNESCO-designated castle-museum dedicated to slavery and its legacy * delve into an eco-community focused on reforestation, vegetarianism and natural products * go to Varadero beach and nearby botanical gardens * see a community youth arts project and talk with students PRICE: $2,250 Applications & $250 deposit due: September 15, 2019. Remainder of  balance due: November 11, 2019. *Price includes: All lodging, meals, interpretation and transportation within Cuba. You will also receive extensive reading material  and advocacy tools. *Price doesn't include: passport costs, international airfare, and personal incidentals. *Fundraising assistance and scholarships may be available.. For more information or to request an application please contact: Judith Foster  (judithfoster@ymail.com [mailto:judithfoster@ymail.com]; 754-422-3672) and Lee Schlenker (newengland@solidaritycollective.org [mailto:newengland@solidaritycollective.org]; 857-636-8479). column2: This Childhood Nutritionist Says Food Pouches Are Bad For Your Babies (Modern Parenthood)
column3: Hi Stephanie --  A WHO study just found that half of baby foods analyzed obtained more than 30% of calories from sugar, concentrated fruit juice or other sweetener. This essentially trains kids to crave sweet foods, leading to childhood obesity, adult diabetes and heart disease.  But the problem is much deeper: Those food pouches our kids love have been linked to childhood obesity, speech delays and problems with motor skills development.  Here’s why you should avoid giving your kid any food squeezed from a pouch:  #1 THEY DON'T LEARN FOOD TEXTURES  According to expert Amy Shapiro  of Real Nutrition NYC, pouches don’t include spoons, tools which actually help introduce your baby to see and try new textures without scaring them (for example, potatoes). Without  a spoon, your little one is just drinking food.  #2 PROMOTES DELAYS IN MOTOR SKILLS  Pouches have been linked to speech delays and issues with motor skills, because kids are squeezing food in their mouth instead of practicing hand/eye coordination to put food in their mouth, which is an important developmental milestones. The prolonged sucking motion of a pouch, beyond the bottle phase, also impacts speech development.  #3 UNDERMINES SOCIAL EATING  When a child is munching on a pouch in the car for lunch or on the couch, they’re not learning to appreciate food as nourishment, understanding their body cues, or really experiencing a meal as “social time” around a table with the entire family.  #4 KIDS DON'T LEARN TUMMY CUES  Kids are squeezing food in their mouths in large gulps instead of savoring each spoonful. The “one spoonful at a time” approach gives babies the space to learn to eat when they’re hungry and to stop eating when they’re full.  With Fresh Bellies baby food (freshbellies.com), kids learn to eat how they should - from a cup with a spoon - and without masking vegetables with things like sweet fruit.  Available for interviews or write-ups:  > Childhood nutritionist, Amy Shapiro of Real Nutrition NYC > Fresh Bellies founder Saskia Sorrosa, who can talk about how to teach kids to eat to eat veggies without "lying".  They are available for in-person (NY), email or phone interviews.  Saskia can also talk about:  * Why there's no such thing as a "picky eater" * How to get your kids to love garlic, peppers, chard, and exotic herbs * The problem with baby food marketing.  Can I connect you to this story idea or these experts for any stories you're working on?  If you'd like a sample for potential coverage, please send over your mailing address. column2: Because They Said It Was Impossible
column3: Every entrepreneur's journey is different, but these things remain.  "If you can find a path with no obstacles, it probably doesn’t lead anywhere." -- Frank A. Clark ------------------------------------------------------------ https://mailchi.mp/perkconsulting.net/achieveyourbusinessgoalsin2018-1273701?e=d4302bda94 https://perkconsulting.us4.list-manage.com/track/click?u=302a656f6b047fd7b6e501114&id=562b546fe3&e=d4302bda94   ** https://perkconsulting.us4.list-manage.com/track/click?u=302a656f6b047fd7b6e501114&id=802224a6fc&e=d4302bda94 Unlocking Success: The Advice Every Entrepreneur Must Hear ------------------------------------------------------------  I never had much of an interest in entrepreneurship. As a child, I watched my father work tirelessly to build businesses. Some were successful. Other were not. I now know my father was not alone in his plight because Bloomberg Research suggests that 8 out of every 10 businesses fail within the first 19 months. The Small Business Administration suggests that only half of new businesses survive the first five years, while only 35% are able to survive for 10 years. Despite my early exposure to the unfortunate side of entrepreneurship, I have come to believe that what sets the successful and the unsuccessful apart is not luck, worth ethic, or even skill. Most times, it comes down to the power of flexibility.  When you first become an entrepreneur, you are inundated with solicited and unsolicited advice. There is an incredible adrenaline rush that comes from seeing yourself manifest what had only been a vision in your mind for weeks, months, and sometimes even years. Most of the advice is given with good intentions and meant to be motivational. Yet, some have absolutely no significance to you because your primary concern early on is simply to survive. column2: Security Alert. Your account was compromised. Password must be changed.
column3: Hello!  I am a hacker who has access to your operating system. I also have full access to your account.  I've been watching you for a few months now. The fact is that you were infected with malware through an adult site that you visited.  If you are not familiar with this, I will explain. Trojan Virus gives me full access and control over a computer or other device. This means that I can see everything on your screen, turn on the camera and microphone, but you do not know about it.  I also have access to all your contacts and all your correspondence.  Why your antivirus did not detect malware? Answer: My malware uses the driver, I update its signatures every 4 hours so that your antivirus is silent.  I made a video showing how you satisfy yourself in the left half of the screen, and in the right half you see the video that you watched. With one click of the mouse, I can send this video to all your emails and contacts on social networks. I can also post access to all your e-mail correspondence and messengers that you use.  If you want to prevent this, transfer the amount of $500 to my bitcoin address (if you do not know how to do this, write to Google: "Buy Bitcoin").  My bitcoin address (BTC Wallet) is:  3FGHpEHiCnFSj4XEqviWPMPx8M58HhAoNk  After receiving the payment, I will delete the video and you will never hear me again. I give you 50 hours (more than 2 days) to pay. I have a notice reading this letter, and the timer will work when you see this letter.  Filing a complaint somewhere does not make sense because this email cannot be tracked like my bitcoin address. I do not make any mistakes.  If I find that you have shared this message with someone else, the video will be immediately distributed.  Best regards!  --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to daily+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: HomeAway/Vrbo to Collect Vacation Rental Tax in Mass - What does this mean? Interview Avail
column3: Hi Stephanie,  This month, all eyes are on Massachusetts in the vacation rental industry. As of Aug 1, Vrbo/HomeAway has officially "turned on" vacation rental tax collection and remittance in the state. So why is it you (probably) haven't heard about this? The answer is that Vrbo and HomeAway aren't exactly broadcasting this move, and while they are collecting and remitting some state lodging taxes...there is a good chance that in any given local municipality there are additional local taxes owed which are still up to the homeowner to understand, collect from their renters and remit to the correct agency (and at the right time) independently of what Vrbo/HomeAway are collecting. Confusing, right?!  So, what does this mean for Massachusetts' growing short-term rental market? Why is Vrbo/HomeAway choosing to cooperate now with statewide lodging tax collection/remittance efforts? Why aren't they collecting ALL the necessary taxes for their users? How can vacation rental owners figure out how much they need to collect, who that money needs to go to, and when? How does this change in Massachusetts stack up against the broader trend toward legislation and taxation in the vacation rental space across the country? And what is the hotel industry's role in lodging taxes being collected by Vrbo/HomeAway in the state)?   I'd love to offer an interview with Rob Stephens, a vacation rental owner himself and the preeminent expert on the short-term vacation rental market as the founder and general manager of Avalara MyLodgeTax (https://www.avalara.com/mylodgetax/en/index.html) , the first and only tax collection and remittance software used by Airbnb, VRBO, HomeAway and virtually every major regional and national vacation rental platform. Rob keeps a close eye on the rapidly evolving landscape of the vacation rental industry and regulations being introduced both on a national and state level. He's been following these developments in Massachusetts very closely and can provide insight into both the local and national impact of what's happening.   Just let me know if you have any interest in an interview for Christian Science Monitor, The and I'll be more than happy to make that happen. Thanks!  Dave  --  Dave Feistel p: 949-502-6200 x224 e: dave@bastionelevate.com (mailto:dave@bastionelevate.com)    CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE:  This E-mail (including attachments) is covered by the Electronic Communications Privacy Act, 18 U.S.C. §§ 2510-2521.  ______________________ If you would rather not receive future communications from Bastion Elevate, please go to http://LFPR.pr-optout.com/OptOut.aspx?514084x74769x110029x1x4617759x24000x6&Email=customerservice%40csmonitor.com. column2: Little Women Movie Now Available!
column3: Little Women Movie Now Available!   Display problems? View this newsletter in your browser. ( https://mychristiandaily.com/?email_id=799&user_id=93437&urlpassed=W3ZpZXdfaW5fYnJvd3Nlcl9saW5rXQ&controller=stats&action=analyse&wysija-page=1&wysijap=subscriptions )  Little Women Now Available!  For immediate release FAITH NEWSWIRE ( https://mychristiandaily.com/?email_id=799&user_id=93437&urlpassed=aHR0cDovL3d3dy5mYWl0aC1uZXdzd2lyZS5jb20v&controller=stats&action=analyse&wysija-page=1&wysijap=subscriptions ) – Writer-director Greta Gerwig (Lady Bird) has crafted a Little Women that draws on both the classic novel and the writings of Louisa May Alcott, and unfolds as the author’s alter ego, Jo March, reflects back and forth on her fictional life. Watch the Youtube trailer here. ( https://mychristiandaily.com/?email_id=799&user_id=93437&urlpassed=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g%2Fdj1BU1QyLTRkYjRpYyZhbXA7ZmVhdHVyZT15b3V0dS5iZQ&controller=stats&action=analyse&wysija-page=1&wysijap=subscriptions ) In Gerwig’s take, the beloved story of the March sisters – four young women each determined to live life on her own terms — is both timeless and timely. Portraying Jo, Meg, Amy, and Beth March, the film stars Saoirse Ronan, Emma Watson, Florence Pugh, Eliza Scanlen, with Timothée Chalamet as their neighbor Laurie, Laura Dern as Marmee, and Meryl Streep as Aunt March. column2: Your account was under attack! Change your credentials!
column3: Hello!  I am a hacker who has access to your operating system. I also have full access to your account.  I've been watching you for a few months now. The fact is that you were infected with malware through an adult site that you visited.  If you are not familiar with this, I will explain. Trojan Virus gives me full access and control over a computer or other device. This means that I can see everything on your screen, turn on the camera and microphone, but you do not know about it.  I also have access to all your contacts and all your correspondence.  Why your antivirus did not detect malware? Answer: My malware uses the driver, I update its signatures every 4 hours so that your antivirus is silent.  I made a video showing how you satisfy yourself in the left half of the screen, and in the right half you see the video that you watched. With one click of the mouse, I can send this video to all your emails and contacts on social networks. I can also post access to all your e-mail correspondence and messengers that you use.  If you want to prevent this, transfer the amount of $500 to my bitcoin address (if you do not know how to do this, write to Google: "Buy Bitcoin").  My bitcoin address (BTC Wallet) is:  31pa4MHspcRVMHKiTeiHNgEh98vEM2S1NJ  After receiving the payment, I will delete the video and you will never hear me again. I give you 50 hours (more than 2 days) to pay. I have a notice reading this letter, and the timer will work when you see this letter.  Filing a complaint somewhere does not make sense because this email cannot be tracked like my bitcoin address. I do not make any mistakes.  If I find that you have shared this message with someone else, the video will be immediately distributed.  Best regards!  --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to daily+unsubscribe@csps.com.
