Our Core Belief is that information is power and no one should struggle to live  a healthy, safe, dignified and happy life from a lack of it. RIElderInfo.com is the only expert-curated, comprehensive, online resource for Rhode Island Seniors, Caregivers and Professionals. Community resources specific to residents of each of the 39 cities and towns are  listed. State and Federal resources are captured in broad categories that are easy to navigate. RIElderInfo.com [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001i99IwBGWeH14gF6KaZX8baB-oJd8rHqTCSbnGzvyb4at7O_kHTAi_fMOOZx-mmx55ghL4AVtcEU_ifd0wzpR-X8K5eFBuPNIVVsFZWT-vFrhs1NLxZ5RIMct2P5D9kEr5Dmy8poVx6dpW633ipCggyls3AIUnNVWmkDfOoRtVuY=&c=zwZeVA-Cx9QPYDYtwMmfPkDwG1sQBu7X4AyUpbp74h6TweogRdK0Hg==&ch=HenSZobd3hLXVNGHt74ZAVnErAGP-USF9CisZO787BzyMAOu2HibsA==] provides information for all Rhode Islanders without limitations based on income  or language. If you are a home owner, or homeless, there are resources listed for you. Thirty percent of Rhode Islanders over the age of 65 have limited English proficiency or are non-English speaking. The site can be translated into Portuguese, Italian, Spanish, French, Russian, Chinese, German and Arabic. You will find the information you need in a language you understand. RI Elder Info is registered with the State of Rhode Island as a nonprofit. The application for the 501c3 nonprofit tax designation by the IRS has been submitted and will take 6 months to receive. In the interim, RI Elder Info is supported by donations from individuals in the  Rhode Island community. Please let me know if you have any questions. Sincerely, Deb Burton, MS Gerontologist Executive Director RI Elder Info RIElderInfo.com [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001i99IwBGWeH14gF6KaZX8baB-oJd8rHqTCSbnGzvyb4at7O_kHTAi_fMOOZx-mmx5TSD2e9qfyuby63yqPMD94zSsZGssjDbsaxCtkEAPi-sWfJubwf87tXV_-C-xZP9sFI4Qf9qIBVVc6hbW_dTAyPsDoYxJHJEnD401HoolPA8=&c=zwZeVA-Cx9QPYDYtwMmfPkDwG1sQBu7X4AyUpbp74h6TweogRdK0Hg==&ch=HenSZobd3hLXVNGHt74ZAVnErAGP-USF9CisZO787BzyMAOu2HibsA==] 401-585-0509 ### AVAILABLE Worship Space The Church of the Ascension, 390 Pontiac Avenue, Cranston, has a sanctuary which  is underutilized, being used for worship only for eight hours on Sunday. If there is small or growing congregation seeking to rent worship space for use late on Sundays or during the week, we would be glad to hear from you. Call Mike Coburn, Priest-in-charge, at 401- 461-5811. ### SouthCoast Fair Housing Lots, lots, LOTS more information HERE [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001i99IwBGWeH14gF6KaZX8baB-oJd8rHqTCSbnGzvyb4at7O_kHTAi_a-p2GCgnlqL29Dite-njyVEW7o25B7gDySMKZuvqU2yXAsyN3bfrIylY-_4WSxP-SuWMq4rWMHtU8aDTGoReDE6aSaycQRLxZH4VyonfpmpRJlsdsNyPEEcyWGLxdfGgseNC-lQPEovt07WrJcO98TAql-kE2LjHGU1D_OrCIlAQs6wfDPhwRih5rBmG4GRpKwSWvfD0-F0&c=zwZeVA-Cx9QPYDYtwMmfPkDwG1sQBu7X4AyUpbp74h6TweogRdK0Hg==&ch=HenSZobd3hLXVNGHt74ZAVnErAGP-USF9CisZO787BzyMAOu2HibsA==] ### Behavior Health Link View Poster HERE [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001i99IwBGWeH14gF6KaZX8baB-oJd8rHqTCSbnGzvyb4at7O_kHTAi_X5LP1qv5wa4vtAQxLphD6zNY_R8su8T7No2JXk0iNKHwCG_quXXUCOdkNXZreHmsXovbUR9wsnL4DlrWLV6_za0741j9F9RPHyAyd7UP6ksHr30zgB9NzAMXJxSnItvNLN50Y9LCD2M_C67BRsonQqMrsj9UtqRGJg39T6idSjgYMV4rVnWhHbW6yscjYZ_G-WkSuv4zUGM&c=zwZeVA-Cx9QPYDYtwMmfPkDwG1sQBu7X4AyUpbp74h6TweogRdK0Hg==&ch=HenSZobd3hLXVNGHt74ZAVnErAGP-USF9CisZO787BzyMAOu2HibsA==] WHAT IS BH LINK? * A comprehensive program intended to serve those individuals 18+ who are experiencing behavioral health crises (mental health and/or substance use) by establishing a community-based, 24/7 hotline and triage center Location: 975 WATERMAN AVE., EAST PROVIDENCE, RI 02914.  WHY BH LINK? * Provides immediate access to behavioral healthcare in a community-based, 24/7  facility * Ensures stability, provides seamless transfer to ongoing care, and reduces unnecessary use of hospital-based services * Delivers better, more cost-effective behavioral healthcare in Rhode Island  Primary components: * BH Link Hotline, (414-LINK; 414-5465): a one-stop, statewide 24/7 call-in center that connects people to appropriate care and resources, when they or someone they care about is experiencing a behavioral healthcare crisis. * BH Link Triage Center: a 24/7 community-based walk-in/drop-off facility where  clinicians connect people to immediate, stabilizing emergency behavioral health  services, and long-term care and recovery supports ### IMPORTANT INFORMATION Providence Safe Stations to address the overdose epidemic in Providence On behalf of Commissioner Steven M. Paré: The purpose of Providence Safe Stations is to address the overdose epidemic in Providence by providing hassle-free and immediate access to supportive services. Individuals living with substance use disorders may not be aware of the resources available  to them or have the ability to access them. Providence Safe Stations breaks down  barriers for individuals, allowing them access to critical supportive services  provided by a peer in recovery when and where they need them most. Individuals from anywhere in the region can come to any Providence Fire Station  at any time 7 days a week to seek help beginning January 2, 2018.  When they are  ready to seek help, Providence Safe Stations will provide the connection to begin treatment.  Providence Firefighters will secure any drugs that individuals may have and start the process to connecting them to recovery coaches and services to assist them with their addiction.  No questions asked and no consequences for disposing  of any drugs an individual may wish to surrender. Providence Safe Stations is based on the model from Manchester and Nashua, NH, which also experience high rates of opioid overdose deaths.  It is in alignment with the State of Rhode Island's Overdose Prevention Action Plan [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001i99IwBGWeH14gF6KaZX8baB-oJd8rHqTCSbnGzvyb4at7O_kHTAi_aThtddb0wQeMJmLBItSK3QxNPAki27SUMbT1dBNHFAfmb3s95O4ikPq9MjxERI8HtlA5g0_QV1_rwPpknSU9Fw6JA3bQjTR2zZ8_erigZv6erX3fTGue7oknByTe7cwAa-jIKAnFPsA48kpPQgMJFQ=&c=zwZeVA-Cx9QPYDYtwMmfPkDwG1sQBu7X4AyUpbp74h6TweogRdK0Hg==&ch=HenSZobd3hLXVNGHt74ZAVnErAGP-USF9CisZO787BzyMAOu2HibsA==], which includes expansion of peer recovery services and access to treatment options for long-term recovery.  Providence Safe Stations is a partnership between the City of Providence's Fire Department [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001i99IwBGWeH14gF6KaZX8baB-oJd8rHqTCSbnGzvyb4at7O_kHTAi_aThtddb0wQePjMiwsswl7nnN06S8nbbn-PTWPHOEmq1okN8mk9GwFWc8xJf6u54IDuXQ6v-4Oxnp7w2LRv3EQx1Xj_Yo8yGGb2SLEUCmJNkmB04LyaJAczOqsRLC8KjTyn4a2bHYAb-bCI7tjZig_0=&c=zwZeVA-Cx9QPYDYtwMmfPkDwG1sQBu7X4AyUpbp74h6TweogRdK0Hg==&ch=HenSZobd3hLXVNGHt74ZAVnErAGP-USF9CisZO787BzyMAOu2HibsA==] and The Providence Center's Anchor Recovery [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001i99IwBGWeH14gF6KaZX8baB-oJd8rHqTCSbnGzvyb4at7O_kHTAi_aThtddb0wQekYwtpq58QOeTx0l9G8i98WHmP3_i9yRb-iK8IuoD-jTpaZA7I4OVMHuc08pvkueNk4fsUrs6mpnKAo1-1B76NncbvD8JPY-sTpl-s-qzisZIxkfcvoTSr0zeliA0RXqBJlYVoutoDBgh8ApS5wuHUVk9AFctXTL1mwnl5aiXdA32dE2VWZaalCMI9blR7WwK&c=zwZeVA-Cx9QPYDYtwMmfPkDwG1sQBu7X4AyUpbp74h6TweogRdK0Hg==&ch=HenSZobd3hLXVNGHt74ZAVnErAGP-USF9CisZO787BzyMAOu2HibsA==] with leadership and support from the RI Department of Behavioral Healthcare, Developmental Disabilities, and Hospitals [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001i99IwBGWeH14gF6KaZX8baB-oJd8rHqTCSbnGzvyb4at7O_kHTAi_aThtddb0wQeXK708xit1gvVG829Pe9nXVI1uiAECf0crELzljjPmmHAc11Ilu_wJlPD4LX_trcs4p5a6JqarBDjVbIkPN1bNVgCyBp3E1WwjEX0Xf64TMw=&c=zwZeVA-Cx9QPYDYtwMmfPkDwG1sQBu7X4AyUpbp74h6TweogRdK0Hg==&ch=HenSZobd3hLXVNGHt74ZAVnErAGP-USF9CisZO787BzyMAOu2HibsA==] and the RI Department of Health [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001i99IwBGWeH14gF6KaZX8baB-oJd8rHqTCSbnGzvyb4at7O_kHTAi_aThtddb0wQeU7fLld-nZx7IEGxI7-tCvnJem8WdtSWk3n8de9pRpfA7J6_I9MpW0O0HqIk_cht_c9XzQ0JJHG0jbpQPjcl5zS3h42Xzqk5IzSHw99T_orNoFimmcY_2FQ==&c=zwZeVA-Cx9QPYDYtwMmfPkDwG1sQBu7X4AyUpbp74h6TweogRdK0Hg==&ch=HenSZobd3hLXVNGHt74ZAVnErAGP-USF9CisZO787BzyMAOu2HibsA==]. ### Equine Therapy Offered A year ago, Rev. Lynne Bryan Phipps established Beachwood, an equine therapy center, to help people suffering with anxiety, trauma, and grief. The program has received a strong response in the RI Community.  In intensive equine therapy (IET), trained psychologists and counselors working  with specially selected horses help clients with a range of emotional issues. There is no riding and horse care is incidental to the process. The client learns to communicate with the horse - talk to the horse if you will - and read the horse. It can be fun, it certainly is interesting, takes focus and requires a horse with the ability to hold a connection. The client also interacts with the therapist - we call them trainers, who are highly skilled at reading and understanding horses and their behavior. We think our protocol is unique and quite often yields significant rewards and successes. So much so that Brown University has developed protocols for data collection to  document the remarkable healing rates.  Alternative therapies like equine therapy are not covered by insurance in RI, but we are finding that the costs associated with our work are far less than traditional approaches; a significant number are free or on a sliding scale. If you know of  someone who might benefit, please contact us.  Beachwood's website is www.beachwoodri.org [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001i99IwBGWeH14gF6KaZX8baB-oJd8rHqTCSbnGzvyb4at7O_kHTAi_WbHq7usye805wmeLb6ugXuK0AS-CjFPeZl9SEuyzM4hu-gfD107vnu5SMsD8_ZJY26eB5u5GYSMxVHL2eZxau4ohqYH0ZnosSqGfnQ4x4O5fv2NbSg5P3b5McI_d761pg==&c=zwZeVA-Cx9QPYDYtwMmfPkDwG1sQBu7X4AyUpbp74h6TweogRdK0Hg==&ch=HenSZobd3hLXVNGHt74ZAVnErAGP-USF9CisZO787BzyMAOu2HibsA==] or call Rev. Phipps directly at 401 742-4028 ### Comprehensive Cancer Control Program at the Rhode  Island Department of Health,  in collaboration with The Partnership  to Reduce Cancer in Rhode Island, have recently produced a few items  that will be of interest to all. First, we have compiled a list of Support Groups,  Bereavement Groups and other  resources for cancer patients and survivors  in Rhode Island. This is a comprehensive list that we'll be updating on  a quarterly basis moving forward, that includes   detailed information about support and bereavement groups around the  state. We've also developed three educational brochures regarding different topics related to cancer... -         A Palliative Care Brochure: This brochure  describes what palliative care is, how it can be beneficial for patients  with any chronic illness,  who provides palliative care, and how  patients might go about accessing it.Here [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001i99IwBGWeH14gF6KaZX8baB-oJd8rHqTCSbnGzvyb4at7O_kHTAi_ap9zbY-2ogTpVMBJAftMB9hUgYxEtHoUoRmhAEzhMjJZlJCuEN7l6-ERFIZaSnImrP8ZuYYKYTA1WyqwEPo-OUaAhhBdyoPpF4SbkqPT6Aq44kcPoXGx6b723BYI0-vLrjRdhAjtZ4MSzveJrZq5EpP7OSvMy89hskuKJG9iLyioKmsjgCzPq0_nq4ekqNNQhAU6Ir0O-YF&c=zwZeVA-Cx9QPYDYtwMmfPkDwG1sQBu7X4AyUpbp74h6TweogRdK0Hg==&ch=HenSZobd3hLXVNGHt74ZAVnErAGP-USF9CisZO787BzyMAOu2HibsA==] and Here [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001i99IwBGWeH14gF6KaZX8baB-oJd8rHqTCSbnGzvyb4at7O_kHTAi_ap9zbY-2ogTk1wr4xTqSKusJyDLgOoO2U05rzUh-jzRw--jf2C5dsGovvJ_BQWGuDZ1w-v4yWpXg0DWp7ti1LFZ8NE0mb2XsoihthHKduJque-K3rYcaboNCLObDhAakOE_RgJsHy80rUb1Wo2TiUlI1OddXKbiSPPquaRLUX6FJNFoNjg83yGiF6G3Z1AziMZYqlXyDx0b&c=zwZeVA-Cx9QPYDYtwMmfPkDwG1sQBu7X4AyUpbp74h6TweogRdK0Hg==&ch=HenSZobd3hLXVNGHt74ZAVnErAGP-USF9CisZO787BzyMAOu2HibsA==] (Spanish) -         A Clinical Trials Rack Card: Here [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001i99IwBGWeH14gF6KaZX8baB-oJd8rHqTCSbnGzvyb4at7O_kHTAi_ap9zbY-2ogTJ_M2L_yKs6oqxuhnSbXxPZt9DjRZHUuac8XJilVENwhh1SsP8ZZhjt375sJ_lspmrhI6okhuLa437EE5GJooaV1JgnZy6y8U6Kkba3ia3EDAlbqWqpBlmu_xjcGwYtuvuUHbPNtJEQFcz7kCu_NyfaZRMUZil9P-NhOjVP6QIZSvBe_FJ3Cb9gdx1HYcL4Bq&c=zwZeVA-Cx9QPYDYtwMmfPkDwG1sQBu7X4AyUpbp74h6TweogRdK0Hg==&ch=HenSZobd3hLXVNGHt74ZAVnErAGP-USF9CisZO787BzyMAOu2HibsA==] and Here [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001i99IwBGWeH14gF6KaZX8baB-oJd8rHqTCSbnGzvyb4at7O_kHTAi_ap9zbY-2ogT1m4hGaK6M5yC4XCU2px2lkfFNg5DvUlFc4w0yng2DDPJQWQgjEwra6MPM-ynh2XNQVIixTtxXp6InU6q9ze2kZIYkkXKld7xoMmM-mkujeIwBx60QVQE9frm5XA2QM5kTN-ERpcQf6fZJT7ciJvf7EQELIPw_DqChF85MUQYxJEgYPLO3gMNpSvdod2-buMa&c=zwZeVA-Cx9QPYDYtwMmfPkDwG1sQBu7X4AyUpbp74h6TweogRdK0Hg==&ch=HenSZobd3hLXVNGHt74ZAVnErAGP-USF9CisZO787BzyMAOu2HibsA==] (Spanish)This details  what the goals for clinical trials for cancer patients typically are,  and links to other helpful resources on clinical trials for cancer  patients, including a hotline number for the Institutes  of Health, who can answer any questions a patient might have. -         A Nutrition for Cancer Patients Rack Card:  Here [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001i99IwBGWeH14gF6KaZX8baB-oJd8rHqTCSbnGzvyb4at7O_kHTAi_ap9zbY-2ogTV1SL9G2dmSfpf8IN-8QgE5e_hZANmdMorBrcnPh9oz7wDWVCrcvMHQIcghFSAKOsSDaugNQMFJ9MDMZJSvkO9Kv-b3_VbNldapNLM-zKkWTWsgAnrhKEa_oNj_Seo8fJ2EvsyX7Oy8nwpZXWHK5h0u3iBbkSTGMC1ySm3VshQ5GTX92wHvGrwTuvS3xZ6_bH&c=zwZeVA-Cx9QPYDYtwMmfPkDwG1sQBu7X4AyUpbp74h6TweogRdK0Hg==&ch=HenSZobd3hLXVNGHt74ZAVnErAGP-USF9CisZO787BzyMAOu2HibsA==] and Here [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001i99IwBGWeH14gF6KaZX8baB-oJd8rHqTCSbnGzvyb4at7O_kHTAi_ap9zbY-2ogT3vUfdi_k4PfWl8FmjXrFjtnLYsD-tnyZ1xLPLfdoqQDinfN3Kf9glE2lFynB8zGoqBJgcRIQEm1Qn2v-61Iq6V7xTZtWx5_XDxCgc0K5QPfS7XKlf9L-YesIM3KlIFCArQ_nXROwGcLTEF6Ml8-pC9mt6-0HOTlo7PnKvOx5yfvlOCndnx7nevfuVQ4LcP8b&c=zwZeVA-Cx9QPYDYtwMmfPkDwG1sQBu7X4AyUpbp74h6TweogRdK0Hg==&ch=HenSZobd3hLXVNGHt74ZAVnErAGP-USF9CisZO787BzyMAOu2HibsA==] (Spanish) This card explains how proper nutrition during treatment and  survivorship can be beneficial for patients and survivors, and how they  can go about accessing more information to help guide  their dietary habits. For further information, contact George at George.Andoscia@health.ri.gov [mailto:George.Andoscia@health.ri.gov] ###  RISCC Resource End of Life - Resources, Issues, Learning Modules We are pleased to present to clergy, faith leaders, care givers and elderly advocates a NEW Resource, located on the RISCC Web Site [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001i99IwBGWeH14gF6KaZX8baB-oJd8rHqTCSbnGzvyb4at7O_kHTAi_QVocdp1Qe05zdZ9DM3TxVqmIPaVQK6XbIRqt9YWsvh0atj689zouIB7XTdNTvVcpO-Nt4LmX1m48bt4meI91wg_zfj64ATEgu_bNlj9yQa6vHWLWC0zbsR1cY-Q_1RoyQ==&c=zwZeVA-Cx9QPYDYtwMmfPkDwG1sQBu7X4AyUpbp74h6TweogRdK0Hg==&ch=HenSZobd3hLXVNGHt74ZAVnErAGP-USF9CisZO787BzyMAOu2HibsA==], for many End of Life issues.  Some of the publicly available information gathered here is: (All available now on our web site) Hospice in Rhode Island [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001i99IwBGWeH14gF6KaZX8baB-oJd8rHqTCSbnGzvyb4at7O_kHTAi_TssFFTxNYPGl2_vFpk9Yw1nBxnP4wW6FdnuOGIBJJ90_FicMfWrWOQQ9RSR8pU5zd26pJEU2bzoe5RGyKzcHamG_bypYShqtRpQ_gePJt3rC-hzBUCUMdddvNQ-9OWOVkKIJYAF8AkTTchtoPTCulTkSxUv_PFDVezj4FNgr0_q&c=zwZeVA-Cx9QPYDYtwMmfPkDwG1sQBu7X4AyUpbp74h6TweogRdK0Hg==&ch=HenSZobd3hLXVNGHt74ZAVnErAGP-USF9CisZO787BzyMAOu2HibsA==] Palliative Care in Rhode Island [http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001i99IwBGWeH14gF6KaZX8baB-oJd8rHqTCSbnGzvyb4at7O_kHTAi_TssFFTxNYPGe7wOP1SigT2Q0DQ90kx0cS3oL47g7kCgCd1HNL7BfnlJDBwgonoihPPI8oRGra5a-EmfjA0qt-3ojN_qKuMsIbInGeXK0Zr_VHnF_iFBduMrZ9bvAxXhXXS902_k4oq0SdSWTVV--

column2: Elections and Audits Updates from Secretary Clarno
column3: Newsletter from Secretary Bev Clarno [ https://sos.oregon.gov/Pages/index.aspx ]________________________________________________________________________  900 Court Street NE, Salem, Oregon 97310 - oregon.sos@oregon.gov  ________________________________________________________________________    *News from the Secretary of State*  2020 Census  You may know that the next federal census takes place in 2020. The information gained during this census will be used to redraw Congressional and legislative district boundaries for the next decade. Under Article IV, section 6, of the Oregon Constitution, the Legislature must try to agree on what those new boundaries will be. If it does not, or if it does so inadequately, the Secretary of States Office must redraw the lines itself. Due to rapid population growth over the last ten years, Oregon is expected to gain a Congressional seat in the next redistrictingbringing us from five members in the U.S. House of Representatives to six. As such, it is important that the information gathered during the census be as accurate as possible. Our office has been asked to assist in outreach efforts to communicate that importance and encourage all Oregonians to participate in the censusparticularly some of the traditionally hard-to-count populations, such as young children, racial and ethnic minorities, and low income persons. This is something we are delighted to help do.  Deschutes County Picnic  Deschutes Picnic   On July 13th, I attended the Deschutes County Republican Partys annual Summer Picnic in Bend. As Secretary of State, and Oregons chief elections officer, I make a special point to speak to all organizations that invite meRepublican or Democrat. As the keynote speaker, I discussed the core functions of the Secretary of States Office, some of the recent audits that we have conducted, and some of the highlights from the 2019 legislative session. About 100 people were in attendance, including State Senator Tim Knopp, State Representatives Jack Zika and Cheri Helt, and Deschutes County Commissioners Phil Henderson, Patti Adair, and Tony DeBone.     County Elections Offices  Hood River   On July 15th, during my drive home to Redmond, I visited three County Elections Offices in Eastern Oregon to hear from local officials. My first stop was in Hood River, where I met with the Hood River County Clerk, Brian Beebe. Brian is unique among county clerks in Oregon because, in addition to serving as County Clerk, he also serves as County Assessor. He therefore manages the county's Records and Assessment Department as well as its elections. Brians Chief Deputy, Kim Kean, has served the County for over thirty years.     Wasco   Next, I stopped in The Dalles, where I met with the Wasco County Clerk [ https://www.co.wasco.or.us/departments/clerk/index.php ], Lisa Gambee, and Wasco County Commissioner Steve Kramer. While there, I also had the opportunity to observe some of the Countys historical collectionsmuch of which consisted of memorabilia from the Rajneesh movement that settled near Antelope in the early 1980s. Such a fascinating time in Oregons history. Finally, I met with Jenine McDermid, the Sherman County Clerk [ https://www.co.sherman.or.us/departments/sherman-county-clerks-office/ ], in Moro. Her husband, Ron, who is also a Justice of the Peace, gave me a tour of their historic courthouse, which was built in 1899.     Sherman   Some of these individuals expressed concerns about the additional administrative burden that newly-enacted legislation will place on their already-tight budgets. Others expressed appreciation for all that our Archives Division [ https://sos.oregon.gov/archives/Pages/default.aspx ] does to help with the management of their counties records, and all that our Elections Division [ https://sos.oregon.gov/voting-elections/Pages/default.aspx ] does to help them conduct fair and secure elections. I appreciated the opportunity to meet with them and to discuss how our state government can better serve Oregonians.     Eastern Oregon Economic Summit  Summit   On July 26th, I attended the inaugural Eastern Oregon Economic Summit in Hermiston. This gatheringthe first of its kindwas organized by the Eastern Oregon Womens Coalition [ https://www.eowc.biz/ ], a nonprofit charitable organization dedicated to educating Oregonians about Eastern Oregons businesses and rural way of life. The purpose of the Summit was to have an in-depth discussion about the various factors affecting rural Oregons economy, from the impacts of 2019 legislation to recent changes in technology, demographics, and the environment. Over 200 people were in attendance, including local, state, and federal elected officials, as well as representatives from approximately 100 businesses in the region.  In particular, attendees heard from Ken Bisconer, the director of West Coast flight operations for PAE ISR [ https://www.paeisr.com/ ], a Virginia-based aerospace firm that develops advanced tactical equipment and communications systems, including FLIR thermal imaging cameras, for drones and other aircraft. This technology is useful for fighting forest fires and discovering insect infestations, among other things. PAE ISR currently leases a hangar at the Pendleton airport. Ken told attendees that his company chose Eastern Oregon not only to take advantage of the large flight area, but also for the quality of life that it affords their employeeswonderful communities, beautiful surroundings, and endless opportunities for outdoor recreation. I couldnt agree more. Eastern Oregon is a wonderful place to live, work, and play. Special thanks to the Eastern Oregon Womens Coalition for organizing the event and for inviting me to attend. I look forward to next years Summit!     Oregon China Council  OCC   Also on July 26th, the Deputy Secretary of State, Rich Vial, gave the welcome address at the 9th Oregon-China Economic Forum in Oregon City, the theme of which was Building the Bridge to our Common Dreams and Sustainable Future. This event is sponsored each year by the Oregon China Council [ https://oregonchinacouncil.org/ ]. Numerous dignitaries from China, as well as local business and government leaders, were in attendance. Deputy Vial was accompanied by his daughter-in-law, Liyan Huynh, who was born in China and who provided simultaneous translation of his remarks. Deputy Vial spoke about the many things that former Secretary of State Dennis Richardson did to improve trade between Oregon and China, and he encouraged those in attendance to see past their cultural differences and to develop lasting, meaningful relationships with one another.     Going the Extra Mile  Corinna   On July 29th, I invited Corinna Tanguy to my office in the Capitol to personally thank her for her hard work. Corinna is part of the Contact Center team for Secretary of States Corporations Division [ https://sos.oregon.gov/business/Pages/default.aspx ], where she spends her days working directly with business, notary, and Uniform Commercial Code customers. Most importantly, she does it all with a positive attitude. At a time when our Contact Center was low on staff, Corinna really brought her A-gametaking an average of 100 calls per day and replying to customer emails in between. In her spare time, Corinna participates in the Divisions Quick Response Team as well as the Secretary of States Inclusion and Diversity Council. She is an incredible example of a team player, par excellence!  In addition, the Audits Division would like to recognize the initiative and impact of two auditors, Jamie Ralls and Ian Green, who went above and beyond and found a way to use data analysis to help federal investigators identify potential fraud in the food stamp program. After conducting a 2012 audit of public assistance programs, Jamie and Ian had access to vast troves of data on these programs, including Oregons Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), otherwise known as food stamps. After analyzing the data and identifying common red flags for fraud, the two were able to successfully compile a list of SNAP merchants with multiple fraud indicators and share it with the FBI. While they are still ongoing, these efforts have already led to the successful prosecution and conviction of five merchants, including a meat market in Klamath Falls with ties to a Mexican drug cartel; lifetime bans for 59 SNAP recipients who were committing fraud; and over $525,000 in restitution paid to the state. I want to thank Jamie and Ian for their commitment to identifying government fraud, waste, and abuse. Their story is yet another example of how hard your government is working for you.     Public Auditor of the Republic of Palau  Palau   On July 30th, Satrunino "Nino" Tewid, Public Auditor for the Republic of Palau, came to Oregon to visit the Secretary of States Audits Division.Given recentchanges to Government Auditing Standards,Nino requested assistance from our Audits Division with his performance audit policies and procedures.He and Kip Memmott, Director of our Audits Division, agreed that a collaborative relationship has been established between their offices, and they are committed to speaking again in the near future. One of the things that I appreciate most about our Audits Division is that they are not afraid to think outside the box and to exchange best practices with other government auditorsnot just around the country but around the world! I believe the free flow of ideas, opinions, and information drives innovation. Perhaps that is why the Audits Division has won numerous Excellence in Accountability Awards from the National State Auditors Association.     Department of Administrative Services Audit  On July 31st, my office released an audit report highlighting three areas in which the Department of Administrative Services [ https://www.oregon.gov/das/pages/index.aspx ] (DAS) can enhace transparency and help lawmakers to make informed decisions when crafting the States budget. Both Legislators and the public need to know how state agencies spend their money. The report, which you can read here [ https://sos.oregon.gov/audits/Documents/2019-29.pdf ], explains that state agencies will often hire two or more employees for one position, and quickly spend money towards the end of a budgeting cycle. It also found that the States Transparency Website [ https://www.oregon.gov/transparency/Pages/index.aspx ] can be difficult for Oregonians to use and, in some ways, incomplete. The report makes sixteen recommendations for things that DAS can do to help address these issues. I want to thank our Audits Division for their hard work in pulling this project together, and I want to thank DAS for their cooperation throughout the process. Identifying ways in which we can make government more efficient is a victory for all Oregonians.  Oregon Youth Challenge Program  Jasmyn   On August 5th, I attended a ceremony where Jasmyn Troncoso was sworn in to the Deschutes County District Attorneys Office [ http://www.dcda.us/ ] as Deputy District Attorney. While attending high school in Gresham, Jasmyn struggled with her grades. When she was sixteen years old, she entered the Oregon National Guard Youth Challenge Program [ https://www.oycp.com/ ] (OYCP), which provides opportunities for personal growth, self-improvement, and academic achievement for at-risk high school students through a highly structured, non-traditional environment. Jasmyn excelled in the OYCP, working as a librarian, building maintenance custodian, and phone duty receptionist, and holding various positions of leadership in her platoon. In 2006, she graduated from the program with her GED and enrolled at Mt. Hood Community College. In 2017, she graduated at the top of her class from Loyola Law School, and was eventually hired by the Deschutes County District Attorneys Office. District Attorney John Hummel asked that Jasmyns swearing in ceremony be conducted at the Youth Challenge Program, which played such a pivotal role in her success story. As both a public servant and someone who has served on the OYCPs Board of Directors for over 25 years, being able to attend Jasmyns ceremony was particularly meaningful for me. It is so encouraging to see some of the real life, positive effects that this program has on Oregons most vulnerable youth. Congratulations, Jasmyn. Youve made us all so proud.     Oregon Matters of State Podcasts  In case you missed it, Deputy Secretary Rich Vial has begun a series of podcasts, entitled Oregon Matters of State, to give Oregonians a peak behind the curtain and to help them better understand not only "what" the Secretary of States Office and its various divisions do, but "who" it is the state has hired to lead those important efforts. I believe our office has some of the most qualified agency directors in the countryand I know first-hand how hard they work for Oregonians. It is my hope that these podcasts will serve to introduce them to the people of Oregon and to inform Oregonians how our office can better serve them. You can listen to the first two episodes, wherein Deputy Vial interviews me and the Director of the Elections Division, Steve Trout, by following the link on the left-hand side of our website [ https://sos.oregon.gov/Pages/index.aspx ].  As always, it is an honor to serve as your Secretary of State.  Sincerely,  Bev Clarno signature  Bev Clarno          Having trouble viewing this email? View it as a Web page [ https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/ORSOS/bulletins/25891d3 ]. column2: Mission Agency Wages War Against ‘Child Killer’ Mosquitoes, Malaria
column3: On World Mosquito Day, August 20, mission agency enlists public to help combat airborne killer  View this email in your browser (https://mailchi.mp/9587562e8d23/gfa-mosquito-report?e=70980e1f90)  ============================================================ FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE August 14, 2019  FOR MORE INFORMATION, CONTACT: Gregg Wooding @ 972-567-7660 gwooding@inchristcommunications.com Gospel for Asia Wages War Against ‘Child Killer’ Mosquitoes, Malaria  On World Mosquito Day, August 20, mission agency enlists public to help combat airborne killer WILLS POINT, Texas — Faith-based agency Gospel for Asia (GFA, ** www.gfa.org (https://inchristcommunications.us19.list-manage.com/track/click?u=e3746de33f5451f19df787d41&id=d654d0bad0&e=70980e1f90) ) today announced it is combatting the deadly mosquito menace and resulting malaria parasite killing thousands of children in Asia, as the Christian organization marks the annual World Mosquito Day on August 20. To read GFA’s special report  titled “Fighting Malaria—a Chilling Disease,” visit: ** https://inchristcommunications.us19.list-manage.com/track/click?u=e3746de33f5451f19df787d41&id=88b42b069b&e=70980e1f90 (https://inchristcommunications.us19.list-manage.com/track/click?u=e3746de33f5451f19df787d41&id=c43be37151&e=70980e1f90) .  “It only takes one mosquito to kill a child,” said GFA founder, Dr. K.P. Yohannan, explaining that seven out of every 10 mosquito-caused deaths are children under age five, but a simple mosquito net costing $10 could save a child’s life. GFA provides people with the opportunity to donate mosquito nets at ** https://inchristcommunications.us19.list-manage.com/track/click?u=e3746de33f5451f19df787d41&id=fe30e07909&e=70980e1f90 (https://inchristcommunications.us19.list-manage.com/track/click?u=e3746de33f5451f19df787d41&id=454a80723d&e=70980e1f90) .  Mosquitoes were responsible for nearly 220 million malaria cases around the world in 2017, resulting in 435,000 related deaths—nearly one every minute—according to the World Health Organization’s (WHO’s) latest World Malaria Report.  On August 20, 1897, India-born British doctor Sir Ronald Ross discovered that the bite of parasite-infected female mosquitoes transmits malaria – and declared that the date should be commemorated as World Mosquito Day each year.  “As GFA combats these mosquitoes and the deadly diseases they carry, we’re seeking to minimize the risk of children being infected,” Yohannan said. “It’s part of our commitment to the remote communities we serve and one way to express God’s love for them.”  This year, health workers at more than a thousand GFA-supported medical camps in Asia will teach families the importance of sleeping every night under a mosquito net and making sure they remove stagnant water around their homes to eliminate mosquito breeding grounds.  In 2018, GFA-supported workers helped distribute 360,000 free mosquito nets to vulnerable families across Asia, and similar malaria prevention efforts are underway this year.  “Many villagers in remote areas can’t afford to buy mosquito nets or preventive medications,” Yohannan said. “This is why our efforts are so critical and show people that we really do care about them.”  Malaria is just one of numerous deadly diseases transmitted by the bloodsucking insect. In tropical and subtropical regions of the world—mostly in sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia—mosquito-borne dengue fever, yellow fever, West Nile virus, African sleeping sickness, and encephalitis ravage extremely poor communities that lack basic healthcare. A female mosquito can live up to eight weeks and lay hundreds of eggs.  Malaria was close to being eradicated in the 1950s, but it soon surged again to epidemic levels in India, Indonesia, Kenya, Uganda, Nigeria and other impoverished nations.  Despite this resurgence, WHO reported that the number of malaria cases in India in 2017 declined 24 percent from the previous year, raising hopes of major progress against the disease in the heavily impacted eastern state of Odisha on the Bay of Bengal.  Combating malaria is one of WHO’s eight Millennium Development Goals, and the agency is currently field-testing the first malaria vaccine—potentially a huge breakthrough.  Although unusual in the United States, the U.S. is not immune to deadly mosquito-borne diseases. In July, health officials in central Florida discovered a rare form of mosquito-transmitted encephalitis that can cause fatal brain swelling.  Media interested in interviews with Gospel For Asia should contact Gregg Wooding at InChrist Communications, ** gwooding@inchristcommunications.com (mailto:gwooding@inchristcommunications.com) / 972-567-7660.  ###  Celebrating its 40th anniversary in 2019, Gospel for Asia (GFA, ** www.gfa.org (https://inchristcommunications.us19.list-manage.com/track/click?u=e3746de33f5451f19df787d41&id=0a92b251af&e=70980e1f90) ) is a leading faith-based agency, bringing vital assistance and spiritual hope to millions across Asia, especially to those who have yet to hear the "good news" of Jesus Christ. In GFA’s latest yearly report, this included more than 70,000 sponsored children, free medical camps conducted in more than 1,200 villages and remote communities, over 4,000 clean water wells drilled, over 11,000 water filters installed, income-generating Christmas gifts for more than 200,000 needy families, and spiritual teaching available in 110 languages in 14 nations through radio ministry. For all the latest news, visit our Press Room at ** https://inchristcommunications.us19.list-manage.com/track/click?u=e3746de33f5451f19df787d41&id=0bb59728d5&e=70980e1f90 (https://inchristcommunications.us19.list-manage.com/track/click?u=e3746de33f5451f19df787d41&id=3561c2e6d5&e=70980e1f90) .  PHOTO CUTLINE: BITING BACK: Christian mission agency Gospel for Asia (GFA, ** www.gfa.org (https://inchristcommunications.us19.list-manage.com/track/click?u=e3746de33f5451f19df787d41&id=d4543b3ca9&e=70980e1f90) ) today announced it was “waging war” on the deadly mosquito menace killing thousands of children in Asia, as the Texas-based organization marks World Mosquito Day on August 20. GFA will help distribute thousands of free mosquito nets to vulnerable families across Asia.   Copyright © 2019 InChrist Communications, All rights reserved. column2: New Team Members
column3: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  Greetings! I hope you're doing well. Our GM Alex has resigned to pursue a new career as a teacher and we want to wish  him the best. With his exit we have hired some new team members that will be starting over the next couple of weeks. In the meantime myself and other existing team members can help you if Alex has been your usual point of contact. Something I do want to address while I have your attention, is we get a lot of emails to place orders or request quotes, which is fine but it does leave a margin for  error, in that I myself will get an email, start to work on putting in the order  or send back a quote, get a call, get pulled away from my desk or any other number of reasons that my attention gets divided, resulting in the action not being completed and leaving your request unaddressed. If you do not get a response or get an order confirmation for an email you sent,  please follow up with us to ensure we do fulfill your request.  This is by no means an attempt to push you to our website to place an order if you are not comfortable doing so, you're always welcome to call us, come by or email us but the website  has a ton of resources, pricing and full online ordering, in fact all orders through TampaPrinter.com go through our site whether we put them in for you or you put them in on your own. We're very excited about our new team members and are confident that we will continue to provide you with great service (and maybe even better). column2: Trendy Vegan Treats + Entrepreneur Success Story: Chantal Guillon
column3: Trendy Vegan Treats + Entrepreneur Success Story: Chantal Guillon  #outlook a {             padding: 0;         }          a {             color: rgb(61, 152, 198);         }          img {             max-width: 100%;             height: auto !important;         }          #email-wrapper {             font-size: 14px;         }          @media (max-device-width: 568px) {             #email-wrapper {                 font-size: 17px;             }         }          @media (max-device-width: 1024px) {             #email-wrapper {                 font-size: 16px;             }         }       Hi Outlet,      I have a news tip for you about a French expat in the food industry who's been thriving in SF since the '08 recession. Chantal Guillon came to the US not knowing English well, started her macaron business in the heart of SF during the 08' recession, and just launched new vegan macarons.     Chantal Guillon has garnered major clientele, and celebrities like Whoopi Goldberg choose it as a go-to for fun gifts. The best way to find out why is to try it yourself, and the ladies of Chantal Guillon would be happy to invite you to the store to see how the macarons are made or ship some samples to you. :)       I could set up an interview with the CEO of Chantal Guillon herself, and you can meet the woman behind the success of SF's first specialized macaron business.      Any interest? Please let me know.      Best,  Jack                Parisian Patisserie Thriving Since ‘08 Recession in San Francisco: Meet The Woman Behind It All             August 2019           San Francisco, CA, August 2019 -- San Francisco-based Chantal Guillon invites you to try their ultimate Parisian-Californian dessert, the macaron. The Chantal Guillon macaron brings the Parisian patisserie and American appetite together in its unique experience-forward sweet tooth indulgences. One bite into a Chantal Guillon macaron immerses one into an experience of multiple flavors and textures, a love affair for dessert. The best way to understand why celebrities, such as Whoopi Goldberg and Olympic Athlete Josh Prenot, choose Chantal Guillon macarons is to try them for yourself.            A Bit of History     The macaron appeared in Europe during the Middle Ages. In France, it has become one of the most loved high-end sweet treats, and its history is tightly linked with the monarchy. Catherine de Medicis apparently had macarons served at the wedding of Duc Anne de Joyeuse, in Ardèche, in 1581. Macarons also appeared in Saint-Jean-de-Luz in 1660, where a baker offered a few to king Louis XIV for his wedding.            Taking the Bay Area by storm with the French heritage royal delicacy, Chantal Guillon is the leading artisan baker of the Bay Area, and you are welcome to visit the shop, bake with their team, and learn the founder’s story.            A Success Story Made Out of “Little Divas”      “I started as an entrepreneur looking for a new challenge and a mother who wanted to be closer to her kids in the US. The challenge was scary, to start in a new country without even speaking the language, but the excitement of creating a new business by offering something that my family always loved and to be close to my children won me over and made me take a leap of faith.” -- Chantal Guillon, CEO            Macarons, or as Chantal calls them, “Little Divas,” blended Chantal’s careers. Coming from a background in luxury interior design and the previous owner of a Parisian restaurant, macarons were a way to combine those two experience into Chantal’s next one. “It was very important to me to offer the best macaron to San Francisco, not just a crunchy flavored cookie, by creating a true Parisian experience in each detail of the macaron, a delectable taste and offering a gift-giving experience with a desirable packaging,” says Chantal.            With a delicious product complimented by a fashion-forward travel box, Chantal Guillon soon became the perfect go-to gift in San Francisco, combining taste and beauty. Creating limited-edition flavors and gift boxes for every occasion.                     About Chantal Guillon ®     The success of the independent small business is the result of a serial entrepreneur, Chantal Guillon, a Paris to SF expat who started her shop to create a space for fun and sweet tooth joy in the most innovative city in America.  Chantal Guillon is the first specialty macaron store of San Francisco and is known as the best macaron of the Bay Area Nationwide since 2012 with its e-commerce website, recreating the in-store experience by offering individual assortments.           Chantal Guillon quickly understood the need for catering to tech companies with customized gifts for their brands. Due to popular demand, Chantal Guillon has catered for non-profits and tech companies inside and outside the Bay Area. Chantal Guillon utilizes local suppliers for all its main ingredients (Bay Area dairy, local eggs, and California-grown almonds). With her connection to the Parisian culinary scene, Chantal continuously sources the best particular ingredients around the world, such as Lavender from Provence, Rosewater from Persia, and Hazelnut from Italy. Discover updates and new flavors by signing up for the newsletter here. Email jack.s@oxygen-rp.com to schedule your interview with Chantal Guillon and to plan your trip to the best macarons store in America.                                        You are receiving this message from jack.s@oxygen-rp.com, jack.s@oxygen-rp.com at Oxygen Public Relations.     United States, 26 O'Farrell Street, San Francisco, CA, 94108     jack.s@oxygen-rp.com          If you would like to stop receiving messages of this type in the future, you may unsubscribe            Unsubscribe From This List http://click.deliveryengine.agilitypr.com/asm/unsubscribe/?user_id=8692845&data=IB_FryFXU1KRjWfe0Y8UkqHkM5GgU9NGgkllJTrzBMMWXQ2NSJIbTfr_zxOQovyMAORsvaem2HH7p798o1l-VN9vaGI6taVx62qxYXyQY7zeMDmzhIOf_JD-hPBLFLWsx2cCLschty36bLH0yvVRiF10oOt4v8GvS2nGmHwvNKiW-_Vg8PHA5N0geUHVAypgEok1TMSNeNMoyJWHplyykmVmYwkh8nmJMrUSihYq9DSMOLSycFB1_tcdCYC-oAnY1cwYsxgpc0-ksWh6HO-b79AJyYbrE-eiOgahidjHr_6Z0UEC4KFYDBGEtqVN0BbQ-wZz8bnnYWZnCdLeo1PXWELA1u3nWOhH6URzdrMBuUSukQbIh6X0EzgoyYcanfpD6j5aSQ7zP1KicJhIJp3rA4GxGsCJJKqa1ctxd_V0rqIKcGD7Otte3xXi4HRw-GrMwv-EZS8OYgTJitTEDqFiWk60O_46Vs9Z3JY6ypJXM6EEDpdfkUFC6jrAJzOtuxom5T3t3RzUQuALGbZO9iE6mSVopoQIFypACTHghRNxB1y_mP7pqoE9RSImNFJeqA5j | Manage Email Preferences http://click.deliveryengine.agilitypr.com/asm/?user_id=8692845&data=NrVp67-wVUSMv8lJH4sJjO254cDzVTp8IRtrovviuaAvKl-fVcUzLto8IV67llJwsg6hAd_lsoSCgNG96xsvREWC-uOtT6Ey-VElsl549oK7jVEuvm2l7arlSFtcbgNHiYgUKXQJY_BowmMl_zMDJv0b-tu0wt2OewcUolqwbEwR92RX5iZVavsbV2uPFy8RyCGpHZtU9TOr8yEE_xxZlVpStU7dDI1CXTYaDYqFoL9gt8b5Ca3OCaW7OIWVFTKDfaWVgF77TPX_zxE9VS7Ff-ol2hG6h_--LRrcX_tFyvdueT143RnuHFjMSp5CXbV48YQJ9zqvvLw6fH3HP7XLiueLfylOe_7LWD9gajRb9aqzO1oXyV4ASnj5IwS6Q9j7SxDAa9S9JZXzxsiDy1byzwRiYIdSy_M7Ag6n589KgAqIVV_xuZ8o8Xrwl2v4WjibnnhH9gBlQd3w0egdGKnJdPGJcsqH5SNEwzhVAyJmM4qEuF6sSA_rxynLd80eqN2KRdNsuM7QA3270MeavZjvZHAqAea_ch_DT9qad0RLddA=

column2: Editorial comments and corrections
column3: The following information was collected:  Name: John  Email: robledoint@yahoo.com  Subscriber: No  Subject: Why is China Investing Billions In Africa?  Product: csmonitor.com  Message: Why Is China Investing Billions in Africa? | NowThis World 215,529 views  4.2K  619  SHARE  SAVE   NowThis World Published on Dec 16, 2018 China has invested billions of dollars into the continent of Africa to build massive infrastructure projects in African countries. Much of this infrastructure is part of China’s Belt and Road Initiative, an estimated 1 trillion dollar plan to connect the country to trade routes all over the world. » Subscribe to NowThis World: http://go.nowth.is/World_Subscribe » Watch the Previous Episode: https://go.nowth.is/2LhNmtv  While China’s Belt and Road Initiative was only proposed in 2013, the country’s first infrastructure project on the African continent was built decades ago. The TazaHra railway, completed in 1976, was built to connect copper mines in Zambia to Dar EH Salaam, Tanzania’s former capital. The TazHara railway was the first infrastructure project built on a pan-African scale.  China’s Belt and Road projects will be designed to create new trade routes within and between African countries. In 2017, a Chinese firm opened a railway network in Kenya, connecting its capital Nairobi to the port city of Mombasa. There are already plans to extend this network into South Sudan, Uganda, Rwanda and Burundi.  Many observers worry that African countries won’t be able to pay back these debts, placing them in what’s been called a quote “debt trap.” But others think that as African countries rise economically, they could actually have the upper hand by the time they negotiate payments back to China. This explains why African leaders have been so confident in calling Chinese investment a “win-win.”  But is China’s investment in the continent actually a “win-win”  as some African and Chinese leaders have said? OR is it just a new form of colonialism on a continent that’s experienced so much of it? In this episode, we’re examining China’s Belt and Road Initiative and what it might mean for Africa. Each week we’ll be exploring current stories in international news, by examining the facts, providing historical context, and outlining the key players involved. We’ll also highlight powerful countries, ideologies, influential leaders, and ongoing global conflicts that are shaping the current landscape of the international community across the globe today.  http://www.youtube.com/nowthisworld

column2: Saturday: Sunshine & Extinction Rebellion
column3: Armory News for December 2018. Galleries open 12:00 to 5:00 PM Closed Tuesdays and holidays Admission is always free Win back our future from the brink of extinction. TWO-talk-4-email-lede1.jpg - THE WINTER OFFICE: The Social Territories of a Warming World with Sunrise Movement LA & Extinction Rebellion LA - Saturday, August 17, 2:00 to 4:00 PM - In conjunction with their current exhibition (https://www.armoryarts.org/exhibitions/2019/winteroffice/?utm_source=Armory+eNews+Subscribers&utm_campaign=0d0587b812-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2019_08_14_10_03&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_49d72a3489-0d0587b812-122544969) , please join The Winter Office (http://thewinteroffice.net/?utm_source=Armory+eNews+Subscribers&utm_campaign=0d0587b812-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2019_08_14_10_03&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_49d72a3489-0d0587b812-122544969) for the fourth and final public conversation at the Armory on non-ideal theories of art, collaborative design, and spatial justice in the 21st century city. For Saturday's conversation, members from Sunrise Movement LA (https://www.sunrisemovement.org/?utm_source=Armory+eNews+Subscribers&utm_campaign=0d0587b812-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2019_08_14_10_03&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_49d72a3489-0d0587b812-122544969) and Extinction Rebellion LA (https://rebellion.earth/?utm_source=Armory+eNews+Subscribers&utm_campaign=0d0587b812-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2019_08_14_10_03&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_49d72a3489-0d0587b812-122544969) will gather under the rice paper flags installed in the Winter Office exhibition to talk about their movements. Their conversation will touch on strategies for fighting the climate crisis, examine Sunrise and Extinction Rebellion’s ongoing actions and campaigns, and discuss building a movement large enough to win back our future from the brink of extinction. - Please note: Additional conversations from this series will be hosted by 18th Street Art Center (https://18thstreet.org/?utm_source=Armory+eNews+Subscribers&utm_campaign=0d0587b812-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2019_08_14_10_03&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_49d72a3489-0d0587b812-122544969) in Santa Monica on August 15, August 31, September 5, and September 12 (times TBA). - Image: The Winter Office, Flags (SUNRISE AND EXTINCTION REBELLION MOVEMENTS), 2019. Silk-screen on rice paper, installation dimensions variable. Photo by Ian Byers-Gamber. - https://www.armoryarts.org/schedule/2019-events/socialterritories-4/?utm_source=Armory+eNews+Subscribers&utm_campaign=0d0587b812-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2019_08_14_10_03&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_49d72a3489-0d0587b812-122544969 - https://www.facebook.com/events/491393145020624/?utm_source=Armory+eNews+Subscribers&utm_campaign=0d0587b812-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2019_08_14_10_03&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_49d72a3489-0d0587b812-122544969 - TWO-email-lede-8.jpg - THE WINTER OFFICE: Non-Perfect Dwelling - through September 15 - The Winter Office (http://thewinteroffice.net/?utm_source=Armory+eNews+Subscribers&utm_campaign=0d0587b812-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2019_08_14_10_03&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_49d72a3489-0d0587b812-122544969) , an artistic and professional working group of artists, curators, architects, designers, and social scientists with ties to Copenhagen, Denmark, presents new works that engage the challenges facing Southern California – including rising housing inequality, economic displacement, house-lessness, and environmental disaster. Conceived of as a collection of thought provoking vignettes, Non-Perfect Dwelling brings together wildly different time scales and references, including comic book anti-hero Bizarro, ancient ammonite fossils, futuristic holograms, and an operational podcast studio, to create an environment where urgent approaches to dwelling and cohabitation can be imagined and planned. - Image: The Winter Office, The Coming North (detail), 2019. Wood, silk, paint.. Photo by Ian Byers-Gamber. - https://www.armoryarts.org/exhibitions/2019/winteroffice/?utm_source=Armory+eNews+Subscribers&utm_campaign=0d0587b812-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2019_08_14_10_03&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_49d72a3489-0d0587b812-122544969 - club-scum-email-lede-8.jpg - Club SCUM: Three Year Anniversary Exhibition - through September 15 - As Club SCUM (https://www.latimes.com/entertainment/music/la-et-ms-club-scum-20190330-story.html?utm_source=Armory+eNews+Subscribers&utm_campaign=0d0587b812-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2019_08_14_10_03&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_49d72a3489-0d0587b812-122544969) enters its third year, the Armory celebrates this milestone with an exhibition that features ephemera, flyers, and photographs taken at the club. Founded by Rudy “Bleu” Garcia and Ray "Hex-Ray" Sanchez, Club SCUM is a boundary-pushing, community-building, monthly queer punk POC party at Chico, a venue located on the border of East Los Angeles and Montebello. With its focus on diverse drag performers and identities that don’t fit into stereotypes, Club SCUM is a platform that welcomes everyone and provides queer Latinx youth a space to gather, create, dance, sweat, feel safe, and transcend the routines of everyday life. - Image: Crowd Shot, 2017. Courtesy of Amina Cruz. - https://www.armoryarts.org/exhibitions/2019/clubscum/?utm_source=Armory+eNews+Subscribers&utm_campaign=0d0587b812-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2019_08_14_10_03&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_49d72a3489-0d0587b812-122544969 - Nonprofit and community-based, Armory Center for the Arts is a national leader for contemporary art exhibitions and community arts education. The Armory's mission is to build upon the power of art to transform lives and communities through creating, teaching, and presenting the arts.  145 N. Raymond Ave. • Pasadena, CA 91103 • (626) 792-5101  - https://www.armoryarts.org/shop/membership/?utm_source=Armory+eNews+Subscribers&utm_campaign=0d0587b812-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2019_08_14_10_03&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_49d72a3489-0d0587b812-122544969 - - https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=NE92JADVE5B6S&source=url&utm_source=Armory+eNews+Subscribers&utm_campaign=0d0587b812-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2019_08_14_10_03&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_49d72a3489-0d0587b812-122544969 - http://us12.forward-to-friend.com/forward?u=30f7e01cd06e86bfc7785a413&id=0d0587b812&e=0197494026  https://www.instagram.com/armoryarts/https://www.facebook.com/armoryartshttps://twitter.com/armoryarts?utm_source=Armory+eNews+Subscribers&utm_campaign=0d0587b812-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2019_08_14_10_03&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_49d72a3489-0d0587b812-122544969 -  This email was sent to service@csps.com (mailto:service@csps.com) why did I get this? column2: Back to School Hacks for Brace and Invisalign Wearers.
column3: Hello Stephanie?,  EverSmile® (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB9kmd93mMHV07bqBQ2z78KhUJo3kgIcGShjifhl1TtB1_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs3UZxatvHCkVjDWJwIHon9f67Frv5zQXhsjm0U7J3qkBz10q3-2Fuueu-2B0WZe0wByA5KsiVmXvKZwrKT-2FOyA76aMKGcYAkgHLcWR-2FOPBepWAB7UcoEK4wAdiFZ32IKgRrkCyL70BBr2XHgoU8BbfIMICBTTvYI-2FxwufXH9CYoDdK7sdhhBdyxK2hSyCLc-2BbuEEbJwJgoVlT-2FVGxUEzTu7Y2v6phG4FaimnYncSWUl1DQ5v1XOnWXcrLpg8NA8FJDFB4E-3D makes back to school season a breeze with their effortless products! Many kids go through the daunting experience of braces during summer vacation. Orthodontic treatment can be difficult, but OrthoFoam™ (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB9kmd93mMHV07bqBQ2z78KjtBEmerjFOP7qh3-2BUE8mjn9-2FX01a7-2BRxg6uwoLzefKPI8qPJOi5yxobVKpciy3EH0YyNS8KdR3p-2B8DNJF1Z-2FXJ_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs3UZxatvHCkVjDWJwIHon9f67Frv5zQXhsjm0U7J3qkBz10q3-2Fuueu-2B0WZe0wByA5KsiVmXvKZwrKT-2FOyA76aMKGcYAkgHLcWR-2FOPBepWAB7Vv7pANGbqDIqWfYAV6oC1cOPusdzRA3q-2Brk7OhaqVl2Ar9btl3rPzKcT1zwvJe-2BQdnsu3uwLxBT8N-2Bs6y-2BVUkCBh9-2BTOKASficqTqm7svvs6rzLR9mp2P1tCV8mITk8gfJUsD0XtEHV5eF5YF2110E-3D is here to help make the process of cleaning and whitening teeth simple. With an effortless brush and rinse formula, you can be sure those brackets are clean with OrthoFoam’s brushing bubbles which work on top of, around, and even underneath metal and ceramic brackets.   https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB2wtWQe-2BRq3AtI-2FlWPm8lkw2mcJSZiu0JLNaIlpDy-2Fjw4vxOzQax9Sw67jHFBTolaoxJzWhtOalR50lFl8Bxy00VLyqxdetkPH6tgJ4j8mimgZ-2ByLcMzqwF1Wn7UsZY3EpoMBQcmoPi7-2BAz0TPRcmG2KTPhLJmtxDgDBhURDOWrDqOD7JAkfcSCyNh53GERWxr-2F8BfJXRCQX0WLOKgNovXX0IP3q5vjWSkMhyprzhjlM_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs3UZxatvHCkVjDWJwIHon9f67Frv5zQXhsjm0U7J3qkBz10q3-2Fuueu-2B0WZe0wByA5KsiVmXvKZwrKT-2FOyA76aMKGcYAkgHLcWR-2FOPBepWAB7Tvw2IbZDSD0dG1i9-2FIrPpmzAGDbeDlgjZ0Z-2FUy1SU7eIJFnzccmM-2B95p4osVJZh3TvgOjMGRk9n-2F0DM8yfmAf6Gn0eS7xcChreeneOuq0pk-2FYOUSgF4LHtGVMuh6sdQzkqKjE3tLdPXkbWyzeU-2FCMg-3D  EverSmile® AlignerFresh™ (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB9kmd93mMHV07bqBQ2z78KiOfTiTOo8RahMOC-2BdH6-2FTV5bi1NjngiMbaUKDwOUlH-2Fg-3D-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs3UZxatvHCkVjDWJwIHon9f67Frv5zQXhsjm0U7J3qkBz10q3-2Fuueu-2B0WZe0wByA5KsiVmXvKZwrKT-2FOyA76aMKGcYAkgHLcWR-2FOPBepWAB7TDlxxQj1jQMaJSr3wEypVcSIDRriiqnkZKNfGcrw5tFknPIGITlEtShRGcluEryJbc6W56oFVlGYPhz5FsDgC2EEKa9ftHqgKhm63FTKJNy07TkGqh2-2BgKJYwEOgUMOoECMhj-2BArBAXa3zNZNGf9v8-3D is perfect for whitening and cleaning before heading off to school or after lunchtime. AlignerFresh™ uses hydrogen peroxide-based, anionic EverClean™ technology and in laboratory testing, 99.999% of common oral bacteria were killed within 60 seconds of exposure. AlignerFresh™ can be kept in a backpack all day long and will come in handy for after meals when you can't rinse.   https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB2wtWQe-2BRq3AtI-2FlWPm8lkzZXfoQkc9wlWAf-2Fx8hmD4ahvTfJgh-2Ff3qH2VqjkuEAWQY-2FVgatU8b0tM1lhNheByeRgMXZj8n-2FHLF52JhAnkAzqPzONYj8Ea0goB0ND6mWe-2FmXsNVauPCASu4s-2FRXpM41J2iHP0lrOkXx2hfrjpc-2F0mYUEibAWTMGRs6hJh973jYt6sRCt4pAvuSJk1EBZ4H6Am6xc9ZOBUDfoCLgjcghR_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs3UZxatvHCkVjDWJwIHon9f67Frv5zQXhsjm0U7J3qkBz10q3-2Fuueu-2B0WZe0wByA5KsiVmXvKZwrKT-2FOyA76aMKGcYAkgHLcWR-2FOPBepWAB7ZgvfhyH0LjQRe6cHjKU0KglYmOtOmOAD5Bq8l-2FxJcLe7WzW9igifU4H6o2ZpdoI6NWD6XhJpwZRnNJek6c9hMMhalhg-2BPrvNRVCpUseSQkBBbxX1tTJHV9Y5iitc5BU17XCW4GM6B3TpLI5EtRgOs0-3D  OrthoFoam™and AlignerFresh™will help kids and teens with aligners or braces quickly and effectively clean their teeth. These products will keep cavities at bay, freshen breath, and whiten teeth during the madness of back to school.   We’d love to work together on a feature for EverSmile®  OrthoFoam™ and AlignerFresh™ and are happy to get you started with samples to review! If you’re interested in Dr. Michael Florman providing additional commentary then we can get that set up as well.   About EverSmile:  Founded in 2013 by Dr. Michael Florman, DDS and Camilo Triana, EverSmile, Inc. is a leading innovator in the oral care and orthodontic consumer packaged goods market. Dr. Florman wanted to answer his patients’ most common question: “How do I keep my aligners clean and fresh?” By using advanced anionic hydrogen peroxide technology, Dr. Florman not only answered his patients’ questions but also introduced a patented method of application which provided cleanliness, freshness, and teeth whitening to aligner patients. For 7 years now, EverSmile® has been the only solution on the market and has since expanded to include the following products: OrthoFoam for braces, WhiteFoam and AlignerFresh for for clear aligners & retainers, WhitenFresh for on-the-go dual-action breath-freshening & teeth whitening, SportsFresh for sports mouth guards, and FreshDent for  dentures & partials. Today, EverSmile® is a globally recognized brand selling products in the US, Europe, India, and Australia. Available in CVS, Bed Bath & Beyond/Harmon, Kinney Drug, London Drug and Rexall in Canada and arriving in Walmart and Walgreens stores nationwide in Spring of 2020. With a dedication to providing innovation and science to every smile, EverSmile® is leading the oral care industry with unique products that truly solve a problem.    ______________________  If you would rather not receive future communications from P2R Inc., please go to https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=mAHw-2B8ZZluKmvldupnv96lCyDgcamR5NQmtFpp-2FepcvsZ5toPjOVEvRbn6-2BM4wdbh3j0VN3z7CmWiIpv27W1yKsZsLDh7jrrjy6u7B5fniH4gUX-2FlLooA07Yb-2B80nnU9rUTwdI7GqUDwig-2Fipvxxq9LhARgoGKjb3cVGU5PFZsY-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs3UZxatvHCkVjDWJwIHon9f67Frv5zQXhsjm0U7J3qkBz10q3-2Fuueu-2B0WZe0wByA5KsiVmXvKZwrKT-2FOyA76aMKGcYAkgHLcWR-2FOPBepWAB7dvnz6Bkn1t93jT70ubBZGPOduWxYT2NE8fHLHmnQOHo94hhl9oo64hi69yu99wgrMyq7bi2RxFs14VBkt7LBUvnlLtmU0PGIxCgNlp3AdqG05Nv5nAxvxHKiN2PciYA3sxwRVrcpHkkjT7qVLA69TQ-3D  P2R Inc., 31567 Wildwood Road, Laguna Beach, CA 92651 United States  --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to customerservice+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: Getty Music Nominated for GMA's Inspirational Album of the Year CAT 25 for The North Coast Sessions
column3: To view this email online, paste this link into your browser: https://t.e2ma.net/message/3g8ogd/j16t49      FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE  GETTYS NOMINATED FOR INSPIRATIONAL ALBUM OF THE YEAR – CAT 25 BY GOSPEL MUSIC ASSOCIATION The North Coast Sessions: New Hymns and Songs Inspired by the Book of Psalms – Keith & Kristyn Getty, (producers) Fionán de Barra, Keith Getty, Kristyn Getty   Getty Music Worship Conference: Sing! 2019 takes on Music City this weekend!   (https://t.e2ma.net/click/3g8ogd/j16t49/bfgs5p)  Wortman Works Media & Marketing  |  www.WortmanWorks.com  NASHVILLE, TENN. (Aug. 15, 2019) -- Preeminent modern hymn writers Keith and Kristyn Getty of Getty Music, have been nominated for GMA's "Inspirational Album of the Year" - CAT 25 for The North Coast Sessions, which includes hymns and songs inspired, in part, by the book of Psalms. Producers are Fionan de Barra, Keith Getty and Kristyn Getty.  The 50th anniversary of the Dove Awards will be held in Nashville, Tennessee on October 15 and will air October 20 on the Trinity Broadcast Network (TBN).    “North Coast Sessions,” was recorded on Northern Ireland’s stunning coastline and is the first studio recording the Getty’s have released since 2016. It features songs such as “I Will Wait for You” based on Psalm 130; “The Lord Is My Shepherd” based on Psalm 23; and “I Lift My Eyes” based on Psalm 121.    The Gettys' are on their first global arena tour that launched a few months ago at the Belfast SSE Arena in their hometown of Belfast, Northern Ireland as part of the annual Getty Music Worship Conference: Sing! 2019. The grandiose production features performances from Keith and Kristyn, alongside a 1000 voice choir and band of virtuosic instrumentalists. The arena events are set in-the-round and will see a fusion of Celtic, Bluegrass, Americana, Modern and Classical music along with cultural dance, and will also include a special message from best-selling author John Piper.  This weekend Music City USA hosts the Getty Music Worship Conference: Sing! 2019  with Nashville Hymn Sing, including special guests Natalie Grant, Ricky Skaggs and Selah, at the Grand Ole Opry House on Sunday, August 18 and then Tuesday, August 20 at Nashville’s Bridgestone Arena with the 1000 voices of the Sing! National City Choir.  To learn more about the upcoming Bridgestone Arena event in Nashville or the Sing! initiative please visit www.gettymusicworshipconference.com (https://t.e2ma.net/click/3g8ogd/j16t49/r7gs5p).  About Keith and Kristyn Getty About Keith and Kristyn Getty: Keith and Kristyn Getty occupy a unique space in the world of music today as preeminent modern hymn writers. In re-inventing the traditional hymn form, they are creating and cultivating a catalogue of songs teaching Christian doctrine and crossing the genres of traditional, classical, folk and contemporary composition which are sung the world over. In 2017, Keith Getty was made an “Officer of the Order of the British Empire” (OBE) by Queen Elizabeth II for his contribution to "music and modern hymn writing," marking the first time the award had been given to an individual involved in the world of contemporary church music. Keith and Kristyn Getty are the authors of “Sing! How Worship Transforms Your Life, Family, and Church,” published in 2017 by B&H Publishing Group.  - 30 -  MEDIA CONTACT:  Melissa Mathews / Wortman Works   mmathews@wortmanworks.com (mailto:mmathews@wortmanworks.com?subject=Show%20this%20subject%20automatically)   615.310.5859   (https://t.e2ma.net/click/3g8ogd/j16t49/7zhs5p)   (https://t.e2ma.net/click/3g8ogd/j16t49/nsis5p)   (https://t.e2ma.net/click/3g8ogd/j16t49/3kjs5p)      1300 Division St. Ste. 205 | Nashville, TN 37203 United States  This email was sent to journal@csps.com. column2: Guest Byline: Benefits of Breastmilk and Where to Find it Naturally to Benefit Adolescent Growth
column3: Hi Stephanie,  Hope you are enjoying your summer. August is breastfeeding awareness month but even without that timely angle below is an informative article from Kristine Gedroic, M.D (https://www.gedroiccenter.com/healing-arts) . Director of The Gedroic Medical Institute, graduate from Harvard University with a degree in biochemical sciences and medical school at Thomas Jefferson University. In the piece she offers advice and great options if you are unable to breastfeed as well.  Dr. Gedroic book was just endorsed by Dr. Weil, Dr.Oz and Deepak Chopra: A Nation Unwell.  Full article follows below my signature line. Please let me know if you wish to run it.  My very best,  Janet Shapiro / Director Publicity Services  SMITH PUBLICITY, INC.  Since 1997, promoting thousands of experts, authors & books  Janet@smithpublicity.com • 856-489-8654 x320  How Breast Milk Shapes the Gut  “The Key to Better Long-Term Health”  By Kristine Gedroic, MD  There is simply no better food for an infant than a mother’s breast milk. The body is truly amazing; it creates and produces breast milk to support a growing and developing baby, why breast milk has often been called nature’s perfect first food. When you think about it, breast milk is an evolutionary guarantee that our offspring will survive—and thrive—long term, which is why the health benefits of breastfeeding are extensive.  Breastfeeding exclusively for at least a year, which is the critical time frame when the cells of the body and brain are becoming established, has been shown to have significant benefits on a child’s physical and mental health, advantages that carry well into adulthood. This is why one of the first questions that I ask a new patient is whether he or she was breastfed as an infant.  Numerous studies show that children who are breastfed exclusively are less prone—throughout their lives—to obesity, allergies, eczema, diabetes, asthma, respiratory illnesses, ear infections, and digestive problems, as well as being at less risk of developing autoimmune diseases like type 1 diabetes and multiple sclerosis. Breastfeeding for at least a year has also been linked to better mental health, including less depression and stress-related and behavioral issues—through age 14, though I would argue that this benefit extends into adulthood.  The question is, why does breastmilk have such a powerful effect on health? Yes, breast milk has a rich balance of healthy nutrients for a rapidly developing infant including lactose or milk sugars, protein, and fat. But breast milk’s effects on health has more to do with its impact on early formation of the gut, which has been found in recent years to benefit the body and brain long term.   The Gut: Where Health Begins  The gut is where our health begins, and it’s immediately after birth that the gut begins to form into anenterotype—a scientific name for an ecosystem—which is conserved for the rest of our lives. In fact, this early shaping of the gut, which includes the formation of critical health-promoting bacterial species, can onlyhappen in infancy and early childhood. Research (https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s40124-014-0051-y) has shown, that after the age of three—despite any attempts to change this otherwise—we simply cannot recreate these same bacterial colonies, which include a core of more than nine bacterial types including Staphylococcus, Streptococcus, Lactobacillus,Bacteroides, and Bifidobacterium.  We can change the numbers of bacteria in the gut through the use of probiotics, but we cannot affect these initial colonies of bacteria. This can only be established in infancy—which is why breast milk is absolutely critical for the lifetime health of the gut.   • A healthy gut stimulates a strong immune system.The right balance of bacteria in the gut stimulates the healthy development of our immune system. The bacterial colonies found in breast milk, along with something called oligosaccharides or HMOs that act as prebiotics to feed gut bacteria and antimicrobials to inhibit the growth of harmful bacteria, are the primary stimulus for the development of our immunity.  According to the American Academy of Pediatrics, breast milk is also rich in antibodies like IgA, which help to prevent infections and other illnesses by blocking pathogens from attaching to the gut. This explains why breastfed infants are less likely to develop health problems like ear and respiratory infections as infants and later on as adolescents and adults.  • A healthy gut is key to balanced brain health. As the gut develops, so too does the brain.Breast milk is a rich source of essential fatty acids, which are critical for healthy neurological development, and hormones like leptin that seem to have a stress-reducing effect on an infant’s behavior, according to one study (https://szczepienia.wybudzeni.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/Oddy10mentalhealth.pdf) in The Journal of Pediatrics.  We also know that the gut communicates with every part of the body, including the nervous system and the brain through something called the gut-brain axis. What this means: when the gut is balanced, it sends signals up to the brain allowing for optimal neuronal development and circuitry. The result: an infant’s overall mood is calmer and his/her neurological behavior is regulated.  What to Do If You Can’t Breastfeed  I understand that sometimes breastfeeding isn’t possible. While the benefits of breastfeeding can’t be completely transferred to formula feeding, it ispossible to mitigate some of the effects of not breastfeeding by doing these things:  Do what and when you can.Any breast milk is better than none, so even low milk producers are doing their babies a ton of good by offering some breast milk along with formula. If you can’t physically breastfeed, the latest pumps are discrete and efficient, so it’s easier than ever to incorporate pumping breastmilk into a busy schedule. I recommend doing what you can for as long as your milk supply lasts; if possible, for at least a year.  Choose an organic formula with prebiotics, probiotics, and essential fatty acids. While formulas can’t match breast milk’s composition, the newest formulas do contain some essential components that can help feed a baby’s gut.  Bottom line: breast milk is absolutely the best form of food for your baby, but your infant can have a healthier gut if you have to supplement or feed your baby formula.  ###  Kristine Gedroic, MD, is author of A Nation of Unwelland Medical Director of the Gedroic Medical Institute in Morristown, NJ. She is Clinical Associate Professor in the Department of Medicine at Rutgers New Jersey Medical School.  ______________________ If you would rather not receive future communications from Smith Publicity Inc., please go to http://tcismith.pr-optout.com/OptOut.aspx?519228x40410x218475x1x5080076x24000x6&Email=customerservice%40csmonitor.com. Smith Publicity Inc., 1930 E. Marlton Pike Suite 1-46, Cherry Hill, New Jersey 08003 United States  --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to customerservice+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: Jay DeMarcus Tune In Alert Tonight!
column3: View this email in your browser (https://mailchi.mp/29caf268ce0f/jay-demarcus-tune-in-alert-tonight?e=83f59b44bf) ** TUNE IN ALERT ** TONIGHT – MONDAY, AUGUST 12, 2019 –  at 7 PM CT, Jay DeMarcus – member of Rascal Flatts, musician, songwriter, producer and CEO/Owner of Red Street Records – will join his friend, Mark Lowry, for Mark's internet web show, Mondays with Mark.  The show is broadcast on Facebook (http://facebook.com/markalanlowry) , YouTube (https://www.youtube.com/user/marklowry) and Twitter (https://twitter.com/markalanlowry) .  Jay says: "Mark and I go way back, I love him dearly, and it was so fun to sit down with him and relive some wonderful memories."  MEDIA CONTACT: Aaron Crisler Red Street Records 615-474-8673 aaron.c@redstreetrecords.net  ============================================================ Copyright © 2019 Red Street Records, All rights reserved.
