column2: Re: Arbin Instruments | Collaboration
column3: Hi,    This is Alice from Arbin Instruments.    We recently contacted you with an invitation to collaborate with us. We haven't heard back from you so we would just like to follow up. We'd love to supply an article for your blog that we believe would benefit your audience.    These are a few of the topics that we could cover: the positive impact of battery testing, green power storage, aircraft/automotive batteries improvements, as well as innovative uses such as for drones, flying cars, electric vehicles…    If this goes well we'd love to establish a long-term partnership.    Let me know what you think.    Thank you for your time.    Kind Regards,    Alice    -----Original Message-----  To whom it may concern,    I am Alice from Arbin Instruments.    I’m reaching out because I enjoy your content and we’re interested in collaborating with you.    Arbin is an American company that provides high precision battery equipment. We have thousands of systems running in over 50 countries around the world and have provided testing equipment for energy storage for over 25 years.    We believe that we have the expertise your audience would be interested in and we could provide an article for your blog. These are a few of the topics that we could cover: the positive impact of battery testing, green power storage, aircraft/automotive batteries improvements, as well as innovative uses such as for drones, flying cars, electric vehicles…    We can cater the article to fit your site, and if you enjoy the article, we would love to begin a long-term partnership with you.    Let me know if you are interested. Looking forward to hearing from you.    Best regards,    Alice  --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to customerservice+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: POE BALTIMORE ANNOUNCES SATURDAY VISITER AWARDS’ FINALISTS, TO BE HONORED DURING SECOND ANNUAL INT’L EDGAR ALLAN POE FESTIVAL & AWARDS IN OCTOBER
column3: Image  Image  ** Contact ------------------------------------------------------------  Enrica Jang, Director  ** Office ------------------------------------------------------------  410-462-1763  ** Cell ------------------------------------------------------------  443-327-9789  ** Email ------------------------------------------------------------  contact@poefestinternational.org  ** Website ------------------------------------------------------------  PoeFestInternational.org   ** FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE ------------------------------------------------------------  **   ------------------------------------------------------------  POE BALTIMORE ANNOUNCES SATURDAY VISITER AWARDS’ FINALISTS, TO BE HONORED DURING SECOND ANNUAL INT’L EDGAR ALLAN POE FESTIVAL & AWARDS IN OCTOBER  Baltimore, MD, August 13, 2019 – Poe Baltimore (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=84Em28S1K9SvtzcUtu04Eh-2Fchq3tKs5oS5OVcP0HxiICl-2FIfZvx8chE4lRS9sOO2_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs1jOk2zBUadzTmlCipvHjjrt6Lc1VY8z-2FL0Lhovl4EMw6EzLCYarjkUDduFbmjrEgB95HxSJMUnr251N-2BCCVqghOVrm23i48-2FJE1CIsM5y33wpLZxv-2FHAgIAiQ3OR1HjLNOYtbVFJPzUH-2BW2JYJ4mlg5Pil263z4n-2FpAocCbNnCM4Qa0WNsiVmqBHIxnkFyL3mps4T7jNppExWKns6J4Ay8yfWFaPr9uaL7AweKkBuNWi819REwBU-2BmV7XjENjDPBg-3D announces 18 finalists of the first Saturday Visiter Awards (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB5tCEM0er-2BmTdrTrRg-2BkPu8KUqVEdaLfEX040ZyiLIREBh4VkqrYVokdKwS0Rh-2FrHcNk24XfVjuwLwVWC5JsfMc-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs1jOk2zBUadzTmlCipvHjjrt6Lc1VY8z-2FL0Lhovl4EMw6EzLCYarjkUDduFbmjrEgB95HxSJMUnr251N-2BCCVqghOVrm23i48-2FJE1CIsM5y334wSywuF7H1mCodM9xBdOXlF0dv5ANu0BHB5skNZ4EppWMUFPGdwKSmtIn7PaySKP8e6tvulVMjquzzrtdt5DsD0QKT7o696hfyM0rcjbzdpyxzIuXqsUqQft2B9tH-2BxUJAFAMa824eb1JOZvwj8rTk-3D . Poe Baltimore received dozens of entries from writers, actors, and artists around the world, celebrating the works and legacy of Edgar Allan Poe.  The awards ceremony will take place on October 5, 2019, at the 6th Annual Black Cat Ball at Westminster Hall, University of Maryland Carey School of Law in Baltimore. The venue is fitting as Poe is buried at Westminster Burying Ground (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB8qrsqC-2BEjr0OVbDMLwtiPmYD3P1oLSKNX-2Bj6bZaloshzIZHM-2FC3Xm8ZphQZtqvgbreRO-2BkVVsQ-2B2-2FL0agMxHsI-2FVzIS9qFCiUzxL597bCzI_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs1jOk2zBUadzTmlCipvHjjrt6Lc1VY8z-2FL0Lhovl4EMw6EzLCYarjkUDduFbmjrEgB95HxSJMUnr251N-2BCCVqghOVrm23i48-2FJE1CIsM5y33x7ezsQ6CHPkUBrGU9LqjtYgtWCapW0HTUSjZXpYgHWxU0ofCDim-2B8-2Bash6kKgbzQnqhyYr153T2IBSPYI8Ie2Pyo7Wto4MqbBYZhZnEVlOkYaeT2IPmIm5SJ56a5vAQ28HOv2GDCZLEGX7zhOHRWYw-3D next to the Hall. The Black Cat Ball is the official party at the second annual International Edgar Allan Poe Festival & Awards, (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB5tCEM0er-2BmTdrTrRg-2BkPu94DxwHLPdaYOxvTV4Zym-2FR_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs1jOk2zBUadzTmlCipvHjjrt6Lc1VY8z-2FL0Lhovl4EMw6EzLCYarjkUDduFbmjrEgB95HxSJMUnr251N-2BCCVqghOVrm23i48-2FJE1CIsM5y33wWAs4ZwAsFP4WLmMtAY8r1aoRVTwfNfYh0tEibuGjPsQKG66xS-2Bg257qqy2zFnp-2FyrP3spWtdNbKSBoeAdX28r-2Fmg6ZnMYzL5JW5daP0spMHLqA4CU-2B5Xu4I51UswYp4-2FmEl9SScdwfa-2BJyIKEBUTw-3D themed this year as a Cognac & Roses Masquerade with dinner by the American Culinary Federation (ACF), Greater Baltimore Chapter. Proceeds from the evening benefit The Edgar Allan Poe House & Museum.  The Saturday ‘Visiter’ Awards honor media, art, performance, and writing that adapts or is inspired by Poe’s life and works. The finalists fall into two categories, from which three will be chosen in each:   In the “Adaptations of E.A. Poe’s Life or Works” Category:  · The Raven, by Damien Draven · Poe In an Angel Frame, by June Ponte · The Tale Telling Heart, by Nicholas Schleif · There's No Place Like Poe, by Carmen Bouldin · My Poe Heart, by Rachel Heiress · A Midnight Visit, by Broad Encounters Productions, and Kirsten Siddle and Danielle Harvey · The Bells for voice and piano, by Gabriel Ruiz-Bernal · Birds of a Feather, by Stefan Parker · Edgar Allan, by Katie Hartman, Nick Ryan, Stanton Nashe, Steve Corrao · A Grave Disposition, by Adrianne Draude  In the “Original Works Inspired by E.A. Poe’s Life and Writing” Category:  · To My Beloved Heart, The Last Journey of Edgar Allan Poe, by James Marchiori · Wrathbone, by Jason Parent · Insomnia, by Mario E. Moreno · Bury Me Like Poe, by Kandy S. Alameda · The Raven Nutcracker, by Tracy Dentico · Tell-Tale, by Alan Gordon · American Mourning II, by Alan Gordon · The Assassination of Edgar Allan Poe, by Devon Armstrong and John Armstrong  New York Times Notable author, Louis Bayard (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB8Re5MS3pqviraX1EI8lXy8t1f2NTIBxrW-2BaiaU8wzXs_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs1jOk2zBUadzTmlCipvHjjrt6Lc1VY8z-2FL0Lhovl4EMw6EzLCYarjkUDduFbmjrEgB95HxSJMUnr251N-2BCCVqghOVrm23i48-2FJE1CIsM5y336ipVhzEh7xDiQy1cZ-2FJiPz02u3MtyppGI-2F1X9BQX3cetQ8-2FMvkxmsz0GyI7O9JkovlyqxqEUZoNHQu8c6erHcqRpyEV1yjvkboxbWkMvAFTwThR7n2zjggb6Xr-2BRMskxXLIUt7Mp30H6PbE1k7Nu-2F0-3D , will present the six awards October 5. His mysteries include The Pale Blue Eye, Mr. Timothy, The Black Tower, and The School of Night and Roosevelt's Beast, which have been translated into 11 languages. His story, “Banana Triangle Six,” was chosen for The Best American Mystery Stories 2018. Bayard also teaches fiction writing at George Washington University in Washington, D.C. Details for the Black Cat Ball and festival can be found here: https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB5tCEM0er-2BmTdrTrRg-2BkPu89NTL0gGNNkYTbsEsSMDOs_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs1jOk2zBUadzTmlCipvHjjrt6Lc1VY8z-2FL0Lhovl4EMw6EzLCYarjkUDduFbmjrEgB95HxSJMUnr251N-2BCCVqghOVrm23i48-2FJE1CIsM5y336MrJ84Rr4WCxCe3ccrNN5On30wOunjZaud3tJNRE6LI0S0Yi5GxttDnB6oaFvxJkIi7MCTTyTTI7TdoVTh7xmEhhECesq-2FHGqAa5hAEalih0E3Dl5X8MpV3VfmzfjF3wZ1hoNdoa1tX4hvzh6FDiI4-3D  Poe Baltimore (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=84Em28S1K9SvtzcUtu04Eh-2Fchq3tKs5oS5OVcP0HxiLJ7KHAy4mjtAVpHMYVr-2FhW_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs1jOk2zBUadzTmlCipvHjjrt6Lc1VY8z-2FL0Lhovl4EMw6EzLCYarjkUDduFbmjrEgB95HxSJMUnr251N-2BCCVqghOVrm23i48-2FJE1CIsM5y333SEeplJv2PI6sIiz8IZgdcC6dowN6BynsR-2Bt78suHkVgkkUiku8-2Bm9YsIqkmr93-2Bl2tJ9AMCx3fVelV8-2BLW7Z8WOeuGabipIkRyvxcGqatockSaoFRrXE0rpehUzMmBqTWBfEl-2FLWycAsUUwg9wc-2F0-3D is a nonprofit 501(c)(3) organization created to fund, maintain and interpret The Edgar Allan Poe House and Museum, and to celebrate the legacy of one of Baltimore’s most famous residents.  The organization is dedicated to maintaining the museum as a vibrant experience for the thousands of visitors who come from around the world each year and as part of a broader mission of city-wide events and educational opportunities celebrating Poe’s legacy in Baltimore and beyond.  ###    ______________________  If you would rather not receive future communications from Purple Dot Public Relations, column2: As 9/11 Anniversary Approaches, New Book Informs Kids About The Day: 9/11 Courage and Tributes
column3: Dear Stephanie Hanes :  America pledged to 'Never Forget' the events of September 11, 2001. But as the 18th anniversary of our nation's darkest day approaches, there's more to do to ensure future generations also never forget.  Author and Context Productions CEO Kristie Kiernan Bouryal's new release for children, 9/11 Courage and Tributes, was written to raise awareness to the events of that fateful day and is a tribute to the fallen and the courage of everyday heroes. It is the author's intention that the three books in her Discovering Heroes™ series, which are all based on true events, will help children to better understand that day, its aftermath and the bravery of the men and women who lost their lives and those who carried on. The author's parents (her father was a former lieutenant in the NYC Fire Department and her mother a former nurse), were the inspiration behind the series.   Please read the following press release and let me know if I may forward a copy of Kristie's new book in consideration of an interview or review from you. If you wish to do a feature story, I'd be happy to send JPEGs of the author and book cover. Thank you.  Brian Johnson Ascot Media Group, Inc. Post Office Box 2394 Friendswood, TX 77549 news@ascotmedianews.com ascotmedia.com 281.333.3507 Phone 800.854.2207 Fax  (This press release may be reprinted in part or entirety by any print or broadcast media outlet, or used by any means of social media sharing)  FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE  As 9/11 Anniversary Approaches, New Book Informs Kids About The Day, The Courage Of The Fallen And Everyday Heroes  **New York, NY, August 15, 2019** — Context Productions, a media company, is releasing its latest book for kids, 9/11 Courage and Tributes. The book is the third in the Discovering Heroes™ series, which increases awareness about September 11, 2001 and everyday heroes.  "We have a whole generation of kids who are largely uninformed about 9/11, yet we are on track to lose more people to 9/11-related illnesses than we lost that day,” said CEO and Author Kristie Kiernan Bouryal.   According to the World Trade Center (WTC) Health Program as of March 31, 2019, more than 95,000 people enrolled in the program and more than 49,000 have at least one disease certified as a 9/11-related illness. Since 9/11, more than 2,350 members of the program have died—over 2,100 were first responders.   "9/11 is a day that is still harming people – and this is going to continue for years to come. Many vowed to 'Never Forget,' but those words require action. I'm calling on every educator, parent, grandparent, close relative or friend of a child to use this book and others in the series to engage kids about 9/11,” said Bouryal.   Bouryal's books are all based on true events. Her parents, John Kiernan, a former lieutenant in the Fire Department of the City of New York (FDNY), and Benita Kiernan, a former nurse, inspired the series. They are the grandparent characters in the series who lovingly inform their grandchildren about 9/11, and the fallen and everyday heroes, by responding to the kids' many questions.    In 9/11 Courage and Tributes, the family visits special tributes created to honor and remember those we lost. The grandkids learn about the courage of everyday heroes, including their role in America's largest water evacuation, and that 9/11 is still harming people.   In the second book in the series, Remembering Heroes, the family visits FDNY's Rescue Company 1 in New York City to attend a memorial service for 9/11. There, the kids learn about the nearly 3,000 people lost that day, including the 343 members of the FDNY and the 11 fallen heroes from that firehouse, all while they explore the meaning of everyday heroes and see them in action. In the first book of the series, My Buddy's a Hero – And I Didn't Even Know It, the grandkids learn for the first time that their grandfather was part of the rescue and recovery efforts and helped rescue the last man out alive from the ruins of the World Trade Center.   This series of books is fitting for kids of all ages, especially seven through eleven. Teaching tools for the books are available at www.contextproductions.com, including activities that kids can complete and share with Bouryal for publishing consideration online or in print.   About Context Productions:   Context Productions is a media company that creates and publishes content for kids. Our Discovering Heroes™ series of non-fiction, chapter books reveal first-person accounts of heroism tied to September 11, 2001 and help kids uncover stories of everyday heroes in their lives.   For more information, visit www.contextproductions.com or connect with us on Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram and Twitter.  9/11 Courage and Tributes Publisher: Context Productions Released: June 2019 ISBN-13:978-1732991354 (paperback) ISBN-13: 978-1732991347 (hardcover) ISBN-13: 978-1732991361 (digital) Available through Ingram, on Bouryal's Amazon Author Page, at www.barnesandnoble.com, www.fdnyshop.com, in the FDNY Fire Zone in New York City, the New York City Fire Museum and more stores.  ###  Q and As available on request.  Ascot Media Group is compliant with the can-spam act. Contact information: Ascot Media Group, Inc. Post Office Box 2394, Friendswood, TX 77549. Main: 281.333.3507. Fax: 800.854.2207. Thank you.  --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to customerservice+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: Capital is Dead...is this something worse? by McKenzie Wark
column3: It’s not capitalism, it’s not neoliberalism—what if it’s something worse?   Capital is Dead  Is this something worse?  by McKenzie Wark Request Review Copy (mailto:wes@versobooks.com?subject=Review%20Copy%20Request%3A%20Capital%20is%20Dead) https://www.versobooks.com/books/3056-capital-is-deadAdvance Praise  "Counter-intuitive, insightful, and imaginative, Capital is Dead is a timely reminder that there are things worse than capitalism—and we may just be living through them." -- Nick Srnicek, author of Inventing the Future  “Consider this your exploratory field guide to a new mode of production.” -- Kate Crawford, Distinguished Research Professor and cofounder of the AI Now Institute, New York University  It’s not capitalism, it’s not neoliberalism — what if it’s something worse? ------------------------------------------------------------ Hardback / $24.95 / October 8, 2019 / 9781788735308 ------------------------------------------------------------  In this radical and visionary new book, McKenzie Wark argues that information has empowered a new kind of ruling class. Through the ownership and control of information, this emergent class ominates not only labour but capital as traditionally understood as well. And it's not just tech companies like Amazon and Google. Even Walmart and Nike can now dominate the entire production chain through the ownership of not much more than brands, patents, copyrights, and logistical systems.  While techno-utopian apologists still celebrate these innovations as improvements on capitalism, for workers — and the planet workers — it's worse. The new ruling class uses the powers of information to route around any obstacle labor and social movements put up. So how do we find a way out? Capital is Dead offers not only the theoretical tools to analyze this new world, but ways to change it. Drawing on the writings of a suprising range of classic and contemporary theorists, Wark offers and illuminating overview of the contemporary condition and the emerging classes that control - and contest - it.  McKenzie Wark is the author of A Hacker Manifesto, Gamer Theory, 50 Years of Recuperation of the Situationist International and The Beach Beneath the Street, among other books. They teach at the New School for Social Research and Eugene Lang College in New York City.  Contact Wes House wes@versobooks.com (mailto:wes@versobooks.com) McKenzie Wark is available for select interview Capital is Dead is available for review and first serials https://twitter.com/VersoBooks?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor https://www.facebook.com/VersoBks/ https://www.versobooks.com/ https://www.instagram.com/versobooks/ http://versobooks.tumblr.com/  ============================================================  This email was sent to sentinel@csps.com (mailto:sentinel@csps.com) why did I get this? column2: Boston - One of the worst places to buy a home
column3: Hello,   If you’re looking to buy in *Boston*, you might want to think again. A new study by GOBankingRates <https://www.gobankingrates.com/investing/real-estate/worst-places-buy-home-where-invest-instead/> found that buyers looking to invest in a home in one of America’s best-known cities may want to rethink the location.    Boston landed on the list of the 15 Worst Places To Buy a Home – and Where To Invest Instead <https://www.gobankingrates.com/investing/real-estate/worst-places-buy-home-where-invest-instead/>    *Don't Buy a Home in Boston <https://www.gobankingrates.com/investing/real-estate/worst-places-buy-home-where-invest-instead/#2>*     - *1-year home value change:** 2.5%*    - *5-year home value change:** 43%*  *Boston may boast great attractions like Fenway Park and Boston Harbor, but it’s probably not the best place to buy your starter home. Its real estate runs at a pretty high price per square foot, $724.90, for a relatively low return. Property crime isn’t great either at 22.54 offenses per 1,000 residents.*  *Instead, Choose Brockton <https://www.gobankingrates.com/investing/real-estate/worst-places-buy-home-where-invest-instead/#3>*     - *1-year home value change:** 6.8%*    - *5-year home value change:** 59.6%*  *While violent and property crime rates are still a little higher in Brockton than one would prefer, the city offers proximity to all that Boston has to offer in a little more than an hour’s drive, with a much more pocket-friendly rate of $223.75 per square foot and a 6.8% one-year home value change*.    For this study <https://www.gobankingrates.com/investing/real-estate/worst-places-buy-home-where-invest-instead/>, GOBankingRates analyzed the most expensive metro areas in the U.S. in terms of home price per square foot. The study then evaluated more affordable cities within each metro area by looking at the one- and five-year changes in median home value, percentage of homes with negative equity and violent and property crime rates to help prospective homebuyers identify some fantastic places to invest in.    Please let me know if you are interested in using the study for a story. I would be happy to connect you with one of the researchers for more information or an interview.   Thanks, Vita    *Vita DeCeglio*  Public Relations Associate  - Outreach and Earned Media ConsumerTrack, Inc. l GOBankingRates  vdeceglio@consumertrack.com 484-788-5011 l  Charlotte, NC  --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to customerservice+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: Simply Pure Cleaning One Time Offer
column3: Affordable, Dependable, and Reputable.    ** Save money on your cleaning services with Simply Pure! ------------------------------------------------------------  We are positive we can save you money and give you the cleaning you deserve. Each proposal includes a list of our partners that would love to speak on our behalf regarding our affordability and dependability.   ** We're here big or small. ------------------------------------------------------------ We have experience working with all sorts of office spaces. From 500 square feet small business spaces all the way up to 100,000 square feet high rises.   ** If you're wondering how we can serve so many clients at once.. ------------------------------------------------------------ It's because we take care of our employee's! So when they learn about what we have to offer they stay! Our owner Daniel searches daily for individuals truly needing a job and does his best to motivate them to understand success comes with hard work and you must start at the bottom, but you have to start to move up! More than 20% of individuals under 25 years old do not have a job or any source of income. That number has raised every single year and is at the absolute highest it's ever been in history!     ** We are currently searching to offer once a week cleans for only $300 a month! ------------------------------------------------------------  We will deep clean your facility or office space once a week every week for just $300 a month. The payment can be paid once four cleans are completed. No contract. No scheduling. We will agree and set a time and day at your convenience to come perform the cleans! Receive a online proposal based off your approximate square feet (https://simplypurecleaning.us19.list-manage.com/track/click?u=a28ae248bdcd24e9e509fb56d&id=7609d37b7b&e=1f921ebc13) Check out our reviews on Google.  ============================================================ ** (https://simplypurecleaning.us19.list-manage.com/track/click?u=a28ae248bdcd24e9e509fb56d&id=da22ac4466&e=1f921ebc13) ** (https://simplypurecleaning.us19.list-manage.com/track/click?u=a28ae248bdcd24e9e509fb56d&id=4a0f9b45cc&e=1f921ebc13) ** (https://simplypurecleaning.us19.list-manage.com/track/click?u=a28ae248bdcd24e9e509fb56d&id=1559769cf6&e=1f921ebc13) Copyright © 2018. column2: Can You Trust a DIY Pregnancy Test? Yale OB/GYN Discusses What To Know
column3: Hi Stephanie?,  From the earliest moments of conception, your body is already starting to undergo monumental changes. One of the very first is production of the pregnancy hormone, hCG (human Chorionic Gonadotropin), which can be detected in your blood and in your urine.  With the rise in DIY pregnancy tests and at-home alternatives, Mary Jane Minkin, MD Clinical Professor, Obstetrics, Gynecology and Reproductive Sciences at Yale School of Medicine is available to discuss what women should know about how pregnancy tests work—explaining everything from false negatives to false positives and how soon after a missed period you can get an accurate reading.  Please let me know if I can put you in touch with her in the coming weeks.  Thanks,  Dara  Dara Shlifka  Global Communication Works  847-858-9933  dara@gcomworks.com    ______________________  If you would rather not receive future communications from Global Communication Works, please go to https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=JI3XGwl6BvjKk-2FipdOLyJRqWBmlRgMQWinaiZ-2BLdpTdLppdtFJkbzPlQbksQElRPywxtm2A4agRgmy7Eh9JNnBUAae0hXKe4FBBQcw0KYgJ998E5suEomTDdUWse3ibSMmg3MGb-2F9yqHS8jJ8mlp4PHU-2BfEmpddkI7V41ISOBnx365SFOeJ-2F4VpC9BsAs6lY_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs2NotFRSPR9waUdpifsh9fum0S5nv8R1ZfKjYVjOxz1xYJ-2BQD8DWdRD5oyJOo8DL2-2ByHQUlm0WkaZXs1lF5dfL8kZOvQw2kc-2FtHBCxdMHBljKo7jpeWHCsE-2FrJGp03W6XBTK7mSFVnY6NWwt3nsGbV0asf8OPU-2B7Urr4y-2BfAsmCy7TWIDZtL4R3saZ6s3mADlGaeYu33sNM1KUSDyuboAsMgsDVf-2FxPe8NJoUZN-2BW0aBVxVy3ElTCZoT8Z5rymv7aY-3D  Global Communication Works, 6114 Bayou Bridge, Houston, TX 77096 United States  --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to customerservice+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: Your Weekly eBook Deals Are Here!
column3: WaterBrook Multnomah     (http://l.e.waterbrookmultnomah.com/rts/go2.aspx?t=1705762&tp=i-H43-Q58-Plr-1iwjBQ-1o-LVVM-1c-1iwv0R-1KHVlg&x=2E066F15826E2B38E0534FD66B0AFA34)   (http://l.e.waterbrookmultnomah.com/rts/go2.aspx?t=1705763&tp=i-H43-Q58-Plr-1iwjBQ-1o-LVVM-1c-1iwv0R-1KHVlg&x=2E066F15826E2B38E0534FD66B0AFA34)   (http://l.e.waterbrookmultnomah.com/rts/go2.aspx?t=1705764&tp=i-H43-Q58-Plr-1iwjBQ-1o-LVVM-1c-1iwv0R-1KHVlg&x=2E066F15826E2B38E0534FD66B0AFA34)  Get these great eBooks from WaterBrook & Multnomah while you can! Available at a low price for a limited time. Find this weeks deals below.  $1.99 (reg. $9.99)  (http://l.e.waterbrookmultnomah.com/rts/go2.aspx?t=1705766&tp=i-H43-Q58-Plr-1iwjBQ-1o-LVVM-1c-1iwv0R-1KHVlg&x=2E066F15826E2B38E0534FD66B0AFA34)" data-link-name="9781601429070_bookcover  Discover the personal meaning and gladness you hunger for—without settling for normal!Every human wants to matter and be happy, which is as it should be. God made us to resemble and reflect His worth as we enjoy our true identity in Him.   But we too often swap that calling for the trifles of this world, pursuing cheap substitutes to fill the craving of our souls. As Jonathan Parnell puts it, we settle for “stupid normal” over the transcendent, even though this world can never satisfy our hopes and dreams.  $1.99 (reg. $11.99)  (http://l.e.waterbrookmultnomah.com/rts/go2.aspx?t=1705772&tp=i-H43-Q58-Plr-1iwjBQ-1o-LVVM-1c-1iwv0R-1KHVlg&x=2E066F15826E2B38E0534FD66B0AFA34)" data-link-name="9780307781666_bookcover  Brokenness Made BeautifulThe car accident that killed Abby Pattersons husband and daughter has left her with a limp and chronic pain. Still, Abby strikes out, determined to build a new life for herself away from her overbearing parents.Her perfect cottage home on the beach provides solace save for one tiny irritant: Marsh Winslow, her landlord. But when Abby witnesses a hit-and-run accident and she becomes a target, she and Marsh must join forces to uncover a dangerous secret. Together they discover that God is in the business of putting broken lives back together so that they are more beautiful than ever.  $1.99 (reg. $10.99)  (http://l.e.waterbrookmultnomah.com/rts/go2.aspx?t=1705778&tp=i-H43-Q58-Plr-1iwjBQ-1o-LVVM-1c-1iwv0R-1KHVlg&x=2E066F15826E2B38E0534FD66B0AFA34)" data-link-name="9780735290686_bookcover  A NYC pastor and global influencer inspires readers to find their most meaningful and purposeful life. Surprising to many, this life is not measured by success, comparison, or accolades. Rather, free and joyful living stems from a God-centered celebration of our union with Christ and the lives of those around us. Jon Tysons exploration of the reverse economy of the kingdom frees his readers from merit-based living...not just in terms of salvation, but daily, earthly value. Life is not meant to be a series of competitions or a survival of the fittest rat race. Yet so many of the messages around us and so many of the voices bombarding our hearts and minds tie up our value and package it with our accolades.  $1.99 (reg. $13.99)  (http://l.e.waterbrookmultnomah.com/rts/go2.aspx?t=1705784&tp=i-H43-Q58-Plr-1iwjBQ-1o-LVVM-1c-1iwv0R-1KHVlg&x=2E066F15826E2B38E0534FD66B0AFA34)" data-link-name="9780307785961_bookcover  Collision Course to Troubled WatersRancher Dan Jarrett doesnt trust most people, especially not his new stepfather. His widowed mother says it was love at first sight, but Dan is convinced the man is a con artist spending his mothers nest egg. And the only reason Dans going on the family holiday cruise is to gain time to prove his suspicions.After losing both of her parents to cancer, nurse Sunny Elders cherishes any time she can spend with her sisters family. Relaxing on a cruise filled with love and laughter sounds like the perfect prescription for healing. And Sunnys unsinkable spirit and penchant for zany disasters provide an ample dose of both.Before this hilarious high-sea adventure is over, these two stubborn hearts will hit the unfamiliar waters of trust—trust in each other and in the One who knows better than we ever could exactly what we need to be whole.  eBook sales run through 8/25/2019. Prices have been verified by WaterBrook & Multnomah before sending this email, but prices are subject to change without notice. Please make sure to check each eBook price at your preferred retailer before purchasing.        (http://l.e.waterbrookmultnomah.com/rts/go2.aspx?t=1705790&tp=i-H43-Q58-Plr-1iwjBQ-1o-LVVM-1c-1iwv0R-1KHVlg&x=2E066F15826E2B38E0534FD66B0AFA34)      (http://l.e.waterbrookmultnomah.com/rts/go2.aspx?t=1705791&tp=i-H43-Q58-Plr-1iwjBQ-1o-LVVM-1c-1iwv0R-1KHVlg&x=2E066F15826E2B38E0534FD66B0AFA34)      (http://l.e.waterbrookmultnomah.com/rts/go2.aspx?t=1705792&tp=i-H43-Q58-Plr-1iwjBQ-1o-LVVM-1c-1iwv0R-1KHVlg&x=2E066F15826E2B38E0534FD66B0AFA34)  (http://l.e.waterbrookmultnomah.com/rts/go2.aspx?t=1705793&tp=i-H43-Q58-Plr-1iwjBQ-1o-LVVM-1c-1iwv0R-1KHVlg&x=2E066F15826F2B38E0534FD66B0AFA34%7c2E066F15826E2B38E0534FD66B0AFA34)Click here to unsubscribe. column2: PSALM SPACE - PEG LUKE’S EXTRAORDINARY WORK NOW AVAILABLE
column3: To view this email online, paste this link into your browser: https://t.e2ma.net/message/nyd42b/neunlh       (https://t.e2ma.net/click/nyd42b/neunlh/f0p0ii)    For more information or to schedule an interview with Peg Luke, please contact Cindy Dupree of PLA Media at (615) 327-0100 or cindy.dupree@plamedia.com (mailto:cindy.dupree@plamedia.com).     For more information about New Day Christian Distribution, contact Nicole Gregory  at ngregory@daywind.com (mailto:ngregory@daywind.com).      Listen to the Psalm Space by clicking here (https://t.e2ma.net/click/nyd42b/neunlh/vsq0ii).   View the videos here (https://t.e2ma.net/click/nyd42b/neunlh/blr0ii).  FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE  CONTACT: Cindy Dupree  PHONE: (615) 327-0100  EMAIL: cindy.dupree@plamedia.com (mailto:cindy.dupree@plamedia.com)  PEG LUKE’S EXTRAORDINARY WORK “PSALM SPACE”   NOW AVAILABLE  “Holy Music with Healing Properties”  “Psalm Space,” the musical creation written by Peg Luke, composer and world-renowned flutist, is now available on Spotify, Pandora, Apple Music, as well as in many brick and mortar outlets nation-wide. “Psalm Space” interprets six popular Biblical Psalms, as well as new versions of “The Lord’s Prayer,” “Kum Bah Yah,” and more. Among other achievements, Peg Luke has performed 12 sold-out Carnegie Hall flute recitals.  The deeply spiritual music of “Psalm Space” was created to bring soul-nourishment to the masses. Purposely written using the French Taize technique, the sound creates a calming effect and gives listeners a chance to meditate, heal, emote kindness and peace. The work is meant to inspire relaxation and restoration, whether driving home from a hectic day at work or suffering a tragic loss.   “Psalm Space exists to bring hope and healing to people who need encouragement. Throughout the entire process, I quickly became aware of the power of this music to touch and help people,” Luke says. “It’s my gift to the world, and I am very grateful for all the people that made this vision a reality.”  “Psalm Space” was produced by multi-Grammy Award-winner, Neal Merrick Blackwood, is fully orchestrated and features popular soloists Lisa Bevill and Terry Blackwood. Adult and children’s choirs are highlights of the rich musical interpretations.    Each of the ten songs featured on “Psalm Space” have been visually interpreted and are available on Peg Luke’s You Tube channel here: PegLuke'sYouTube (https://t.e2ma.net/click/nyd42b/neunlh/rds0ii)  This release comes on the heels of Peg Luke signing a distribution deal with industry leader New Day Christian Distributors.   “We are absolutely thrilled that our team at New Day Christian Distribution gets to help take the beautiful musical project “Psalm Space,” by internationally-known flutist Peg Luke to the retail market, said Dusty Wells, director of sales, New Day. “This gorgeous project resonates beauty and peace when listening to it - one of those rare projects that you can start playing and let it repeat over and over. ‘Psalm Space’ contains simple and beautiful music to soothe the soul.”  For more information visit: PsalmSpace (https://t.e2ma.net/click/nyd42b/neunlh/75s0ii) or NewDayDistribution (https://t.e2ma.net/click/nyd42b/neunlh/nyt0ii).   # # #  About Peg Luke  Peg Luke began learning piano at the age of five and flute at the age of seven. She has certainly carved out her own original journey, utilizing not only her flute skills, but her piano and compositional skills as well. Luke attended Northern Illinois University, where she quickly won the coveted Concerto Competition during her sophomore year. While doing her Doctoral studies at the University of Minnesota, British flautist Geoffrey Gilbert sensed her innate connecction to the instrument and advised her to "go out and just play the flute."  Peg Luke has done just that, performing at Carnegie Hall (12 solo flute recitals), Cadogan Hall, the National Flute Convention, and many more. Peg and her husband Jack spent more than a year in Nashville to pursue her dream project "Psalm Space." Not only is this project composed by Peg and inspired by her favorite Psalms, she is also a featured performer on "Psalm Space." Luke has been working with multi-Grammy Award-winning producer, Neal Merrick Blackwood on "Psalm Space."       1303 16th Ave. S. | Nashville, TN 37212 US  This email was sent to journal@csps.com. column2: STORY/ prominent researcher: A Breakdown of How Love Helps Solve Some of the World’s Most Pressing Problems
column3: Stephanie? -  I thought you might be interested in checking out an article on the following topic:  Contrary to the theory of survival of the fittest, our human capacity for love actually played a major role in the emergence and survival of our species. And now, it can help us tackle major systemic problems that currently seem too big to conquer.  Systems scientist, cultural historian and international best-selling author Riane Eisler (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB-2BAqqCYgx-2BfQgHqPPqDF5yLvbXGFYz3STdR6mGpq2cAMUokgFbUTqLP-2F3TsIM3U7Sw-3D-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs0M-2Bw1-2FoFLPz0fE0y-2FpY3hPTYqFWXWKkUjpAui9KqhEGdvsN89CBWQv-2Bl430Y8N0yIBPXbdWc6LO9vYfVDya4WDtfXuJxIp2oAvG7oNvb-2BgKsdFrH1hGg9VQqD1XWdPwUlYzsZctgKxGpk6L1KmLfB3BlWHUc0S4-2B7EuDlHqlpAoFMjss7-2BfaVicFIgNF7xyFukuBhoI3bZvqKWr8KeVPTabAvoyHakEvKeztx-2Bs82GYUQdHsLAuzcgJk21GMAlzwI-3D (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB-2BAqqCYgx-2BfQgHqPPqDF5yLvbXGFYz3STdR6mGpq2cAMUokgFbUTqLP-2F3TsIM3U7Sw-3D-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs0M-2Bw1-2FoFLPz0fE0y-2FpY3hPTYqFWXWKkUjpAui9KqhEGdvsN89CBWQv-2Bl430Y8N0yIBPXbdWc6LO9vYfVDya4WDtfXuJxIp2oAvG7oNvb-2BgKl0R4CsXgjGmQSCOUXI2eNWPC8xeIqseGJq3k6SB3jNMnDYpp5kU7Xvl6T31Fw8wOektIXTl8vLlDry1GbMVJJ-2B-2BwK0BNgmS8vHYGbupKqP59KeukHZUXbwABPoghlVkSsGJ6evskH8iSnzoc-2BEVaog-3D has written an article explaining, from a scientific perspective, why exactly tapping into feelings of love and empathy can help us address life-or-death issues ranging from climate change to America’s mass shooting epidemic.  Drawing heavily on neuroscience and current theories in sociology, the article “Why Love Can Help End Poverty and Inequality - and Save Planet Earth” looks at how love contributes to the ability to transcend one’s self and and act in support of a greater common good, and how the extreme stress resulting from environments devoid of love and empathy can lead to conflict, violence, greed and disregard for the natural environment.  It also highlights the steps we can take to transform our current social system -- based on domination and top-down hierarchies --  into one based on partnership and equity.  Let me know if you’d be interested in taking a look at the article, speaking with Riane, or receiving a complimentary copy of her book.  - Emily    ______________________  If you would rather not receive future communications from BSPR, please go to https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=mAHw-2B8ZZluKmvldupnv96uLo9Y9fajlVzzV3E2AQMMy3o0jRx7vDS35Oho-2BRYwxVM-2F-2BL7LaoyWUUZGT3ACwSPBwlgo0uuDSIyxjZqd-2BaEhony4TZRFkrkoK3IO8mpNYNcCChFvKo7c8IoPYNqRD1M-2BeZ1x60LcauLKOeE-2FDPChc-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs0M-2Bw1-2FoFLPz0fE0y-2FpY3hPTYqFWXWKkUjpAui9KqhEGdvsN89CBWQv-2Bl430Y8N0yIBPXbdWc6LO9vYfVDya4WDtfXuJxIp2oAvG7oNvb-2BgKve6eDwRaVn29cC3VMgnKodYgkesZdO-2BNoOdka-2FiAV0sHfhufsQ-2FJw05hR-2FaqBQYMjx4tQ84R-2BVH6L4dq05P2NecuS4-2F-2FBcGu7RRsJ-2F254lGANYHjD1cPxROgdqxgXoG0i2wcQrHqYP4J4w0zJrpex4-3D  BSPR, 18 Main Street, Extension, Suite 409, Plymouth, MA 02360 United States  --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to customerservice+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: We’re hiring young leaders! Please help us spread the word...
column3: Applications now open for Fall 2019 Fellowships  About RespectAbility | Contact Us The National Leadership Program  Fall 2019 Fellowships - We're Hiring!  Dear Stephanie,  As someone with a disability myself who knows that well-prepared and passionate leaders with disabilities are needed at decision-making tables, I wanted to share a key opportunity with you. We’re looking for talented people with disabilities and their allies who have an interest in public service, running for office, advocating on Capitol Hill, working at a non-profit, or working in Hollywood or media. Our unique National Leadership Program is an intensive Fall internship and training program that places people with disabilities and their allies on the fast track to careers in policy, communications or nonprofit management. Fellows work with mentors and professional staff, strengthening skills in advocacy and leadership as well as get hands-on training in public speaking, writing, social media and networking. The Fellowship enables our young leaders to gain critical skills to jumpstart their careers in public policy, media or advocacy. Alumni of the program have gone on to work at the White House, Congress, advocacy organizations, foundations, The World Bank and elsewhere. Depending on the area of focus that they choose, National Leadership Fellows will have the chance to:  Enable diverse people with disabilities to get the skills and jobs they need for a better future. Fight implicit bias and stigmas by promoting positive and accurate portrayals of people with disabilities in TV, films and the news media. Educate philanthropists and nonprofits about how they can include people with disabilities equally in their work. Reach out to candidates for Senate, Governor and the Presidency in a nonpartisan way that will encourage key conversations about issues that impact the 56 million people in America who live with a disability. Include people with disabilities in faith communities.  There are opportunities for both paid and unpaid Fellowships. Paid fellows make $15 an hour and we hire nine of them each year. Unpaid fellows receive a monthly transportation stipend of $300. Lunch is provided daily for all Fellows. In addition, all Fellows participate in special presentations by guest speakers, get personal coaching on their writing and resumes, meet with elected officials and participate in strategic communications workshops.  Applicants must fill out the linked Google Doc Form and send their resume and cover letter to BenS@RespectAbility.org!  The Fall 2019 Fellowship starts on September 4th. If you're interested, send us your application soon so you don't miss out on this opportunity! Respectfully, Ben Spangenberg National Leadership Program Director, RespectAbility  Learn More  About RespectAbility  |  The National Leadership Program  RespectAbility  |  11333 Woodglen Drive, #102  |  Rockville, MD 20852  |  202-517-6272  (C) 2019 UNSUBSCRIBE   LEARN MORE   VOLUNTEER WITH US     -- To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to customerservice+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: Review Copies: Fall Books Help Kids & Families With Stress, Anxiety, & Compromise
column3: Good Morning Stephanie,   While it is arguably the most rewarding job in the world, raising children can be hard—especially in 2019. The issues parents and teachers must guide kids through can be tricky, and unfortunately don’t come with a road map. Boys Town Press recognizes the joys and challenges that communities and families face when helping to raise children. Their books for elementary- and middle school-aged readers are unparalleled in terms of providing entertaining guidance through these tough situations. Helping to confront a wide variety of challenging issues – anxiety, peer relationships, self-monitoring, stress – Boys Town Press titles rely on lively illustrations and relatable characters to make their stories fun and accessible.    Would you be interested in review copies of any of the below titles or an interview/contributed piece from any of the the authors?  · Parker Plum and the Journey through the CATacombs by Billie Pavicic, illustrated by Madeline Timm (August 6, 2019). Parker Plum is back, leading a fantastical adventure through the Metropolitan Mummy Museum that helps him explore, celebrate his own strengths, and work through feelings of envy toward his new classmate.   · Freddie & Friends: Becoming Unstuck by Kimberly Delude, illustrated by Brian Martin (August 20, 2019). In the next installment in this popular series, readers meet Betsy, a beetle who is so pestered by her worry bug that she sometimes gets stuck! With the help of her friends and a new system, she’s able to move forward and find her confidence. · The Great Compromise by Julia Cook, illustrated by Kyle Merriman (September 3, 2019). Cora June is back, and she’s just as spunky and ambitious as ever! This time around, she has very specific ideas about how things should go. But her classmate Wilson also has specific ideas that just so happen to be different from hers. With the help of their teacher, both must learn the very important skill of compromise. · Stress Stinks by Bryan Smith, illustrated by Lisa M. Griffin (September 17, 2019). Between softball practice, homework, and chores, poor Amelia is feeling stressed out. And stress is hard! Luckily, Amelia’s mom is around to teach Amelia some strategies to reframe her thinking and help her through her stressed-out situation.  · How Did You Miss That? by Bryan Smith, illustrated by Lisa M. Griffin (October 8, 2019). The latest installment in the Executive FUNction series follows Braden as he learns the importance of self-monitoring and some good strategies to help him slow down, recognize (and prevent!) mistakes, and stay on track.  Thanks so much for your consideration! Hope you're having a great week.  Warmly,  Emma  About Boys Town Press:  Boys Town Press publishes children’s and educational books, and produces resources for educators, parents, counselors, and youth-serving professionals, all in line with Boys Town’s goal of “Saving Children, Healing Families.” Boys Town Press is a division of Father Flanagan’s Boys’ Home, a mission-driven organization that works in diverse communities with the highest-need children and their families. column2: dépêches du 13 Août 2019
column3: Dépêches du 13 Août 2019  Image  Récapitulatif des dépêches du 13 Août 2019:  1. Togo : Quand l'IFAD d'Elavagnon fascine le gouverneur Phil Bryant ; 2. Vers la mise en place d’un mécanisme de prévention et de gestion de vulnérabilité liée au chômage et au sous-emploi au Togo; 3. Le siège de l’UNREC à Lomé abrite une formation sur la gestion efficace des armes et munition; 4. La présidence de l’Université de Lomé dément les rumeurs sur l’augmentation des droits d’inscription à l’Université de Lomé.  Image  Togo : Quand l'IFAD d'Elavagnon fascine le gouverneur Phil Bryant  Lomé, le 13 Août 2019-  "J'ai vu un centre de formation remarquable et très formidable. Nous savons tous que l'agriculture et l'aquaculture sont très importants pour le développement d'un pays. C'est un centre qui a une technologie haut de gamme et vous devez en être fiers". C'est la conviction de Phil Bryant après  avoir parcouru les différents compartiments de l'Institut de formation en alternance pour le développement (IFAD) en Aquaculture d'Elavagnon. En compagnie de Mme Yawa Tsegan Djigbodi, la Présidente de l'Assemblée nationale togolaise, de ministres et de la conseillère spéciale Reckya Madougou, ce mardi 13 août 2019, le Gouverneur de l'Etat de Mississippi est allé s'enquérir des réalités de ce centre inauguré en juin 2019 par le Président de la République Togolaise, Faure Gnassingbé.  A pas de charge, l'officiel américain a visité les bâtiments de l'internat, les étangs, l'écloserie, les équipements de pré grossissement et de grossissement, les appareils de transformation, le restaurant, la salle informatique et les salles de classe numérisées. "Vous avez des technologies très avancées", s'est exclamé Phil Bryant quand, dans l'une des salles de classe d'une quinzaine d'apprenants, il a été procédé à la résolution d'une équation mathématique à deux inconnues. Le problème posé portait sur un fait concret : un fermier qui devrait faire des calculs sur l'achat d'alevins. A ce niveau, comme à tous les autres, l'étonnement du gouverneur de l'Etat de Mississippi était grand.  Il sera davantage étonné quand le Ministre de l'agriculture, de la production animale et halieutique appuyé par d'autres personnalités, lui ont expliqué la stratégie dans laquelle s'inscrit la création de cet IFAD, le premier sur les dix prévus . D'ailleurs, le second est en construction dans le septentrion et sera consacré à l'élevage, a expliqué le Ministre Koutéra Bataka. Il a surtout développé la stratégie d'actions qui positionne les IFAD dans la réalisation des axes 1 et 2 du Plan national de développement 2018-2022.  A l'IFAD d'Elavagnon, les 60 apprenants en formation proviennent de toutes les régions du pays. L'appel à candidatures est déjà lancé pour recruter la deuxième promotion. L'idée étant de former le maximum de jeunes à l'aquaculture, un sous-secteur porteur, a fait savoir le directeur de l'IFAD d'Elavagnon.  Image  Vers la mise en place d’un mécanisme de prévention et de gestion de vulnérabilité liée au chômage et au sous-emploi au Togo  Lomé, le 13 Août 2019-  Le Ministère de l’action sociale, de la promotion de la femme et de l’alphabétisation a organisé ce mardi 13 août 2019 à Lomé, un atelier de réflexion sur l’état de vulnérabilité des jeunes liés au chômage et au sous-emploi au Togo.  Les travaux de l’atelier ont été ouverts par Koffi GANI, Directeur de Cabinet du Ministère de l’Action Sociale, de la Promotion de la Femme et de l’Alphabétisation.  Cette rencontre organisée en collaboration avec la Coalition nationale pour l’emploi des jeunes fait suite à une étude réalisée par le gouvernement en vue d’en savoir davantage sur la vulnérabilité des jeunes en situation de chômage.  Les résultats de cette étude qui ont fait l’objet de discussion au cours de cet atelier, serviront dans le cadre du projet de « mise en place d’un mécanisme de prévention et de gestion de vulnérabilité liée au chômage et au sous-emploi au Togo », qui constitue selon les organisateurs la première étape vers l’élaboration d’une politique nationale sur le sous-emploi et le chômage des jeunes au Togo.  Pour Pascal TCHILTEME, chargé de mission au Ministère en charge de l’Action Sociale, le Togo enregistre l’un des plus bas taux de chômage dans la sous-région. Mais des poches de vulnérabilité existent, impliquant des chômeurs de longue durée, des travailleurs en fin de contrat et de ceux ayant perdu leur emploi.  La démarche entreprise va donc permettre au Ministère en charge de l’Action Sociale, de consolider le développement social et renforcer les mécanismes d’inclusion comme le recommande le Plan National de Développement (PND) dans son axe 3.  Rappelons que toujours en faveur des jeunes sans emploi, le Ministère de la fonction publique a aussi lancé le 30 juillet dernier à Lomé, un nouveau projet dénommé, Programme d’adaptation professionnelle et d’aide à la création d’emplois.  Ce programme vise à promouvoir l’entrepreneuriat des jeunes ainsi que leur insertion dans la vie active. Il est dédié aux diplômés en quête d’emploi de longue durée et a pour spécificité, de les aider à créer leurs propres activités génératrices de revenus, ce qui pourra contribuer à diminuer le taux du sous-emploi dans le pays.  Image   Le siège de l’UNREC à Lomé abrite une formation sur la gestion efficace des armes et munition     Lomé, le 13 Août 2019-   Le Centre régional des Nations Unies pour la paix et le désarmement en Afrique (UNREC) a ouvert, lundi 12 août 2019 à Lomé, un atelier de formation de (04) jours à l'intention des praticiens du désarmement.  Cet atelier s'inscrit dans le cadre du projet « Désarmement, démobilisation et réinsertion » (DDR), qui vise à aider les professionnels du désarmement à gérer efficacement les armes et les munitions.  « Dans le cadre de leur travail, les experts du DDR sont amenés à travailler avec des ex-combattants qui parfois dans le cadre du processus de démobilisation ramènent des armes. Il convient donc que le personnel des Nations Unies soit entraîné et formé de façon adéquate pour une manipulation correcte de ce matériel qui peut être dangereux », a fait savoir Anselme YABOURI, Directeur de l'UNREC.  La formation est prévue en (02) deux phases. L'une théorique et l'autre, pratique. La partie théorique se déroule au siège de l'UNREC basé à Lomé du 12 au 14 août 2019 et la phase pratique est prévue pour les 15 et 16 août 2019 au Kofi Annan International Peacekeeping Training Centre (KAIPTC) au Ghana.  Cet atelier est conjointement organisé par le Département des opérations de paix des Nations Unies (DPO) et le Bureau des affaires de désarmement (ODA), avec l'appui financier de l'Ambassade de la République Fédérale d'Allemagne au Togo.  Image   La présidence de l’Université de Lomé dément les rumeurs sur l’augmentation des droits d’inscription à l’Université de Lomé       Lomé, le 13 Août 2019-   La semaine dernière, la présidence de l’Université de Lomé a communiqué les conditions pour bénéficier des nouvelles offres de formation en Licence professionnelle pour le compte de la prochaine rentrée.  Une sortie qui a suscité une polémique.  Ce mardi 13 août 2019, le président de l’Université de Lomé, le Prof Dodzi Kokoroko a tenu à démentir les rumeurs sur une possible augmentation des frais d’inscription des étudiants à l’Université de Lomé.  Dans un nouveau communiqué, Prof Dodzi Kokoroko précise que pour s’inscrire à l’université de Lomé pour le compte de l’année académique 2019-2020, les étudiants payeront les mêmes droits que ceux en vigueur l’année dernière.  « Les bacheliers désirant s’inscrire à l’université de Lomé en 2019-2020, en Licence professionnelle, paieront les mêmes droits d’inscription que ceux en vigueur au titre de l’année universitaire 2018-2019. Autrement dit, les droits d’inscription dans les anciennes Licences professionnelles restent sans changement », précise le document.  Toujours dans la note, le président de l’Université de Lomé précise toutefois que pour bénéficier des nouvelles offres de formation de Licence professionnelle qui s’ouvrent à compter de la nouvelle année universitaire, il faut débourser un peu plus.  « Seules les nouvelles offres de formation de Licence professionnelle prévues pour s’ouvrir pour compter de l’année universitaire 2019-2020, sont concernées par les nouveaux droits d’inscription tels que fixés par l’arrêté n° 113/UL/P/SG/2018 du 06 novembre 2018, fixant le montant des frais de formation professionnelle dans le grade de Licence à l’université de Lomé, notamment en son article 5 », explique le patron de l’Université de Lomé.  Les droits d’inscription annuels pour les nouvelles licences professionnelles sont fixés à 211.000 F CFA pour les étudiants, 321.000 FCFA pour les salariés et 576.000 FCFA pour les étrangers et zone hors UEMOA. Une mesure qui n’avait pas bien été comprise. D’aucuns avaient vite vu une augmentation exponentielle des frais d’inscription pour exclure les nouveaux bacheliers togolais. A noter que la prochaine rentrée pour les étudiants de l’Université de Lomé est prévue au mois d’octobre prochain.  Contact : depeches@autogo.tg (mailto:depeches@autogo.tg)    ______________________  If you would rather not receive future communications from AUTOGO, please go to https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQBz2p53T0v-2BoEIvbo6vDi8C-2FTvEwN-2BReXh3EeiyDrCmqwMJ5fT84rxqUfn89WBhoJbvonmZp0Rlng3Xy7Ml-2BcjAM0JsjxMbpg06QMpdDVJwzijBTgLaHqjVFxOdwMqibaZQ1giBdD5O0v3jJMkN66iAE-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs1RGhoGZjKg8-2F1zffQwtgs7z3fp5K49QTL-2B23ataCFiC54ZUXs8WYZCP2bV35vcqzbGDC5Uh9VWS8rS8Tg8E3mPsnByM4wXQzP-2BWLqx4nMmvr-2BF-2FaeJKfj-2Bpw7-2B40xZjj0CqTeDuP59Q2U3HD6hfOCXLm-2Fc1j3e-2F-2BBsv87JfmHLOT8iJMIXJmcx7MH1ETngI-2FGxgSI9x3FVAaI-2B94WnA8Ty3IvXENTi2gN2os7Lr-2BbPdfN0kfCxD8QdPBxmNNa-2F5l0-3D  AUTOGO, 9129, LOME-PORT, . . column2: Conspiracy Theories, by Quassim Cassim   -  (REVIEW COPY? INTERVIEW REQUESTS?)
column3: Publishing November 8, 2019   ** ------------------------------------------------------------  9/11 was an inside job. The Holocaust is a myth promoted to serve Jewish interests. The shootings at Sandy Hook Elementary School were a false flag operation. Climate change is a hoax perpetrated by the Chinese government.  These are all conspiracy theories. A glance online or at bestseller lists reveals how popular some of them are. Even if there is plenty of evidence to disprove them, people persist in propagating them. Why? Philosopher Quassim Cassam explains how conspiracy theories are different from ordinary theories about conspiracies. He argues that conspiracy theories are forms of propaganda and their function is to promote apolitical agenda. Although conspiracy theories are sometimes defended on the grounds that they uncover evidence of bad behaviour by political leaders, they do much more harm than good, with some resulting in the deaths of large numbers of people.  There can be no clearer indication that something has gone wrong with our intellectual and political culture than the fact that conspiracy theories have become mainstream. When they are dangerous, we cannot afford to ignore them. At the same time, refuting them by rational argument is difficult because conspiracy theorists discount or reject evidence that disproves their theories. As conspiracy theories are so often smokescreens for political ends, we need to come up with political as well as intellectual responses if we are to have any hope of defeating them.  The Author:  Quassim Cassam is Professor of Philosophy at the University of Warwick. column2: Editorial comments and corrections
column3: The following information was collected:  Name: John  Email: robledoint@yahoo.com  Subscriber: No  Subject: Game Over : New  FBI Data Completely Destroy Myths About Gun Homicide In The US  Product: csmonitor.com  Message: Game Over: New FBI Data Completely Destroys Myths About Gun Homicide In The US  (Tea Party PAC) – The most recent FBI data on crime statistics illustrates a pattern of homicide in our country that completely destroys the gun-grabbers’ narrative on firearm homicide.  More Americans were killed in 2017 with hammers and clubs than were killed with rifles of any kind.  And yet they want to ban our AR-15s?!  In September 2018, Breitbart News reported on the most recent numbers, those from 2017.  These figures showed that 467 people were killed by “blunt objects (hammers, clubs, etc.),” while 403 were killed with rifles.  And it must be noted that the category of “rifles” used by the FBI includes bolt action, pump action, single shot, and semi-automatic, as well as those the left describes as “assault weapons.” This means only a percentage of the 403 deaths attributed to “rifles” would have been carried out with an “assault weapon.” So the gap between the number of persons beaten to death with hammers and clubs verses those killed with “assault weapons” would be even greater than the gap between those who died in a hammer/club attack versus those who died being shot with “rifles” of any kind.  Breitbart News also reported that the 2017 crime figures showed 1,591 people were killed with “knives or cutting instruments” while 403 were killed with “rifles.” This means nearly four times as many people were stabbed to death as were killed with any kind of rifle. (The gap between the number stabbed to death and the number of persons explicitly killed with an “assault weapon” would be even greater.)  Meanwhile, Democrats are pushing a ban on “assault weapons” while Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (RINO-KY) says that legislation for such a ban would be “front and center” when the Senate reconvenes.  This week, US District Judge Josephine Staton of the Central District of California ruled that the Second Amendment does not mean that semiautomatic “killing machines” need to be legal in California.  Stanton’s ruling against “semiautomatic rifles with non-fixed magazines” came in response to a California Rifle and Pistol Association (CRPA) challenge on the state’s so-called “assault weapons” ban.  CRPA sought a summary judgement on the “assault weapons” ban on behalf of Plaintiff Steve Rupp, which was rejected by Stanton.  Instead, she characterized “semiautomatic rifles with non-fixed magazines” as “killing machines” which “are essentially indistinguishable from M-16s.”  The judge is clearly overlooking the fact that M-16s are fully automatic firearms, which can fire a full magazine of bullets per one trigger depression.  This is a huge difference from the AR-15, a semiautomatic rifle, which fire one round per trigger pull, and that’s all they’re capable of.  Her position is consistent with that of California Attorney General Xavier Becerra, who argued that “[a]ssault rifles may be banned because they are, like the M-16, ‘weapons that are most useful in military service’; and ‘they are also not “in common use” for lawful purposes like self-defense.’”  Stanton declared that a ban on M-16s can stand under scrutiny of District of Columbia v. Heller (2008), because these guns are “outside the scope of the Second Amendment.”  “Thus, if a weapon is essentially the same as the M-16, it is not protected by the Second Amendment merely because gun manufacturers have given it a different model number and dubbed it a ‘civilian rifle.’”  On July 11, 2019, Breitbart News reported a Florida homeowner used an AR-15 to stop four alleged intruders. He killed two and was shot and wounded by gunfire from the alleged invaders as well. On March 28, 2017, NBC News reported that a homeowner’s son used an AR-15 to fend off three alleged intruders and on May 13, 2014, Breitbart News reported that North Carolina homeowner used a AR-15 to defend himself against a suspect who kicked in the door of his house. Over nine million AR-style rifles were manufactured for U.S. sales during the Obama administration and ATF Associate Deputy Director Ronald Turk used a 2017 “White Paper” to explain that AR-15s are now the go-to gun for hunting, sport shooting, and other interests.  The Washington Post quoted Turk, saying, “The use of AR-15s, AK-style, and similar rifles now commonly referred to as ‘modern sporting rifles’ has increased exponentially in sport shooting. These firearm types are now standard for hunting activities. ATF could re-examine its 20-year-old study to bring it up to date with the sport shooting landscape of today, which is vastly different than it was years ago.”  The case is Rupp v. Becerra, No. 8:17-cv-00746 in the U.S. District Court for Central California.

column2: Lucky the TurfMutt Gives a “Paw Up” in Support of This Weekend’s National “Clear the Shelters” Day
column3: Hi,  The 5th annual Clear the Shelters, (https://www.cleartheshelters.com/) a nationwide pet adoption drive to help find loving homes for animals in need, is this Saturday, August 17, and Lucky the TurfMutt, the spokesdog for the TurfMutt environmental stewardship and education program, is giving a “paw up” in support of this important event.  For more than a decade Lucky has proudly worn his superhero cape as TurfMutt (http://www.turfmutt.com) , the national and award-winning spokesdog for OPEI’s environmental stewardship program for kids and their families. In addition to promoting the importance of our living landscapes, Lucky wants every pet to have the same chance at happily ever after that he received.  Kind Regards,  Debbi Mayster  On Behalf of OPEI and TurfMutt  240.988.6243  Lucky the TurfMutt Gives a “Paw Up” in Support of This Weekend’s National “Clear the Shelters” Day  Alexandria, VA (August 16, 2019) – The 5th annual Clear the Shelters (https://www.cleartheshelters.com/) , a nationwide pet adoption drive to help find loving homes for animals in need, is this Saturday, August 17, and Lucky the TurfMutt, the spokesdog for the TurfMutt environmental stewardship and education program (http://www.turfmutt.com) , is giving a “paw up” in support of this important event.  Lucky, a real-life rescue dog, knows how hard life can be for pets who have no home. More than 10 years ago, his human friend, Kris Kiser, President and CEO of the Outdoor Power Equipment Institute (http://www.opei.org) , rescued him from an Indiana roadway, gave him a home and a big job. For more than a decade Lucky has proudly worn his superhero cape as TurfMutt, the national and award-winning spokesdog for OPEI’s environmental stewardship program for kids and their families. In addition to promoting the importance of our living landscapes, Lucky wants every pet to have the same chance at happily ever after that he received.  “Lucky’s mission has always been to ‘paw it forward’ whenever he gets the chance to help all dogs and especially “hard-to-place” pets in shelters across the country,” says Kris Kiser, President of the Outdoor Power Equipment Institute’s foundation, which is the creative force behind the TurfMutt program. “We encourage everyone to consider joining Lucky the TurfMutt this Saturday to support or adopt pets who have had a hard time finding their ‘forever homes.’”  The TurfMutt program, celebrating its 10th anniversary this year, teaches students in grades K–8 to care for our living landscapes and appreciate their benefits. The program’s educational materials, available at www.TurfMutt.com (http://www.turfmutt.com) , are free and support Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM) standards. The TurfMutt environmental education program has reached 70 million students, teachers, and families since 2009.  TurfMutt’s focus on environmental stewardship and best practices for water use and landscape maintenance have been widely accepted among educators, youth and families as well as listed as a resource by the U.S. Department of Education’s Green Ribbon Schools, the U.S. Department of Energy, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Green Apple, the Center for Green Schools, the Outdoors Alliance for Kids, the National Energy Education Development (NEED) project, Climate Change Live, Petfinder and the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service.   The TurfMutt Educational materials can be found on the US Green Building Council’s Global Learning Lab, and Lucky the TurfMutt can be seen teaching his lessons about the value of landscaping and green space to our families and communities on CBS Saturday morning television.  About OPEI  The Outdoor Power Equipment Institute (OPEI) is an international trade association representing power equipment, small engine, utility vehicle, golf car and personal transport vehicle manufacturers and suppliers. OPEI is the advocacy voice of the industry, and a recognized Standards Development Organization for the American National Standards Institute (ANSI) and active internationally through the International Standards Organization (ISO) and the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC) in the development of safety and performance standards. OPEI is managing partner of GIE+EXPO, the industry’s annual international trade show, and the creative force behind the environmental education program www.TurfMutt.com (http://www.turfmutt.com) OPEI-Canada represents members on a host of issues, including recycling, emissions and other regulatory developments across the Canadian provinces.  ______________________ If you would rather not receive future communications from The Outdoor Power Equipment Institute, please go to http://FourLeafPublicRelations.pr-optout.com/OptOut.aspx?2240313x36785x72321x1x4584030x24000x6&Email=customerservice%40csmonitor.com. column2: Your account was under attack! Change your credentials!
column3: Hello!  I am a hacker who has access to your operating system. I also have full access to your account.  I've been watching you for a few months now. The fact is that you were infected with malware through an adult site that you visited.  If you are not familiar with this, I will explain. Trojan Virus gives me full access and control over a computer or other device. This means that I can see everything on your screen, turn on the camera and microphone, but you do not know about it.  I also have access to all your contacts and all your correspondence.  Why your antivirus did not detect malware? Answer: My malware uses the driver, I update its signatures every 4 hours so that your antivirus is silent.  I made a video showing how you satisfy yourself in the left half of the screen, and in the right half you see the video that you watched. With one click of the mouse, I can send this video to all your emails and contacts on social networks. I can also post access to all your e-mail correspondence and messengers that you use.  If you want to prevent this, transfer the amount of $500 to my bitcoin address (if you do not know how to do this, write to Google: "Buy Bitcoin").  My bitcoin address (BTC Wallet) is:  3KbEcqrtS4MK9BW4GcifxjTcYtH9Nsdagp  After receiving the payment, I will delete the video and you will never hear me again. I give you 50 hours (more than 2 days) to pay. I have a notice reading this letter, and the timer will work when you see this letter.  Filing a complaint somewhere does not make sense because this email cannot be tracked like my bitcoin address. I do not make any mistakes.  If I find that you have shared this message with someone else, the video will be immediately distributed. column2: Here's your monthly update on small business benefits
column3: Hi Janyce,  As a trusted advisor, we wanted to help keep you posted on upcoming small business health benefit options and provide you with an avenue to help friends and clients today.  What's up in Washington?  Trump to Unveil Drug Price Index in September Health-Care Speech (https://www.peoplekeep.com/e2t/sc2/MmZ-8ykmZ5CW98pf2-5fgWnsW6K9jF08wkf5_W2P7TPd5--FfLdBzP8M04 ) : In his upcoming speech, President Trump will likely reveal his plans to reduce drug prices, overhaul Medicaid, and expand access to individual insurance plans for employees.  Data shows drop in coverage among people ineligible for ObamaCare subsidies (https://www.peoplekeep.com/e2t/sc2/MmZ-8ykmZ5CW98pf2-5fgWnsW6K9jF08wkf5_W2P7TPd5--FfLdBzP8N04 ) : Health insurance enrollment has increased between 2017 and 2018 for people eligible for premium tax subsidies. However, enrollment has shrunk during the same time period for those who don't qualify, largely due to increased premium costs. Does that mean ObamaCare isn't working?  Small business benefit reads  Considerations for 2020 Health Benefits Planning (https://www.peoplekeep.com/e2t/sc2/MmZ-8ykmZ5CW98pf2-5fgWnsW6K9jF08wkf5_W2P7TPd5--FfLdBzP8P04 ) : Health benefits can be complicated. This PlanSponsor article outlines all the compliance measures that companies need to take when offering health benefits, including HRAs, in 2020.  U.S. Employers Shifting Toward Variable Compensation and Customized Benefits to Hold Annual Salary Increases Below 3 Percent (https://www.peoplekeep.com/e2t/sc2/MmZ-8ykmZ5CW98pf2-5fgWnsW6K9jF08wkf5_W2P7TPd5--FfLdBzP8Q04 ) : Employers are looking for options to keep salaries low, largely in response to rising health insurance costs.  The ICHRA and premium tax credits: What are the rules? (https://www.peoplekeep.com/e2t/sc2/MmZ-8ykmZ5CW98pf2-5fgWnsW6K9jF08wkf5_W2P7TPd5--FfLdBzP8R04 ) : Some health plans need to coordinate carefully with premium tax credits, and the upcoming individual coverage HRA is no exception. Our new blog post goes over the regulations.  QSEHRA customer quote  I didn't have health insurance when the company I work for started using PeopleKeep, so I was very excited to learn about it. Right after we got the benefit, I got very severe bronchitis. If I wouldn't have had my people keep benefit, there's no way I could have afforded the $650 doctor's visit. It has been a blessing and a life saver!  Kathryn Neel Patient Care Coordinator Brooks Hearing  PeopleKeep snippets  PeopleKeep and LIG Solutions announce health benefits partnership (https://www.peoplekeep.com/e2t/sc2/MmZ-8ykmZ5CW98pf2-5fgWnsW6K9jF08wkf5_W2P7TPd5--FfLdBzP8S04 ) : We've teamed up with LIG Solutions, a division of Lighthouse Insurance Group, to make it easier for associations, societies, and other affinity groups to provide meaningful health benefits.  We're still looking for referrals! (https://www.peoplekeep.com/e2t/sc2/MmZ-8ykmZ5CW98pf2-5fgWnsW6K9jF08wkf5_W2P7TPd5--FfLdBzP8T04 ) If a client or friend is a small business looking to implement health benefits, we'd love to help.  REFER NOW (https://www.peoplekeep.com/e2t/sc2/MmZ-8ykmZ5CW98pf2-5fgWnsW6K9jF08wkf5_W2P7TPd5--FfLdBzP8V04 )  PeopleKeep, Inc. 480 E. Winchester St. Suite 230 Salt Lake City, UT 84107 USA  You received this email because you are subscribed to Free health benefits and health reform resources from PeopleKeep, Inc..  Update your email preferences (https://www.peoplekeep.com/hs/manage-preferences/unsubscribe?d=Vnb1Qq5bfmlFW43VqYY3H90QMW4cpF0345V723W43T2Qk22MP-bVNw7qH8Vqwh4N57lf97C_7qXW8mGsKG5Rjyj5W8w0VHJ1FY6pbN7jDJDWT473WW84Hf2036Hbx-W8VLsB19cGF2k0&v=3&_hsenc=p2ANqtz--7vfJqVUkjbT77O3iYPUs1_eVzDX6f3FKHS7AZm54bLh-gvUtAEeJ_ZDFZ6OkxUZwBKhI5QPY6oimWB56wUJkBG1lB9g&_hsmi=75642794 ) to choose the types of emails you receive.  Unsubscribe from all future emails (https://www.peoplekeep.com/hs/manage-preferences/unsubscribe-all?d=Vnb1Qq5bfmlFW43VqYY3H90QMW4cpF0345V723W43T2Qk22MP-bVNw7qH8Vqwh4N57lf97C_7qXW8mGsKG5Rjyj5W8w0VHJ1FY6pbN7jDJDWT473WW84Hf2036Hbx-W8VLsB19cGF2k0&v=3&_hsenc=p2ANqtz--7vfJqVUkjbT77O3iYPUs1_eVzDX6f3FKHS7AZm54bLh-gvUtAEeJ_ZDFZ6OkxUZwBKhI5QPY6oimWB56wUJkBG1lB9g&_hsmi=75642794 )

column2: PLACEMENT
column3: Dear Sir/ Madam,  I am Mr. Daniel Alfonso Gomez, an Independent Non-Executive Director &  Audit Committee here in Spain. During audit of Bank Accounts, Safe  Deposit Facilities and other Financial Instrument, I discovered a  concealed vault (Safe Deposit Box) with large amount of funds domiciled  in a storage facility as revealed by the deposit dossiers.    The said vault was unveiled to belongs to one of our Foreign Deceased  Customer(Mr. Wang Jian), The Co-founder and Co-chairman of HNA Group, a  Chinese conglomerate with significant real estate ownerships across the  U.S., died in an accident while on a business trip in France.  Please go through this  link:https://observer.com/2018/07/wang-jian-hna-founder-dies-tragic-fall/  I am writing to request your placement as Heir/Beneficiary to the  deceased (Mr. Wang Jian) Foreign Business Partner. Meanwhile, prior my  correspondence with you, all efforts to contact the next of kin or  family relation to the deceased person has proved abortive.  As a seasoned professional I have done extensive research, thus can  guarantee the application process as viable with no risk involved. Upon  your consideration and acceptance of this offer with kin interest;  detailed information will be forwarded swiftly. Following my position; I  can guarantee successful transmission of the funds to you only if we can  secure a good deal.  Cordially, Mr. Daniel Alfonso Gomez  --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to daily+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: Amtrak and MassDOT Promote Rail Safety and Begin Test Runs for New Valley Flyer Passenger Train Service
column3: FOR PLANNING PURPOSES ONLY  August 14, 2019    Amtrak and MassDOT Promote Rail Safety and Begin Test Runs for New Valley Flyer Passenger Train Service  Trains will travel on the Knowledge Corridor making stops in Greenfield, Northampton, Holyoke and Springfield    SPRINGFIELD, MA - Amtrak is announcing rail safety education efforts are underway as it begins running test trains in preparation for the launch of the Amtrak Valley Flyer<https://trainsinthevalley.org/valley-flyer/> pilot train service between Greenfield and Springfield, MA.    The two-year pilot Valley Flyer passenger train service, expected to begin at the end of August, will travel along the Connecticut River, a region referred to as the Knowledge Corridor, with trains making station stops in Springfield, Holyoke, Northampton and Greenfield. Amtrak currently runs service along this rail corridor, with its Vermonter train, which connects St. Albans, Vermont to Washington, D.C.    Through Friday, August 23, Amtrak will be running 1-2 round trips in overnight hours Monday through Fridays, leaving Springfield between 11:00 and 11:30 p.m., traveling to Greenfield and returning to Springfield at approximately 5:00 a.m. the next day.    With test trains now running and Valley Flyer service about to start, Amtrak officials and the Amtrak Police Department (APD) are alerting the public to be cautious, especially at grade crossings.    The team has given several presentations to various schools in the area, warning students to stay away from the tracks and right-of-way, while making sure they understand the meaning of railroad crossing signs and the stopping distances of trains. Parents have also received rail safety messages via district wide letters, automated phone calls and text messages, posts on district websites and school webpages, as well as including information in school newsletters.    APD has also been conducting positive enforcement grade crossing awareness events, where officers pass out literature at rail grade crossings educating motorists to approach with care, prepare to stop, look both ways and listen, and not to enter a crossing unless you can get completely through. Outreach efforts utilize material and rail safety information provided by Operation Lifesaver, a national non-profit organization dedicated to reducing railroad-related deaths and injuries.    The restoration of train service to the Knowledge Corridor is a project of the Massachusetts Department of Transportation (MassDOT).  # # #   CONTACT: Amtrak Media Relations Jason Abrams 212.630.6933 Jason.Abrams@Amtrak.com<mailto:Jason.Abrams@Amtrak.com>
