column2: What Happened to Our Shared Dream?
column3: This is your last chance to sponsor the upcoming book...  View this email in your browser (https://mailchi.mp/caapusa/bill-owens-of-caap-215465?e=d2b3ef1fec) https://secure.anedot.com/coalition-of-african-american-pastors-usa/dream-derailed-sponsors?mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID] http://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2Fcaapusa%2Fbill-owens-of-caap-215465&mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID] Share (http://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2Fcaapusa%2Fbill-owens-of-caap-215465&mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) http://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=What+Happened+to+Our+Shared+Dream%3F:&mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID] https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2Fcaapusa%2Fbill-owens-of-caap-215465 Tweet (http://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=What+Happened+to+Our+Shared+Dream%3F:&mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID] https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2Fcaapusa%2Fbill-owens-of-caap-215465) http://us6.forward-to-friend.com/forward?u=92112f469785e1152be1993c1&id=caaf49c4fa&e=d2b3ef1fec Forward to a Friend (http://us6.forward-to-friend.com/forward?u=92112f469785e1152be1993c1&id=caaf49c4fa&e=d2b3ef1fec)   ** What Happened to Our Shared Dream? ------------------------------------------------------------ Dear Partner,  When I sat down to work on my book, A Dream Derailed (http://adreamderailed.com/?mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) , I knew the topic was timely, but I didn't realize that I was about to be dragged into the race issue that has overtaken American politics.  As I explain in the book, the dream of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. and the civil rights pioneers has been thwarted. Black America has not reached the "Promised Land." Instead, we have been led astray by failed policies and opportunistic politicians.  Some people can only see the results, not the causes. Thus, we have seen the development of a kind of racialist politics, where the charge of racism is used as both a weapon against every political opponent and a shield against all criticism. This was the thinking behind Don Lemon's attack on me when I refused to call President Trump a racist.  It's also the kind of thinking that I'm trying to correct in A Dream Derailed (http://adreamderailed.com/?mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) .  A Dream Derailed (http://adreamderailed.com/?mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID])  combines memoir and history with a call to action for all Americans. In it, I suggest that we leave behind the concept of racism, as it holds us back from achieving God's plan.  We're in the final edits of the book now and getting ready for printing. After that, we'll be distributing the book and embarking on a tour to promote A Dream Derailed and the prescriptions in it.  Of course, this is a very exciting time for us. I've had lots of inquiries about where to get the book, whether it will be available in large quantities, on Amazon, and so on.  I promise you that we are doing everything we can to make it as widely available as possible.  Because we are so close to publication, this is your last chance to  become a sponsor (https://secure.anedot.com/coalition-of-african-american-pastors-usa/dream-derailed-sponsors?mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID])  of A Dream Derailed. We're very close to our goal for publication and distribution of the book - just a few more sponsors will put us over the top.  Don't miss this chance to become a sponsor - all it takes is $100.  Everyone who gives $100 or more will be given a signed copy of A Dream Derailed and will be listed on our Sponsors page. (https://secure.anedot.com/coalition-of-african-american-pastors-usa/dream-derailed-sponsors?mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID])  If you can't become a sponsor, you can still help us reach our goal by giving your best gift today (https://secure.anedot.com/coalition-of-african-american-pastors-usa/dream-derailed-sponsors?mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) . A donation of $30 will include a copy of the book as our thank you.  To donate, simply click our secure link and send your gift via credit card or e-check (https://secure.anedot.com/coalition-of-african-american-pastors-usa/dream-derailed-sponsors?mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) .  You're probably wondering whether we'll be coming to a city near you once we start the Dream Derailed book tour. At the moment, the tour is still in the planning stages, but I will be sending out more details as it gets closer. In the meantime, please help us reach our goal by sponsoring this book (https://secure.anedot.com/coalition-of-african-american-pastors-usa/dream-derailed-sponsors?mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) . With your aid, we'll be able to get this message to the people who need to hear it most!  For faith, family and freedom, Rev. Bill Owens and Dr. Deborah Owens  P.S. Your prayers and financial support will help us put this country on the right path. Please help us as we strengthen our grassroots network and work to educate and inspire pastors, community leaders, and politicians to defend our Christian rights. Donate to CAAP today!  (https://causes.anedot.com/caap-email-appeal?mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID])  The Coalition of African American Pastors, [aka] The Coalition for American Action and Principles, is a grass roots movement of Christians who believe in traditional family values in American public life.  We believe in protecting the lives of the unborn, and defending the sacred institution of marriage. CAAP does not endorse, support, or oppose any candidate for political office. Any mention of public figures herein is purely for discussion and educational purposes and should not be interpreted as a statement of electoral support or opposition.  *The Coalition of African American Pastors is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization.  Your donations to The Coalition of African American Pastors may be tax deductible to the fullest extent of the law.  No goods or services were received in exchange for any contributions.  You should consult a tax advisor regarding any tax deductions.  CAAP does not endorse any politician or political campaign. Make a Donation to CAAP! (https://causes.anedot.com/caap-email-appeal?mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) http://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2Fcaapusa%2Fbill-owens-of-caap-215465&mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID] Share (http://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2Fcaapusa%2Fbill-owens-of-caap-215465&mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) http://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=What+Happened+to+Our+Shared+Dream%3F:&mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID] https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2Fcaapusa%2Fbill-owens-of-caap-215465 Tweet (http://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=What+Happened+to+Our+Shared+Dream%3F:&mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID] https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2Fcaapusa%2Fbill-owens-of-caap-215465) http://us6.forward-to-friend.com/forward?u=92112f469785e1152be1993c1&id=caaf49c4fa&e=d2b3ef1fec Forward to a Friend (http://us6.forward-to-friend.com/forward?u=92112f469785e1152be1993c1&id=caaf49c4fa&e=d2b3ef1fec) http://caapusa.org/membership/rise/?mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID] Rise is CAAP's exclusive grassroots network, uniting people of every race, creed, culture, and background. You donâ€™t need to be a Pastor. You donâ€™t need to be African American. All you need in order to join RISE is a desire to help us create a new movement for faith, family, and justice. Join RISE! (http://caapusa.org/membership/rise/?mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) http://caapusa.org/membership/caap-clergy-membership/?mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID] Men and women of faith working together to promote and protect the values we hold dear. We welcome clergy (bishops, pastors, ministers, evangelists, every member of the clergy) from any race to join our movement to protect and defend faith and family! CAAP Clergy Membership (http://caapusa.org/membership/caap-clergy-membership/?mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) http://caapusa.org/caap-womens-ministry/?mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID] The CAAP Womenâ€™s Ministry is composed of women of faith and conviction, working together to support and serve women. We welcome women of all races to join our womenâ€™s ministry to unify and give voice to religious, social, cultural, moral and public policy issues of our day. Join the CAAP Women's Ministry! (http://caapusa.org/membership/caap-womens-ministry-membership/?mc_cid=caaf49c4fa&mc_eid=[UNIQID])  ============================================================ Send all donations and correspondence to: CAAP-West Business Office 2654 W. column2: South Coast Rail Early Action Culvert and Grade Crossing Construction: Updated Schedule for Today, August 15
column3: South Coast Rail [ https://www.mass.gov/south-coast-rail ]  You are subscribed to the South Coast Rail Project from the Massachusetts Department of Transportation.  *Early Action Construction Update, Week of August 12*  "*Updated Work Schedule for Today, Thursday, August 15*"  MassDOT's contractor will perform the following early action construction work:  *Culvert Replacements*     * *Location of work:* BK-4 culvert location [ https://www.mass.gov/files/documents/2019/05/30/dot-scr_eac_culverts_May%202019.pdf ] in Berkley on the New Bedford Main Line between the Cotley Street and Padelford Street grade crossings    * *Date/time of work:* From 7:00 AM today through midnight tonight, Thursday, August 15, AND from 6:00 AM on Friday, August 16, through midnight on Monday night, August 19 "(24 hours a day)"    * *Work zone access: *Primary construction access will be via rail from the Myricks Street grade crossing in Berkley, the Malbone Street grade crossing in Lakeville, and the contractors laydown area near the Chace Road grade crossing in Freetown. Materials and equipment will also be staged at these locations. Equipment is expected to utilize these grade crossings and also the grade crossings at Cotley Street and Padelford Street in Berkley throughout the construction period. Employee parking will primarily be located at the Chace Road laydown area and at the rear of the Galleria Mall. All work will be performed on the railroad corridor.   This work will be disruptive to local residents. Crews will be using various pieces of heavy equipment and trucks along the railroad right-of-way throughout the construction period. While the project will seek to minimize construction-related impacts to communities, noise will be generated and work lights will be used along the right-of-way.  *Tarkiln Hill Road Grade Crossing Improvements*     * *Location of work: *Tarkiln Hill Road grade crossing in New Bedford    * *Date/time of work:* Weekdays between 7:00 AM and 5:00 PM   Vehicular and pedestrian access will be maintained through all roadway work zones and access to local businesses will not be impacted.  Work on the Culvert Replacement Project and in the vicinity of the Tarkiln Hill Road Grade Crossing is anticipated to be completed by January 2020.  For more information:     * Visit the project website, www.mass.gov/southcoastrail [ https://www.mass.gov/south-coast-rail ]    * If you have questions, please email the project team: SouthCoastRail@dot.state.ma.us    * Encourage family and neighbors to sign up for informational emails [ https://public.govdelivery.com/accounts/MADOT/subscriber/new?topic_id=MADOT_30 ] on the website    * Follow @MassDOT [ https://twitter.com/MassDOT ] and the #SouthCoastRail [ https://twitter.com/search?q=%23SouthCoastRail&src=typd ] hashtag on Twitter   "If you own or manage a rental property, please share this information with your tenants. We can also provide this**information in alternate languages."  *"The schedule for this"**"i"**"nfrastructure project is weather dependent and subject to change without notice."*    Thank you for your continued interest in South Coast Rail,    Jean Fox, MassDOT Project Manager  Kim Dobosz, MBTA Project Manager  ________________________________________________________________________  Title VI Notice of Nondiscrimination: MassDOT complies with Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 and related federal and state statutes and regulations. It is the policy of MassDOT to ensure that no person or group of persons shall on the grounds of Title VI protected categories, including race, color, national origin, or under additional federal and state protected categories including sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, creed, ancestry, veteran's status (including Vietnam-era veterans), or background, be excluded from participation in, be denied the benefits of, or be otherwise subjected to discrimination under any program or activity administered by MassDOT. To request additional information about this commitment, or to file a complaint under Title VI or a related nondiscrimination provision, please contact MassDOT's Title VI Specialist by phone at (857) 368-8580, TTY at (857) 368-8580, fax (857) 368-0602 or by e-mail at MASSDOT.CivilRights@dot.state.ma.us.   If information is needed in another language, please contact the MassDOT Title VI Specialist by phone at (857) 368-8580. column2: I need a Fiscal Sponsor
column3: Greetings, My name is Stefanie Torres. I am writing to you because I need a Fiscal Sponsor for my United4US Campaign. I am aspiring to raise funding to open and operate several new Homeless Shelters throughout Philadelphia PA and Camden NJ. Trouble is, my Ministry is not yet incorporated nor does it have tax exempt status. Please visit    https://united-4-us.net I have been reading and resonating with Christian Science for many years. I haven't had much of a chance to get actively involved with any of the Reading Rooms or the Church itself due to my instability. I've been homeless myself, off and on, since the year 2000. I'm temporarily living in a rooming house and in the process of hopefully purchasing a home. I'm praying that all goes well with that. I communicate with God and my Spirit Guides as well as my Angels daily. Through that kind of communication I was given this assignment which eventually led to my Campaign. If you read about my Campaign on my website you will see that what I am called to do, I couldn't have come up with that on my own. It was Divinely given. I want to get this moving before the winter. So if you at least consider helping me with my Campaign by becoming my Fiscal Sponsor, I will greatly appreciate it. Many Blessings. Stefanie. I can also be reached @: 1(267) 317-8854 any time after 10 a.m. If you have any questions.

column2: Haitian Non-Profit FEJ-USA Extends Fundraising Effort
column3: For the benefit of our children in Haiti:  USA Non-Profit, Fondation Enfant Jesus-USA  2019 Fundraising Raffle Extended!  Summer online fundraiser now to run through August 31^st, to benefit FEJ-USA’s Kenscoff Orphanage  Fondation Enfant Jesus-USA (FEJ-USA), the venerated, long-serving 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, has announced that its annual summer fundraiser, a raffle now in progress to benefit the deserving children of its orphanage in Kenscoff, Haiti has been extended through Saturday, August 31^st. This additional time-frame will enable more interested persons an opportunity to participate and contribute to the cause.  The official final drawing will include an array of prizes, most notably 25,000 travel miles on American Airlines, two $250 VISA gift cards, a $250 Amazon.com gift card, jewelry and more. To that end, FEJ-USA encourages its network of supporters to continue to spread the word to all friends, family and others so they can purchase their tickets (see this weblink for more details on the fundraiser: FEJ Raffle (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB95Q5zJHc-2FDFSWUnyXFSO9xdVPjxACke9yANLqf03IEqaRYPcUPLGxEfcd860ysRnA-3D-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs3peyeEbjzjDUy6oRNPmPzo2-2FotQjWt5y4uEq7q9xAq1dTjUqRbMqNczSdefZOfOsZ3Lo7BNq0w0dBtDAbhaxp0K2SBP-2BYFGE6ix6LIo9MWqRfAD4mAbPGFaQ0W4DgbKfJevi0hsROnzQO4oc-2By4kyyCGJoa8GXpVagb3gPtzMCF2U5h8ihGcalRqVtC-2FQfvKFTvvgmErCaMIM3r37RV5HRAcdQBk0Hn7jLwBcT-2F3GIz40fbciJypTzMDJ5D9NfHNM-3D , or click here (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB2KwwshnLlSHHDmsNbtyBo2VzVk9HyNkw5EnUOE1p6Aybin2gf5FkzHwvneEo2Lfdw-3D-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs3peyeEbjzjDUy6oRNPmPzo2-2FotQjWt5y4uEq7q9xAq1dTjUqRbMqNczSdefZOfOsZ3Lo7BNq0w0dBtDAbhaxp0K2SBP-2BYFGE6ix6LIo9MWqfn1rOTwEqSz7SWf6UhkAxUbo9-2BXWJLwdwJuwvfKDfxAxL3TrBuSi400WkPWwfgju6BJmkFe-2FEC3v6EPc7qT78bSNSenEnVo4ZSpo85ZBcK0Bu1ZlBdDjaLe1ZfFr27yWdb4k1EclFIePoNni8Drbfg-3D for tickets.   Currently, some 40 Haitian children are housed the Kenscoff orphanage, and they are in dire need of the support and care which the organization tirelessly provides. FEJ-USA’s fundraising goal for this season is $25,000. Friends, supporters, funders and those with the heart to help affect positive change are encouraged to make donations by purchasing tickets via the raffle’s online portal, which can be accessed by clicking-on this link: https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB95Q5zJHc-2FDFSWUnyXFSO9wWEDoY0q6wuSWKGTRg21uh7a5i41kf2umgyfdN3jRdRWNlWQtIeyuiKiL27UUrH2M-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs3peyeEbjzjDUy6oRNPmPzo2-2FotQjWt5y4uEq7q9xAq1dTjUqRbMqNczSdefZOfOsZ3Lo7BNq0w0dBtDAbhaxp0K2SBP-2BYFGE6ix6LIo9MWqaO0Y5499EDBVBSDvv17u4o4f18JnmAWxqa9bZZmq2mSz9Yt0o0bY-2B3vO1V-2BgQjmXIL5gPLu-2BgH-2FVoKitKoe-2FAyESkQP6SigFg8DZsU0RcnaDSBrnIWLwNKHOo7mVKHHfKkwtrAfsnu8OznVp0LW4IM-3D (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB95Q5zJHc-2FDFSWUnyXFSO9wWEDoY0q6wuSWKGTRg21uh7a5i41kf2umgyfdN3jRdRUuzr0mPkLT6zomlkqKkR0siCCLdieIlvS54fitmylaOZwcUdH91OKhVRYtBXAvyAQWx-2BAOTojDCNIkFdk1-2BZocyjaaLO7in1XWnzkynSk1H_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs3peyeEbjzjDUy6oRNPmPzo2-2FotQjWt5y4uEq7q9xAq1dTjUqRbMqNczSdefZOfOsZ3Lo7BNq0w0dBtDAbhaxp0K2SBP-2BYFGE6ix6LIo9MWqQ-2FhndB-2BQ8F0aVkdx7jXEsL5HpnBkpk2cBTz3muKTS6mYM62YObbSBRUE2-2FcYeptlXxs4s4K-2FjPszddCRgwmUeXekDqahCjR6pvygXrMddzZIEHdUYxsN0lomwSnKz-2F6F98-2FXC1REPvdJrVEtKJRMzI-3D .  Any quantity of raffle tickets bought make one eligible to win an array of valuable prizes. This year’s winners will be drawn at random when the new purchase period ends on August 31^st, 2019, and tickets are reasonably priced at $5.00 each, or five for $20.00.  Established in 1985 and based in Haiti, FEJ implements and administers programs which create healthier, more sustainable communities throughout impoverished regions of the Caribbean nation through better education, community development and healthcare, the care of orphaned children and vocational training. FEJ is a registered non-governmental, nonprofit corporation, and has worked for more than three decades to help break the cycle of poverty there, caring for and empowering Haiti’s most vulnerable populations: Children and families.  FEJ's mission is to create sustainable communities in Haiti by offering opportunities for education, improved health and self-sustaining employment. At our primary school and crèche for orphaned children, we strive to be a model of excellence in childcare and educational services. FEJ offers many outstanding programs, including nutrition, healthcare, vocational training, agricultural development, literacy and clean water initiatives, among others. The organization believes in the power of people working together to build brighter futures and create lasting change. More information about the organization can be found by visiting www.fondationenfantjesus.org (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=84Em28S1K9SvtzcUtu04EkrbW9pX-2Fhb4Gbqk5vTuu0obc-2BZTWa2-2FZHmWT018rpCU_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs3peyeEbjzjDUy6oRNPmPzo2-2FotQjWt5y4uEq7q9xAq1dTjUqRbMqNczSdefZOfOsZ3Lo7BNq0w0dBtDAbhaxp0K2SBP-2BYFGE6ix6LIo9MWqffnMbGHgcWWbBpzZj4q7MPahKHjukbonD4cm17yVPp77PQs-2FBzzEsSqAtCbl4iKbJSwr2GzQp6bqv3GhNhMzeD7dCTsKtTEqsacOrrb6p6ctZTkYr6Xku0gZeEIxLG8KYX8QFSwt2IubN3-2FgCTjNFU-3D .  ABOUT FONDATION ENFANT JESUS-USA  Fondation Enfant Jesus-USA is a successful 501(c)(3), non-profit organization with over 8 years of experience working with FEJ to empower local communities, and care for Haiti’s most vulnerable children. operated by concerned US citizens to help end the cycle of poverty in Haiti. Working alongside 'Fondation Enfant Jesus', we offer logistical, volunteer, and financial support to provide education, health care and community development in impoverished regions in Haiti (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB2KwwshnLlSHHDmsNbtyBo1BVFjOn5jm-2FhcSG1T-2FmRBapBkIpWbWdDynWtFTDjtYCA-3D-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs3peyeEbjzjDUy6oRNPmPzo2-2FotQjWt5y4uEq7q9xAq1dTjUqRbMqNczSdefZOfOsZ3Lo7BNq0w0dBtDAbhaxp0K2SBP-2BYFGE6ix6LIo9MWqTxloaisO-2BJrKanzP4s2rPOu9865plvxUeFJOxDAx1SQyV1ISl1gCdlzeAOVEeTQdYJhle5KXGllsx-2FZHXU3h5GtFkd1v2RB-2Fz9yjNPyDnkzDdLss1zWM6ov8yoCkv6x2vN-2F4o97NP4Fd-2BJ8w1wYn-2FA-3D #Foundation #enfantjesus #education #raffle #love #donation #children #Haiti.  - ### -  PHOTO (C) 2019, COURTESY FONDATION ENFANT JESUS-USA    ______________________  If you would rather not receive future communications from x, please go to https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=FYVXevsHHoBFBmS2N78Sxddn3fLc5u25DViH8eTXgPJpnrLNsm-2BL-2FJ-2BPJSBxfShKhFGX0eHy4ApoQdiz-2Ba7-2FdU-2FQgFjmXRiwUHdwCHAQTcK0p6-2FXVuTx3G8tlzffh4Gz0nwcnYhF6SSBeux-2FSrBHV1uIV88-2BhNFQ2DBQvECtgGHQ-2B160qRgHlcewL0uCY3Se6Ar7JOW5RLfy63bM4EP-2F-2Fg-3D-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs3peyeEbjzjDUy6oRNPmPzo2-2FotQjWt5y4uEq7q9xAq1dTjUqRbMqNczSdefZOfOsZ3Lo7BNq0w0dBtDAbhaxp0K2SBP-2BYFGE6ix6LIo9MWqW9ZkFrn-2Fh0V460eBJbgYKh7CkD3eVN38k6jI-2FYKkxE5xH4LPU5O0pUy-2BpBfN9GhZ0XIm8qObTn2TwrEIeikW45CyAhOPWX-2BKgwf1xL74VMrsXfj-2Bvmwmq05qPZM0B8ByCSdzPUa0pgGnRUuOL5gl74-3D  x, x, x, x x United States  --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to customerservice+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: South Coast Rail Early Action Culvert and Grade Crossing Construction Update
column3: South Coast Rail [ https://www.mass.gov/south-coast-rail ]  You are subscribed to the South Coast Rail Project from the Massachusetts Department of Transportation.  *Early Action Construction Update, Week of August 12*  MassDOT's contractor will perform the following early action construction work:  *Culvert Replacements*     * *Location of work:* BK-4 culvert location [ https://www.mass.gov/files/documents/2019/05/30/dot-scr_eac_culverts_May%202019.pdf ] in Berkley on the New Bedford Main Line between the Cotley Street and Padelford Street grade crossings    * *Date/time of work:* From 6:00 AM on Friday, August 16, through midnight on Monday night, August 19 (24 hours a day)    * *Work zone access: *Primary construction access will be via rail from the Myricks Street grade crossing in Berkley, the Malbone Street grade crossing in Lakeville, and the contractors laydown area near the Chace Road grade crossing in Freetown. Materials and equipment will also be staged at these locations. Equipment is expected to utilize these grade crossings and also the grade crossings at Cotley Street and Padelford Street in Berkley throughout the construction period. Employee parking will primarily be located at the Chace Road laydown area and at the rear of the Galleria Mall. All work will be performed on the railroad corridor.   This work will be disruptive to local residents. Crews will be using various pieces of heavy equipment and trucks along the railroad right-of-way throughout the construction period. While the project will seek to minimize construction-related impacts to communities, noise will be generated and work lights will be used along the right-of-way.  *Tarkiln Hill Road Grade Crossing Improvements*     * *Location of work: *Tarkiln Hill Road grade crossing in New Bedford    * *Date/time of work:* Weekdays between 7:00 AM and 5:00 PM   Vehicular and pedestrian access will be maintained through all roadway work zones and access to local businesses will not be impacted.  Work on the Culvert Replacement Project and in the vicinity of the Tarkiln Hill Road Grade Crossing is anticipated to be completed by January 2020.  For more information:     * Visit the project website, www.mass.gov/southcoastrail [ https://www.mass.gov/south-coast-rail ]    * If you have questions, please email the project team: SouthCoastRail@dot.state.ma.us    * Encourage family and neighbors to sign up for informational emails [ https://public.govdelivery.com/accounts/MADOT/subscriber/new?topic_id=MADOT_30 ] on the website    * Follow @MassDOT [ https://twitter.com/MassDOT ] and the #SouthCoastRail [ https://twitter.com/search?q=%23SouthCoastRail&src=typd ] hashtag on Twitter   "If you own or manage a rental property, please share this information with your tenants. We can also provide this**information in alternate languages."  *"The schedule for this"**"i"**"nfrastructure project is weather dependent and subject to change without notice."*    Thank you for your continued interest in South Coast Rail,    Jean Fox, MassDOT Project Manager  Kim Dobosz, MBTA Project Manager  ________________________________________________________________________  Title VI Notice of Nondiscrimination: MassDOT complies with Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 and related federal and state statutes and regulations. It is the policy of MassDOT to ensure that no person or group of persons shall on the grounds of Title VI protected categories, including race, color, national origin, or under additional federal and state protected categories including sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, creed, ancestry, veteran's status (including Vietnam-era veterans), or background, be excluded from participation in, be denied the benefits of, or be otherwise subjected to discrimination under any program or activity administered by MassDOT. To request additional information about this commitment, or to file a complaint under Title VI or a related nondiscrimination provision, please contact MassDOT's Title VI Specialist by phone at (857) 368-8580, TTY at (857) 368-8580, fax (857) 368-0602 or by e-mail at MASSDOT.CivilRights@dot.state.ma.us.   If information is needed in another language, please contact the MassDOT Title VI Specialist by phone at (857) 368-8580. Si necesita informacin en otro lenguaje, favor contactar al especialista de MassDOT del Ttulo VI al 857-368-8580. column2: Cup of Joe, issue 4 - campaign update
column3: CUP OF JOE  August 17, 2019  Newsletter  It’s been a busy seven days - from the Iowa State Fair in Des Moines and the 1st Congressional District Passport to Victory event in Central City through parades and county and local Democratic Party gatherings in Iowa, all the way to a great Cup of Joe on the Issues forum in Corning, Iowa.  And lots of great press besides!  My grassroots team - leafleting Iowa!  I couldn’t do any of this without my staff and volunteers.   They’re the ones who organize my events, get me where I need to go, get me on TV and radio and in the press, and make sure everything runs smoothly.   They’re also working hard to make sure as many people as possible hear my message. I run in every parade I can, and attend every event I can - but without my staff and volunteers, I couldn’t reach nearly as many people.  We do politics the old-fashioned way - with leaflets and handshakes. Now we’ve given out over 100,000 brochures. And people are starting to notice…  https://twitter.com/JoeSestak/status/1161361457021407232  Iowa State Fair  The State Fair is one of the great events of the summer here in Iowa. I was able to meet the Drake University women’s soccer team for a chat on cancer, and had a walk-around with the American Wind Energy Association - check out my Twitter, Instagram and Facebook for more pictures.  I also spoke at the Des Moines Register Soapbox - where I talked about why I’m running, my decades of service to this country and what I learned about accountability from it. Watch the whole 20-minute speech below.  https://youtu.be/Bk6CHKza_Zs  Cup of Joe on the Issues, Corning, Iowa – agriculture and “training for a lifetime”  Corning, Iowa, hosted our fourth “Cup of Joe on the Issues” event - on agriculture, food, and how we can train our workforce for a lifetime. We talked about the fact that America spends less on workforce training than any other developed country - and why that has to change if we want to help our farmers and rural communities face the challenges of tomorrow. If you’d like to read more on my plans for “training for a lifetime” please read my policy paper here.  https://www.joesestak.com/issues/jobs-economic-protection/  I spoke to Local 5’s Sabrina Ahmed about my campaign in Iowa - and how I plan to win.  CLICK HERE TO WATCH  https://www.weareiowa.com/news/local-politics/2020-candidates/running-in-2020-joe-sestak/  We meet some great people in Iowa. Here are two who’ve been great to us - Araceli and Ivan.  https://twitter.com/JoeSestak/status/1162056080844894208  Vox called me a “maverick” and said”He’s an anti-establishment Democrat who has beaten a Republican in a Republican district, he’s someone with military and foreign policy experience, and he has a deeply personal reason for his approach to health care reform: This is his record and he’s running on it.” You can read the full profile here.  https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2019/8/13/20680106/joe-sestak-2020-presidential-campaign-policies-admiral-navy-specter-obama-medicare-public-option  I’ll be speaking at events across Iowa, from a town hall in Des Moines on Saturday, August 17th, and the 7-County Democratic Rally and Fundraiser in Otley on the 18th, through local Democratic Party events to the Iowa AFL-CIO. I’ll also be traveling to San Francisco for the Democratic National Committee’s summer meeting, where I’ll be speaking. You can get updates by signing up for our emails on our website or checking out our events page. We hope to see you at one of our events soon!  www.joesestak.com  For any queries, please email my communications team on press@joesestak.com [press@joesestak.com?subject=Des%20Moines%20Register%20Live%20Stream] . column2: RELEASE: New CAP Report Examines the State of the Turkish-Kurdish Conflict
column3: Center for American Progress Logo (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=84Em28S1K9SvtzcUtu04Ej2w-2B2nroDQ1TooUsT6-2BONmFMb1S1mMjFAws7YaI4LW2_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs0sreLDRPshfRReNwgDfdaHp-2F3oC5GUeWAdqkWlVJsfvrgTTwgk-2Bksmmn-2BpQu3sF3ReXfGaEa2HNcXYRa5U5dpYZlNPAbWzLsUrBfHKo29-2FUP9piUInD3306tmo9FBWP87Saf73955wAP6G7LWkvxewPCsJGRH-2BIpRMi9Ulb-2Fe9badalWvsT51oJBbwEyZMdphoFI4mOmoA7KodQ-2Fha895vNMaIE12UHCRTgCxTvdvweGAf5hgCGBWa6RDChhSKXsw-3D  For Immediate Release August 12, 2019  Contact Sam Hananel shananel@americanprogress.org (mailto:shananel@americanprogress.org)  RELEASE: New CAP Report Examines the State of the Turkish-Kurdish Conflict  Washington, D.C. — A new report (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQBz0p3GHQFP2ojSfiVbdB9oBb52xyZbu6rB7UDOnQ8t-2BB76d5ONE-2B5F8-2BJLaPRjqxScIExIBU0XB0p-2FRwUjxsO8LYgZcwliMfdP2sVzlGHQpcfNGesa6bui4vvHjIeYZdVOzZDkhYkJ-2B2-2F34iu8lEcFc-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs0sreLDRPshfRReNwgDfdaHp-2F3oC5GUeWAdqkWlVJsfvrgTTwgk-2Bksmmn-2BpQu3sF3ReXfGaEa2HNcXYRa5U5dpYZlNPAbWzLsUrBfHKo29-2FUIDaFUZuvF5l8thlZIrc1XotA2QUK0vyPwwlmXAFJ8vKOUIDei-2FUd-2BTKYjNslUVGpys9LWE07dv0mLjrFPsaC-2BOeh6Wz8r9D6ZxzNOH4FrKIYOzJGw6ry2Q1zBQBgZ5DE7w0ALMQysbHrdA0ojCTNB0-3D from the Center for American Progress examines the dramatic shifts in U.S. and Turkish policy toward Kurdish political and military actors in Turkey and Syria over the past five years.  The report, which updates a 2014 CAP report on the same topic, details the escalating conflict between Turkey and the Kurdistan Workers’ Party (PKK) since a ceasefire between the two parties fell apart in 2015.  The report examines the reasons behind the breakdown of the earlier peace process; the current contours of the conflict; as well as the domestic and regional dynamics at play. After assessing the still-distant prospects of a shift in Turkish policy, the report lays out the steps necessary to move toward a path of accommodation. The steps include:  · Begin a confidence-building approach toward Kurdish political actors, including in Syria, to secure a ceasefire · Release political prisoners and ease domestic repression to elevate non-PKK interlocutors · If a prospective ceasefire holds, lower tensions through stepped social and political gestures before negotiating directly with the PKK  “A confluence of domestic political, military, and regional factors raises the slight hope of a softening in Turkish policy toward the Kurds,” said Max Hoffman (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQBz0p3GHQFP2ojSfiVbdB9oDeRWaOcKW2SZ5wyBlDWQqY-2FjCdei4vF6J0-2BAEt-2F2KWkqYmLYt9joKnBFKStR3tvJc-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs0sreLDRPshfRReNwgDfdaHp-2F3oC5GUeWAdqkWlVJsfvrgTTwgk-2Bksmmn-2BpQu3sF3ReXfGaEa2HNcXYRa5U5dpYZlNPAbWzLsUrBfHKo29-2FUK5UvJkrWjHABJDts8i8ezzMvs2PJwSvQsQTaoKDFobe5dHPq2-2BXjO4Z-2FeCCkh0yaYQZm5TTUbxRjtenUs1at2JUoCfWXqhaq6OL-2F4OdNIuef5XNaUHMq4h6Vrzvqh26ifir2afx8HAK39tjNr1EiRk-3D , associate director of National Security and International Policy and author of the report. “Over the decades, this conflict has oscillated between peaceful and violent chapters. It remains to be seen whether we are about to enter an easing phase. But a path of accommodation could yield important political and economic benefits for Turkey and remains the only chance for a lasting peace.”  Read the report: “The State of the Turkish-Kurdish Conflict (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQBz0p3GHQFP2ojSfiVbdB9oBb52xyZbu6rB7UDOnQ8t-2BB76d5ONE-2B5F8-2BJLaPRjqxScIExIBU0XB0p-2FRwUjxsO8LYgZcwliMfdP2sVzlGHQpcfNGesa6bui4vvHjIeYZdVOzZDkhYkJ-2B2-2F34iu8lEcFc-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs0sreLDRPshfRReNwgDfdaHp-2F3oC5GUeWAdqkWlVJsfvrgTTwgk-2Bksmmn-2BpQu3sF3ReXfGaEa2HNcXYRa5U5dpYZlNPAbWzLsUrBfHKo29-2FUJlf5tdlqO6tgRFcghy-2Fy31c0SideRxJY7XBNbjX-2B8iNZKc4nAx4simm4KE-2FwZtZzzEtNAn6rjR70fsmwOS190ErQq1Stm2TSGp1Pl8YirQW6nmTsl8ZaDzPH9FnHUuSiioZEwWLwkJtrtVMK5ugx08-3D ,” by Max Hoffman.  For more information or to speak to an expert, contact Sam Hananel at shananel@americanprogress.org (mailto:shananel@americanprogress.org) or 202. 478.6327.  ###  The Center for American Progress (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQBz0p3GHQFP2ojSfiVbdB9oD5Ae4uWn-2BordGDIbW2Rlj8_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs0sreLDRPshfRReNwgDfdaHp-2F3oC5GUeWAdqkWlVJsfvrgTTwgk-2Bksmmn-2BpQu3sF3ReXfGaEa2HNcXYRa5U5dpYZlNPAbWzLsUrBfHKo29-2FUH8SG0C0PdX-2FH9b91cgf9PFAw7FKigDzIZt2FPQ8lr6oO-2F9vjl9003QGKGwY9-2B-2BLceu3q9O57Hc3DLdNvvtg3xqigbxWmHXp7QEbFWKN-2FncSbGyXr38RwTC1SnB5-2F079LmHy9Xgpoou-2F2YKyivAVqsQ-3D is a nonpartisan research and educational institute dedicated to promoting a strong, just and free America that ensures opportunity for all. We believe that Americans are bound together by a common commitment to these values and we aspire to ensure that our national policies reflect these values. We work to find progressive and pragmatic solutions to significant domestic and international problems and develop policy proposals that foster a government that is “of the people, by the people, and for the people.”    ______________________  If you would rather not receive future communications from Center for American Progress, please go to https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=pK2FwkOhmO2MTkmWlDPkIYEAT6FSvMSN7OJFg6aNebYLLHYN5e6u-2F3iAQzn-2FDQLNIkhIVvRCl6ISEWN9lwdHoG-2FYRUsU7b5XIb3c7jwhqs4mWflNyU8mL-2FUhPG-2BuYnjXhBGiUCU2mwod-2FKyZZHNgqpJDXn8Elt8Cy4n5xaKQPeq3f4GGJdFQHHySNC1DrY-2B2_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs0sreLDRPshfRReNwgDfdaHp-2F3oC5GUeWAdqkWlVJsfvrgTTwgk-2Bksmmn-2BpQu3sF3ReXfGaEa2HNcXYRa5U5dpYZlNPAbWzLsUrBfHKo29-2FUGsFAJXfe6PFHRYr3dSmtGde-2FWsUahzXtaYl9Z6wtJUK2URT50en6wSuEHjp4DXA63l-2F-2BODM7FjFKGaJfaIVdoWTFSq0Hrb9gdKoC8pT2N3H6Cs-2BwpKyWgAjNST9YfVr-2BxPxp6TEj-2BbR2OzBXMXDJZw-3D  Center for American Progress, 1333 H St NW FL 10, Washington, DC 20005 United States  --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to customerservice+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: Prayer & Praise Newsletter
column3: ** Dear Leader, ------------------------------------------------------------ It's been a very hot August in Wales, one of the hottest we can remember.  We decided not to book a holiday as finances were tight, and anyway, there was lovely weather here.  A few days out over August at various parks and a couple of friends coming to stay has been the order of the day.  Reuben has had a great school report at the end of term, coming on really well with his reading, spelling and writing - we are of course proud parents of our little boy.  The picture is of Reuben and Rebekah (not sure whose driving!) at a park we visited last week in West Wales.  On the ministry front, it was lovely to catch up with Andrea Willams the CEO of Christian Concern who was speaking in Wales recently.  We spent a couple of hours chatting through some of the cases they are dealing with.  One thing that really jumped out in our conversation is the increase in the way Christians are being marginalised or persecuted for their own beliefs within our Country.  We continue to pray for the vital work Andrea and her team are doing at www.christianconcern.com  https://www.christianconcern.com  Some good news was that we had our first Encourager Series booklet back from the printers.  This will form part of a wide series of booklets we're planning to produce across, The Encourager Series, The Understanding Series, The Recovery Series, The Kingdom Series and The Spotlight Series.  There's a lot of work ahead of us in this but we're hearing of a general lack of teaching and discipleship, covering the basics of Christianity.  These 28-page booklets will be a brilliant tool for Churches across the country to use as study helps within small groups.  The first one Encourager Series : Prayer Life (http://www.petersbrook.com) is now in stock (we had over 130 pre-orders) and we have The Understanding Series : The Trinity (http://www.petersbrook.com) .  Although this is a lot of work to get things done, I'm really excited that these new Christian Help Guides (http://www.christianhelpguides.com) are coming into being.  A worthwhile project for new and existing Christian Alike.  http://www.petersbrook.com  Thank you if you have sent in a gift to support our ministry work.  We are standing in faith for £523 this month. If you prayerfully feel led to help you can :-  Make a one-off gift - Click Here (http://reach100m.com/donate/oneoffgift.php)  Setup a small monthly gift - Click Here (http://www.reach100m.com/donateregular-gift/donatedirectdebit.php)  We value every prayer prayed and gift made.  Thank you so much for standing with us.  With Love and Blessings  http://reach100m.com/donate/  Carl, Rebekah and Reuben Brettle   ** THE VISION ------------------------------------------------------------  100m is a Christian Ministry devoted to reach 100 million people for Christ, from Wales to the World.  I have devoted the rest of my life to make this vision a reality.   ** DONATIONS ------------------------------------------------------------  We can claim Giftaid on gifts if you are a UK Taxpayer.  To Give - Click Here (http://www.reach100m.com/donate/)  Cheques are payable to 'Network' and can be sent to :-  100m 161 New Road Skewen Neath, UK SA10 6HD   ** ADVISORY BOARD ------------------------------------------------------------  Catherine Brown Gateway Ministries Scotland, UK  Carl Hendricks Crystal Church South Africa  Kyle Cottington Church Edit England, UK  Nigel James Wales Wide Wales, UK  Phil Davies Sporting Marvels Wales, UK  Rick McKinnis Wellspring Church Connecticut, USA  ============================================================ Copyright © 2019 100m, All rights reserved.  You are receiving this email because you opted in via our website.  Our mailing address is: 100m 161 New Road Skewen Neath,  SA10 6HD United Kingdom Want to change how you receive these emails? column2: Editorial comments and corrections
column3: The following information was collected:  Name: John  Email: robledoint@yahoo.com  Subscriber: No  Subject: Knives Account  For 3 Times as Many Murders as Rifles Do ,According to the FBI  Product: csmonitor.com  Message: Knives Account for 3 Times as Many Murders as Rifles Do, According to the FBI Bradley Evans BY BRADLEY EVANS PUBLISHED AUGUST 10, 2019 AT 9:08AM Share on Facebook Tweet Email Print After every mass shooting, politicians on the left clamber for increased gun control measures. They tell Republicans to “do the right thing” and “get something done.”  Lost in the noise, however, is what exactly should be done. And even more important, why.  For many politicians, Democrats and Republicans alike, gun control proposals are nothing more than cheap attempts to politicize tragedy. The most recent statistics from the FBI explain why.  But first, some background.  A pair of horrific shootings in El Paso, Texas, and Dayton, Ohio, last weekend brought several controversial policy proposals into the spotlight.  TRENDING: State Wants To Be Able To Take Your Car Away if You Go 5 Miles over Speed Limit  Perhaps chief among them is the so-called “assault weapons” ban, a measure that would ban “military-style” semi-automatic rifles — and which is favored by an overwhelming number of Democrats.  In fact, nearly every Democrat running for president in 2020 has voiced support for such a ban, according to Vox.  But would a weapons ban really decrease mass shootings — or violent crime in general? At least one major study suggests it would not.  According to the RAND Corporation, “evidence for the effect of assault weapon bans on mass shootings is inconclusive.” Similarly, “evidence for the effect of assault weapon bans on total homicides and firearm homicides is inconclusive.”  Do you think an assault weapons ban would help prevent mass shootings? Yes No Completing this poll entitles you to Conservative Tribune news updates free of charge. You may opt out at anytime. You also agree to our Privacy Policy and Terms of Use. A ban would be not only ineffective, but also misdirected.  The most recent available statistics from the FBI indicate that when it comes to murder, rifles are far from the most common weapon.  In 2017, rifles accounted for 403 murders in the United States. By contrast, “knives or cutting instruments” accounted for 1,591.  And when’s the last time we heard about a ban on knives? (OK — in all honesty, it was pretty recently, in Britain.)  In America, however, calls for knife bans are rare, and rightly so. But the reason for politicians’ silence on knives is more sinister.  RELATED: Anthony Scaramucci Compares Trump to Nuclear Disaster, Says GOP Might Need To Replace Him  As a pragmatic matter, legislation banning knives would be politically useless.  Proposing a ban on “assault” rifles is a much more effective strategy. Calling for a ban on scary-looking weapons is viscerally appealing and emotionally satisfying.  But if major studies and federally collected data are any indication, an assault weapons ban would do little good.  We are committed to truth and accuracy in all of our journalism. Read our editorial standards.  Submit a Correction

column2: Country Music Icon and Lifestyle Influencer, Martina McBride, Announces the Ninth Season Of The Joy of Christmas Tour
column3: View this email in your browser (https://mailchi.mp/f5cb59f0f610/country-music-icon-and-lifestyle-influencer-martina-mcbride-announces-the-ninth-season-of-the-joy-of-christmas-tour?e=1acc59e421) FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE  Country Music Icon and Lifestyle Influencer, Martina McBride, Announces the Ninth Season Of The Joy of Christmas Tour https://truepublicrelations.us12.list-manage.com/track/click?u=12625cf9000644aef0f718377&id=cc59319a40&e=1acc59e421 Download JPEG (https://truepublicrelations.us12.list-manage.com/track/click?u=12625cf9000644aef0f718377&id=6da99b4aa0&e=1acc59e421) (August 12, 2019 – Nashville, TN) One of Country music’s most powerful voices, Martina McBride, will hit the road again this holiday season for the ninth season of The Joy of Christmas Tour, an evening of musical whimsy that will warm audiences’ hearts as they head into this magical time of year. McBride delivers stirringly jubilant renditions of timeless holiday classics we all know and love.  “This show is so much fun to do,” says McBride. She continues, “We have everything from classic hymns like ‘O Holy Night’ to fun, big band swing classics like ‘Winter Wonderland’ and ‘Santa Claus is Coming to Town.’  It’s all a very visual, the songs are well-loved, and you leave with a warm feeling. I love to think of entire families, from grandparents to grandchildren, enjoying The Joy Of Christmas.  It's really a show for the whole family.”  McBride has previously released two holiday albums, her multiplatinum “White Christmas,” and most recently “It’s The Holiday Season.” Each album showcases McBride’s versatility on traditional hymnal tracks, as well as the familiar feel-good songs that immediately puts everyone in the holiday spirit.  Tour Dates:  11/29/19              Biloxi, MS                            Beau Rivage Theatre 11/30/19              Lake Charles, LA                Golden Nugget 12/1/19                San Antonio, TX                 Majestic Theatre 12/3/19*              Tyler, TX                              R. Down Cowan Fine & Performing Arts Center 12/5/19**            Green Bay, WI                     Resch Center 12/7/19**            Prior Lake, MN                    Mystic Lake Casino 12/6/19               Springfield, IL                      Sangamon Auditorium 12/12/19             Wallingford, CT                   Oakdale Theatre 12/13/19             Philadelphia, PA                  The Met 12/14/19             Boston, MA                          Lowell Memorial Auditorium 12/15/19             Newark, NJ                         Union County PAC 12/19/19             East Lansing, MI                 Wharton Center 12/20/19*           Chicago, IL                          Rialto Square Theatre 12/21/19*           St. Louis, MO                      Lindenwood University  *on sale now **on sale 8/23  For additional information on McBride and upcoming show dates, please visit:  Website (https://truepublicrelations.us12.list-manage.com/track/click?u=12625cf9000644aef0f718377&id=39513fc332&e=1acc59e421) Instagram (https://truepublicrelations.us12.list-manage.com/track/click?u=12625cf9000644aef0f718377&id=c9d5c13b96&e=1acc59e421) Twitter (https://truepublicrelations.us12.list-manage.com/track/click?u=12625cf9000644aef0f718377&id=0f2a9d2cab&e=1acc59e421) Facebook (https://truepublicrelations.us12.list-manage.com/track/click?u=12625cf9000644aef0f718377&id=deabe4c1cc&e=1acc59e421)  About Martina McBride:  Multiple Grammy® nominee Martina McBride has sold over 18 million albums to date, which includes 20 Top 10 singles and six #1 hits. 2017 marked a milestone in Martina’s illustrious career when she hit her 25^th year of touring. Last year, Martina released a new Christmas album, It’s The Holiday Season, that features her favorite Christmas standards, all with the backing of a symphony, and also brought back her “The Joy of Christmas Tour,” this time each with a local orchestra. McBride has earned more than 15 major music awards, including four wins for Female Vocalist of the Year from the Country Music Association and won three Academy of Country Music for Top Female Vocalist. Martina has been awarded 14 Gold Records. Nine Platinum honors, three Double Platinum Records, and two Triple Platinum Awards. Martina was awarded the Covenant House Beacon of Hope Award and Music Business Association’s prestigious 2015 Harry Chapin Memorial Humanitarian Award for her philanthropic efforts on behalf of domestic violence. Martina has released two books – the first, Around the Table, a full-color illustrated collection of her favorite recipes, hosting tips, practical menu planning advice, and themed décor inspiration. She released her second book, Martina’s Kitchen Mix: My Recipe Playlist for Real Life, in October 2018.   Press inquiries for Martina McBride, please contact:  Marcel Pariseau (323-957-0730) marcel@truepublicrelations.com (mailto:marcel@truepublicrelations.com)  Taylor Bailey (323-957-0730) taylor@truepublicrelations.com (mailto:taylor@truepublicrelations.com)   ============================================================ Copyright © 2019 True Public Relations, All rights reserved. column2: Can we talk
column3: Hi,  We are a specialized RPO (Recruitment process outsourcing) firm in the sense that we can staff for a range of different industries.  We have recruiters that come from different backgrounds like IT, Hospital/Healthcare, Accounting/Finance, Hospitality, Warehousing/Distribution, Logistics, Sales, Marketing, etc.  We are currently offering our "Dedicated Recruiter" package which comes with:  .             Access to all major job boards (Dice, CareerBuilder, Monster, LinkedIn Recruiter, etc.) as well as our own database that we build and maintain daily.  .             Qualified candidates daily pouring in  .             End-to-End Recruiting, Full Cycle Recruiting  .             24/7 support from our headquarters in India and from our offices in Atlanta, GA, and Delaware  .             Daily Reports on all KPI's  If this is something that piques your interest, let's set up a time to chat or call!  I look forward to speaking with you soon to discuss more!  Regards,  Bavina        --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to customerservice+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: Tips -- Storm Preparedness: Get Ready Before A Storm Strikes, Pay Attention to Safety
column3: Hi,  The preparations you make now, ahead of storms, floods, or hurricanes, can help you recover faster and stay safe during clean-up. The Outdoor Power Equipment Institute (OPEI) (http://www.opei.org) , an international trade association representing power equipment, small engine, utility vehicle, golf car and personal transport vehicle manufacturers and suppliers, reminds home and business owners that it’s best to get ready before a storm strikes.  “In the rush right before the storm, people sometimes forget to make sure their outdoor power equipment is in order,” said Kris Kiser, president and CEO of OPEI. “They also run out of time as weather is often unpredictable. At all times of the year, it’s important to keep your equipment in working order, have the right fuel on hand, and know where your safety gear is. This is doubly true during storm season.”  The “Get Ready Before the Storm” infographic is here. (https://www.livinglandscapesmatter.com/wp-content/uploads/Storm_Safety_2019.png)  We hope you will consider sharing it. Mr. Kiser would be pleased to do an interview or e-interview.  OPEI offers the following tips to help homeowners and businesses plan ahead for storm clean-up:  Kind Regards,  Debbi Mayster  On Behalf of OPEI  240.988.6243  STORM PREPAREDNESS: GET READY BEFORE A STORM STRIKES, PAY ATTENTION TO SAFETY  OPEI Offers 12 Tips to Help Home & Business Owners Prepare Ahead of Storms, Hurricanes and Floods  Alexandria, Va. – The preparations you make now, ahead of storms, floods, or hurricanes, can help you recover faster and stay safe during clean-up. The Outdoor Power Equipment Institute (OPEI) (http://www.opei.org) , an international trade association representing small engine, utility vehicle and outdoor power equipment manufacturers and suppliers, reminds home and business owners that it’s best to get ready before a storm strikes.  “In the rush right before the storm, people sometimes forget to make sure their outdoor power equipment is in order,” said Kris Kiser, president and CEO of OPEI. “They also run out of time as weather is often unpredictable. At all times of the year, it’s important to keep your equipment in working order, have the right fuel on hand, and know where your safety gear is. This is doubly true during storm season.”  OPEI offers the following tips to help homeowners and businesses plan ahead for storm clean-up:  Make a list of what you need to clean up. Survey your property. Consider the damage a storm might cause and make a list of what tools might be needed for repairs. You might need a chainsaw, pruner, generator, or utility type vehicle.  Take stock of your outdoor power equipment. Make sure equipment is in good working order. If needed, take your equipment to an authorized service center for maintenance or repair.  Find your safety gear.  Avoid the scramble for sturdy shoes, safety goggles, hard hats, reflective clothing and work gloves, which should be stored in an accessible area with your equipment.  Review the owner’s manuals for your equipment. Read product manuals to ensure you know how to operate your equipment safely.  Have the right fuel on hand. Fuel stations may be closed after a storm, so it’s important to have the proper fuel for your equipment. Store your fuel in an approved container. Use the type of fuel recommended by your equipment manufacturer. It is illegal to use any fuel with more than 10% ethanol in outdoor power equipment (for more information on proper fueling for outdoor power equipment visit www.LookBeforeYouPump.com (http://www.lookbeforeyoupump.com) ).  Remain calm and use common sense when using outdoor power equipment. Clearheaded thinking and smart decision-making can help you make smart choices. This is no time to rush. Take time to think through a strategy for clean-up efforts.  Use safety precautions. Be aware of fundamental dangers that can occur. For instance, chainsaw kickback, which may happen when the moving chain at the tip of the guide bar touches an object, or when the wood closes in and pinches the saw chain in the cut. Always stand with your weight on both feet, and adjust your stance so you are angled away from the blade. Hold the chainsaw with both hands. Never over-reach or cut anything above your shoulder height. Always have a planned retreat path if something falls.  Keep firm footing when using pole saws and pole pruners. Keep a firm footing on the ground. Observe the safety zone, which means keeping bystanders and power lines (those above you and any that might have fallen down) at least 50 feet away from your work area.   Ensure portable electric generators have plenty of ventilation. Generators should never be used in an enclosed area or placed inside a home or garage, even if the windows or doors are open. Place the generator outside and away from windows, doors, and vents that could allow carbon monoxide to come indoors. Keep the generator dry and do not use it in rainy or wet conditions. Before refueling, turn the generator off and let it cool down.  Drive Utility Type Vehicles (UTVs) with caution. Keep the vehicle stable and drive slowly. Do not turn the vehicle mid-slope or while on a hill.  Be aware of others. Keep bystanders, children and animals out of your work area. Do not allow other people near outdoor power equipment, such as chainsaws, pole saws or pole pruners when starting the equipment or using it.  Pay attention to your health. Storm cleanup can be taxing on the body and the spirit. Do not operate power equipment when you are tired or overly fatigued. Drink plenty of water and take regular breaks.  About OPEI The Outdoor Power Equipment Institute (OPEI) is an international trade association representing power equipment, small engine, utility vehicle, golf car and personal transport vehicle manufacturers and suppliers. OPEI is the advocacy voice of the industry, and a recognized Standards Development Organization for the American National Standards Institute (ANSI) and active internationally through the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), and the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC) in the development of safety and performance standards. OPEI is managing partner of GIE+EXPO, the industry’s annual international trade show, and the creative force behind the environmental education program, TurfMutt.com. OPEI-Canada represents members on a host of issues, including recycling, emissions and other regulatory developments across the Canadian provinces.  ______________________ If you would rather not receive future communications from The Outdoor Power Equipment Institute, please go to http://FourLeafPublicRelations.pr-optout.com/OptOut.aspx?2240313x36785x72292x1x4103116x24000x6&Email=customerservice%40csmonitor.com. The Outdoor Power Equipment Institute, 341 South Patrick Street, Alexandria, VA 22314 United States  --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to customerservice+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: Starry Spaces for Thursday Still Available
column3: Help us plan to see you!  $20 for Members / $ 25 for non-Members Thank you to our generous Signature Beverage Sponsor Wine and Spirits Distributors of Florida, Inc.! Starry Summer Nights Sips ?& Stories Thursday, August 15, 2019 at 5:30 PM – 7 PM Explore an iconic and historic building in a fun and casual after-hours tour featuring brand-new temporary exhibit The Moon, Stars, and Sunshine State. Enjoy wine and cheese while you listen to special stories and create your own museum memories. Reservations required and ? space is limited. Register Here Save the Date for a Spacey Night of Trivia Trivia Night at the Museum: Spaced Out Thursday, September 26 ?6 PM – 8 PM Your destination? The coolest trivia chamber in Tallahassee's galaxy. Your mission? To test your crew's knowledge of all things Space: out-of-this-world music, fantastic movie voyages, and the real people who made it happen. Assemble your team and embark on a voyage to fun at the Historic Capitol Museum. Tasty snacks from Social Catering Events and beverages from Wine and Spirits Distributors of Florida and Tri Eagle will be served. As always, top recruits receive prizes at the end of the night. Register Here Team program fee is $15 for Members and $20 for non-Members, max per team is 4. Flying solo? Individual entry is $5. Sign-in and food service starts at 6:00 PM. Trivia will start at 6:30 PM. The Moon, Stars, and Sunshine State program series is made by possible with the support of the following generous sponsors. The Honorable Dixie Sansom and Mr. Jerry Sansom Mr. Guy Spearman and Mrs. Delores Spearman The Honorable Lauren Book Mr. Ron Book ? ? column2: Security Notice. Someone has access to your system.
column3: Hello!  I am a hacker who has access to your operating system. I also have full access to your account.  I've been watching you for a few months now. The fact is that you were infected with malware through an adult site that you visited.  If you are not familiar with this, I will explain. Trojan Virus gives me full access and control over a computer or other device. This means that I can see everything on your screen, turn on the camera and microphone, but you do not know about it.  I also have access to all your contacts and all your correspondence.  Why your antivirus did not detect malware? Answer: My malware uses the driver, I update its signatures every 4 hours so that your antivirus is silent.  I made a video showing how you satisfy yourself in the left half of the screen, and in the right half you see the video that you watched. With one click of the mouse, I can send this video to all your emails and contacts on social networks. I can also post access to all your e-mail correspondence and messengers that you use.  If you want to prevent this, transfer the amount of $500 to my bitcoin address (if you do not know how to do this, write to Google: "Buy Bitcoin").  My bitcoin address (BTC Wallet) is:  3QdHFhfbMqMQcTVHbxj1HeTQyR6TBYFaUm  After receiving the payment, I will delete the video and you will never hear me again. I give you 50 hours (more than 2 days) to pay. I have a notice reading this letter, and the timer will work when you see this letter.  Filing a complaint somewhere does not make sense because this email cannot be tracked like my bitcoin address. I do not make any mistakes.  If I find that you have shared this message with someone else, the video will be immediately distributed.  Best regards!   --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to daily+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: #ART collection of "excise dollar" of 3 vases
column3: Hello.  Once I thought about how to make the serial numbers of my vases, which cannot be faked. And I came to the non-obvious conclusion, use the dollar. To fake a vase, you need to fake a banknote, and this is counterfeiting and is prosecuted by law. The numbers of the vases are stored with me and you can determine if I have such a number, if so then you have the original.  The first embodiment of this idea was a collection of "excise dollar" of 3 vases.              Ruslan Kolbaev  --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to customerservice+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: Rain Barrel & Compost Bin Truckload Sale
column3: CITY-HOSTED COMMUNITY RAIN BARREL, COMPOST BIN SALE NOW OPEN  HOUSTON—The City of Houston Green Building Resource Center helps area residents conserve natural resources to lessen the effects of the Texas heat by offering rain barrels and compost bins at a discounted price. The fall edition of its biannual online sale is now open, with a pick-up date of Saturday, October 12.  The rain barrels, which typically retail at $129 and provide homeowners with an affordable alternative to watering from the tap, will be available for $69. Additionally, compost bins, which reduce the volume of garbage needlessly sent to landfills, will be offered for $65. Both come with instructions for easy set-up and use.  To order, visit the website by Sunday, October 6: RainBarrelProgram.org/Houston.  Purchases can be picked up October 12 from 10 am to noon at the Houston Permitting Center (West) Parking Lot 2, 1002 Washington Ave. GBRC Program Director Steve Stelzer will be available to answer questions and assist all who take part in this offer: 832-394-9050 steve.stelzer@houstontx.gov www.codegreenhouston.org

column2: NEW- from Redbox
column3: Hi! Thought you might want to share this fun insight from Redbox- please let me know if you can post! Would love to see links... Thanks!  FAMILY FRIENDLY FLICKS FOR WEEKEND RELAXING  Credit: the movie experts at Redbox.com  With the kids heading back to school, many will be craving some weekend downtime. Here are 6 perfect movie options the whole family will enjoy.  Missing Link (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB731Oqof9fY4Pr4Cg88pWNwFalQES557RlV2BXUIhwDF8aT05ZCKHtcw8a0y-2BgCoQQ-3D-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs01tZpaz-2Fr8ve6Pyih3UG1XcidRdxJlIm2XhyFaleF900VrzQJhj-2FrE1c9cbaG4J3LqWZy88RJnD-2BTWi4zKJNjUyjJ4vtMHUQyuhbnKQ1Or0lhnSuGu7hOjVCdrJwdtgm6aCOM1osNfI17EvhMrmQXWgJi5AqhXIEXhVfS-2B9pMNmGqZyyfK-2FczbRLK6KErRer7blMjKHqqVmiKzZBw-2FjhbtpVrT-2BjNBiqpH6yNUaCHCzx6KK0bUuwLwPyxmlO2zxNI-3D  – In this stop?motion animated film featuring a voice cast that includes Hugh Jackman, Zoe Saldana, Emma Thompson and Zach Galifianakis, we follow an English explorer who finds a Yeti (or Bigfoot … or Sasquatch) and helps him get back to his family in the Himalayas. But on top of their perilous journey, they need to deal with a bounty hunter who’s hot on their trail. You’ll be treated to wonderful animation and a heartwarming story — what more could you ask for? (And make sure you keep it rolling for the end credits scene!)  UglyDolls  (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB731Oqof9fY4Pr4Cg88pWNwNy0KY4u8ZWCdnVqV-2FhMn7_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs01tZpaz-2Fr8ve6Pyih3UG1XcidRdxJlIm2XhyFaleF900VrzQJhj-2FrE1c9cbaG4J3LqWZy88RJnD-2BTWi4zKJNjUyjJ4vtMHUQyuhbnKQ1Or0haDsKABxAHna3g-2FwADqzs-2FrHMx0xkxs890kiQjKvlPaCHqerkZxZwrps-2FK6ko1nq8YKqca8Fl-2FyLk5hvhF4xEGHMxlE84qRoztjtKGeWES6-2BJoewdx2Ehl4yJf3068iH7fkeOHHDZdFJ5UjDSS9IZg-3D – This animated tale about a group of defective dolls and stuffed animals from “Uglyville” who try to find acceptance in the real world boasts Kelly Clarkson, Blake Shelton, Pitbull, Janelle Monae, Nick Jonas, Bebe Rexha, Charlie XCX and Lizzo in its voice cast, so clearly it’s going to be jam?packed with some great tunes on top of a sweet message.  How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB731Oqof9fY4Pr4Cg88pWNyRzW2aiYotM28e1iYDBVpVineVowazevmqZmRDlJBc9gU-2FMVC7XBVCUOyx1J9i8Lk-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs01tZpaz-2Fr8ve6Pyih3UG1XcidRdxJlIm2XhyFaleF900VrzQJhj-2FrE1c9cbaG4J3LqWZy88RJnD-2BTWi4zKJNjUyjJ4vtMHUQyuhbnKQ1Or0q5GEiXZ5cGylaiePiCMnM64BQz2Nkr8aorqH-2Fk5y0a3jjcyjUZVTGgBmMAdroBcVUNjnBsOVcuMUwIk5Gzda8YinrUG86xftIHkQTw-2BhmRJf-2FYp6RSH8cACHJyznNdQlz4njBpkoKbCVKbcvVCtqSI-3D  – My kids are crazy about the How to Train Your Dragon series (both TV and film), and this final installment of the franchise is absolutely amazing and did not disappoint.  Mary Poppins Returns (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB731Oqof9fY4Pr4Cg88pWNx8mP67DS3EEJnpd6s78W8SCfP-2BngqsCHK3pdwOAe4GUg-3D-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs01tZpaz-2Fr8ve6Pyih3UG1XcidRdxJlIm2XhyFaleF900VrzQJhj-2FrE1c9cbaG4J3LqWZy88RJnD-2BTWi4zKJNjUyjJ4vtMHUQyuhbnKQ1Or0nsec1cnRcLlAD3MB13aCNoJuzf-2FbxzxUovRc26qqeUvh7aD9s-2BObCEp49aZOsO5IcIqQHyTT4Zxp1NVGkBF6UU4bfjEWyAYRR-2ByRyM0UVm9cBWhRK5-2BjCUi0ZgM76Hpsj0eV9vwFmazub41IrfLfTY-3D  – Mixing live action (in the form of cast members Emily Blunt, Lin? Manuel Miranda, Emily Mortimer, Ben Wishaw and more) with fantastical cartoon sequences just like its 1964 predecessor, this musical is a great pick for those with older children who will understand its slightly more complex themes and not need to be constantly entertained by cutesy characters.  Captain Underpants (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB731Oqof9fY4Pr4Cg88pWNx-2B85ozf6nmTpi8kDXCgt9uzN2rvJ5nNd-2BtEKGFJQpl-2FA-3D-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs01tZpaz-2Fr8ve6Pyih3UG1XcidRdxJlIm2XhyFaleF900VrzQJhj-2FrE1c9cbaG4J3LqWZy88RJnD-2BTWi4zKJNjUyjJ4vtMHUQyuhbnKQ1Or0sbqXk5wmi0gZc7Gu1tUmDkUb-2BDpO4sbLYQKUy38Sn5kdoeTsniscV44AnvE7PtCFpuDURT3ktRETqF-2BnaqPwk6AYpudQNbXlhX3sLtmd2ZejeWiZ1mZq4SCu6yNS8j3j5UUpifCoo4U-2BQplpW04R-2Fk-3D  – … or on the opposite end of the maturity scale, there’s my kids, who love to run around in their undies and shout “I’M CAPTAIN UNDERPANTS…. TRA LALAAAAAAA!!!!” If you have kids like that, this is the movie for you. (And honestly, it’s actually pretty clever cute.)  The Lego Movie 2: The Second Part (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB731Oqof9fY4Pr4Cg88pWNzAEx-2B5iXKkDZS3sMd9MPygLOjrlBUD6zQGTTTyFPDBYXxLfaUxc370eaBgeJzOMFM-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs01tZpaz-2Fr8ve6Pyih3UG1XcidRdxJlIm2XhyFaleF900VrzQJhj-2FrE1c9cbaG4J3LqWZy88RJnD-2BTWi4zKJNjUyjJ4vtMHUQyuhbnKQ1Or0gXU2B0TkE7oIsoDovax3WuGaQLyQKJgrrii6CjLtoAufSdRpcC7pJ-2Bcp6cJh9pwiVH8d8Pdb1Kqx4Eictcn1oNd8nZXkoPaqhXHvzufojEujWGfO4-2BsljG7h811A6IurqcXwkWy9qQsxMr0JLRSNh4-3D  – In our house, summer is also the time when my kids remember ALL THE LEGO SETS they’ve accumulated over the years and get excited about rebuilding them again. So this sequel (that’s just as good as the 2014 groundbreaking original) comes highly recommended.  6 POLITICAL MOVIES THAT WILL EARN YOUR VOTE  Credit: the movie experts at Redbox.com  The last thing many people want to think about when movie watching is politics, but some political comedies are funny enough that watching them still feels like escapism — even if some plot details might eerily reflect real life.  Here are 5 fun ones you'll want to check out.  Long Shot (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB731Oqof9fY4Pr4Cg88pWNyWUgjeIuaEAOV0nc3Esxyj_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs01tZpaz-2Fr8ve6Pyih3UG1XcidRdxJlIm2XhyFaleF900VrzQJhj-2FrE1c9cbaG4J3LqWZy88RJnD-2BTWi4zKJNjUyjJ4vtMHUQyuhbnKQ1Or0jx-2FDmye0rThqa4nrgbmDr8BRRwaLdy5VdXTJQy8CzPWd4-2Bp6T0m-2FoXI4LAaquKWeWE4iXesfV-2Fd6j4r3MSSNR3PByrfbItcBcEASv8-2F4tNyTwr6c0ZiVAQniBXNThlK-2B2gNDzwpNxZBWjOaOsH7kT8-3D  – New to the Box and Redbox on Demand, this one is more of a political rom?com. It stars Charlize Theron as a career politician who decides to run for president, and Seth Rogen as an anti?establishment childhood friend she hires to be her speech writer. Clearly it’s an “opposites attract” type of situation, with an overarching theme about staying true to — and standing up for — yourself. I’ll admit I went into this one a bit cynical, but I ended up really, really enjoying it.  The Campaign (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB9OSOJOPDTjV1UayJAtOcG-2FIyefWhUsLUdsggwZK0mkHFl2FGgTl7MUiyc4bJCow8g-3D-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs01tZpaz-2Fr8ve6Pyih3UG1XcidRdxJlIm2XhyFaleF900VrzQJhj-2FrE1c9cbaG4J3LqWZy88RJnD-2BTWi4zKJNjUyjJ4vtMHUQyuhbnKQ1Or0i4COqGncZpUvY4nPDq70Ay641kNIw5Di1M4kRFkBOtDebJ2B6fimct48C5E9jjcKLwG5yXxQrB07CmdLpgFlveZsmzuTldv5Sqx-2FUY1AL-2B0oTSvMfFsBcoMyLIdOZdIN1AF8it1p3-2F9mv1CZ1x4yIA-3D  – Two of the most hilarious comedians alive — Will Ferrell and Zach Galifianakis — go head?to?head as rivals both running for the same Congressional seat in North Carolina. Their escalating tactics to derail each other’s campaign, supported by various shady characters played by Dan Aykroyd, John Lithgow, Dylan McDermott and Jason Sudeikis (on top of countless real?life cameos), make this one a must?see.  Dave (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB9OSOJOPDTjV1UayJAtOcG959nG4TKdF1zX7RrmEE2vtiSp0UGkxkNcaR-2Baej1FoAg-3D-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs01tZpaz-2Fr8ve6Pyih3UG1XcidRdxJlIm2XhyFaleF900VrzQJhj-2FrE1c9cbaG4J3LqWZy88RJnD-2BTWi4zKJNjUyjJ4vtMHUQyuhbnKQ1Or0iqGGaRM6pRo1bz6XezRP6fzFe-2FjpbH0ix0qJBIpmfvJShkyq49vtRClB8fdQJffBDWG-2FxEE-2BAeF7pqfxOvo7q4ZxnOO7jopRRzSi3ba63vlZNnZeynUzxEqcdLjq64gTqD5VAbCUX16QZuAe1yiFBY-3D  – The sweetest film on this list by far, Dave tells the story of a presidential impersonator (Kevin Kline) who actually ends up taking over the country’s reins when the real president suffers a stroke and falls into a coma. What might happen when a truly good, everyday American goes up against the political machine?  Idiocracy (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB9OSOJOPDTjV1UayJAtOcG87XQev5ub19-2FWLNH5CVqD-2Fs1r-2FTwc1UF8UOleMgKd1Zw-3D-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs01tZpaz-2Fr8ve6Pyih3UG1XcidRdxJlIm2XhyFaleF900VrzQJhj-2FrE1c9cbaG4J3LqWZy88RJnD-2BTWi4zKJNjUyjJ4vtMHUQyuhbnKQ1Or0vTgdYeaMrA8FxgApXlrmY1dS3oJGyMYMdwgVzhkGadsrSGWrVYd44Li4J9pPXohOADB8AOHB55cKH8a0m46qsWv6vMdMZMsFz9dEMlK-2Bn6eRAbmENzXNdAOor1-2FZv34LrY0-2B0mQnXqjamfRSQqfg8w-3D  – In this searing 2006 Mike Judge comedy that is starting to hit a little too close to home, Luke Wilson plays an Army librarian who enters into a state of suspended animation alongside the prostitute Rita (Maya Rudolph) as part of an experiment. When they finally wake up in the year 2505, they realize that humanity has gotten progressively dumber over the centuries, to the point where no one knows how to keep plants alive, reality TV rules, and people are named after products.  Wag the Dog (https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB9OSOJOPDTjV1UayJAtOcG8eKPcvX6KMvybBJ4s02-2BP-2FzQ-2BN127Fh57GZPhF4HLFJQ-3D-3D_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs01tZpaz-2Fr8ve6Pyih3UG1XcidRdxJlIm2XhyFaleF900VrzQJhj-2FrE1c9cbaG4J3LqWZy88RJnD-2BTWi4zKJNjUyjJ4vtMHUQyuhbnKQ1Or0nLcTa2B6FbLAxBUKRoG5WijiCpHTlp1reMxLREmDWHB9W1-2BprLi52wW-2BAJTcVxY-2Fmwkds7YL3S0zVDEaB4ZAp47B3ORbPZKKDtX5qBV5C3FD8V42IEYydcNZJ7AkaAayKRW4JWymox0zxaMDKYfzGM-3D  – This 1997 black comedy brings Dustin Hoffman and Robert De Niro together as a Hollywood producer and a Washington spin doctor who elaborately make up an entire war in Albania in order to distract the public from a presidential sex scandal.  What’s your favorite political comedy?    ______________________  If you would rather not receive future communications from Pitch Public Relations, LLC, please go to https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=mAHw-2B8ZZluKmvldupnv96iy-2F17NrcPfjSezjb-2FSDbKHCNmUIIJhVVAo6T3PzqGFtwoB2z6W8fVp7SdQQfsSj37zAIeFFz8al9vtd1gDg5DEaLFeNfyz0Q-2BxbyKMQfuRCCwHM2reGOFEsG-2Brqcs5KO3XnfqYNj9eoloM2FjaGVXfh7FbI-2FSEkVRD8s8-2BIJD0y_6pchHAirW10eM8b14ZAlkZkRllITHdt0G4CIxpgEX-2FYMT-2FVtvkhkoxOwXdc140hQDKip1v9w6NG6f4yMNdzd3I0JbBoOspHl9BOjIgd0xs01tZpaz-2Fr8ve6Pyih3UG1XcidRdxJlIm2XhyFaleF900VrzQJhj-2FrE1c9cbaG4J3LqWZy88RJnD-2BTWi4zKJNjUyjJ4vtMHUQyuhbnKQ1Or0noWJRGPZrgeerjsJ08-2B-2FYBYEwH-2Bmk-2BEOMf-2FuVZHjStdy34uAm5xNbsq8HlmQdvkzEQ5FcW6xGkHKdVOK4rZizJWIr8We4kto9xCVjB16hkql6HyMNHAlL1M9F-2BlJHmhRgw3v6rzM-2BDsD-2BBMKWb-2BFgY-3D  Pitch Public Relations, LLC, 5751 S.
