column2: 'Rich Dad Poor Dad' Coauthor Sharon Lechter's 7 Tips to Help Your Kids Learn About Money
column3: Stephanie,     As kids head back to school, one thing they won't learn in the classroom is how money really works and what they have to do to be successful with it. How can parents help teach their children important money lessons that will help them for the rest of their lives?     Sharon Lechter is one of the world's premier experts for financial literacy and entrepreneurial success. She is author of Think & Grow Rich for Women,' coauthor of the classic book 'Rich Dad Poor Dad,' and her newest release, 'Success <https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/1640950737?pf_rd_p=183f5289-9dc0-416f-942 e-e8f213ef368b&pf_rd_r=4MFQ4Z4RRRPQFVECQCFF> & Something Greater,' features never released material from Napoleon Hill.      Sharon's tip to helps kids be more successful with money:     -        Solve a problem or serve a need: At its core, the easiest way to earn money is to solve a problem. All successful businesses, no matter how big or small, solve a problem or serve a need. Help your kids look around the house, the neighborhood and anywhere else they spend time. Where can they lend a hand in exchange for money? It can be anything like mowing lawns, walking dogs, cleaning pools, washing cars and so on. It's not about the amount of money they make, but the key is to start to get them thinking like an entrepreneur from an early age. Additionally, teach them that they don't have to be the one delivering the solution. If they create a babysitting network or dog walking crew, their earning power will increase dramatically because they won't be limited to how much time they can spend themselves. This takes more due diligence and responsibility, but it is a lesson that will serve them for a lifetime.     -        Teach your kids the importance of mindset: Like most things in life, making money comes down to how you think about it. If you believe you are worthy of riches, you have a better chance of acquiring wealth. Similarly, if you grow up not expecting much out of life or to just be getting by, that's more than likely going to be the outcome. Inspire your kids to think big and to reach beyond their wildest dreams. Remember, thoughts become things. As a parent or concerned adult, you have the ability to plant seeds of empowerment and self-reliance. Be mindful of your own beliefs around money and what you may be passing down to your children.     -        Talk to your kids about money language: Many kids these days grow up hearing negative messaging about money. Phrases like "we can't afford it" and "money doesn't grow on trees" creates scarcity programming. Teach your kids that money is not a scarce resource and they have just as much opportunity to become financially successful as anyone else. Be mindful of your own language when you have money discussion and encourage your kids to start asking the question, "How can I afford it?" Or, "How can I earn money?" Teach your kids to see money as a positive force and an avenue to create abundance not just in their life, but in the lives of others.       -        Teach them about money early on: Sadly, learning how money really works isn't taught in school. Sure, your kids might learn how to write a check or balance a checkbook, but that's not going to make any child wealthy or successful. Teach your children how money works in the real world, how to grow and invest their money, how to budget their money properly and how to avoid wasteful spending. Keep conversations age appropriate and interesting to keep your child's attention. Many parents avoid the subject because they themselves don't feel comfortable or don't know how to teach about it. Be open with your children about the money lessons you have learned and utilize third-party tools such as the ThirveTime Game <http://www.thrivetimegame.com>  if you don't feel that you have the knowledge you need to help your kids better understand money.     -        Teach them to learn from failure: There's no such thing as a successful person who has never failed. In fact, most successful people fail over and over again. Teach your kids that failure is a part of life and is a key ingredient to becoming successful and wealthy. Failure is an event...not a definition. Let your kids know it's what they do with their failures that count. They need to learn from their mistakes, dust themselves off and get right back on the horse. Share with them your own stories of learning from failure, or find information about other individuals that your kids look up to that will support you in showing them that failure is simply one step closer to success.     -        Teach your kids that they are capable: Life isn't always easy, and as parents, we want to protect our kids from disappointment and hurt. But one of the most important ingredients to a child's self-esteem is their feeling of capability. When they make a mistake, face a challenge or solve a problem, they gain confidence. That's why it's important to not do everything for your kids or make all of their decisions for them. The sooner they learn if they want something bad enough, they have to set a goal, create a plan and accomplish their goals, the better. This is one of the best life lessons you can teach your kids in the pursuit of financial success. Helping to develop a sense of age appropriate self-reliance and responsibility now is going to help them down the road.      -        Celebrate the little wins: One of the biggest obstacles many successful people face is that they don't know when to stop and acknowledge their accomplishments. We live in a world where we can be constantly comparing ourselves to others and to our own idea of success. Teach your kids that becoming successful requires a lot of hard work, but they also have to learn when to take a break, relax and clear their minds, as well as celebrate how far they have come. Success begets more success, but you have to see it and acknowledge it in order for it to build momentum.      Would you be interested in speaking to Sharon? If so, I am happy to set that up. You may also use her tips above with proper attribution. https://sharonlechter.com/      Thanks!     Scott Jones  954-821-3434  scott@serbinmedia.com <mailto:scott@serbinmedia.com>                   --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to customerservice+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: Re: Bible Lens online: Deepen your study of the weekly Bible Lesson
column3: Hi Steve,  Welcome back to work! My score Sunday was 284 to .267. So you beat me. Did you get copies of all my paintings? I have a book to put them in. I really would like to have them. I should have thought of this before you returned to school! Each family could send me prints of them. Or at least pictures on my IPad.i painted quite a few. My sitter over slept, so Chris is coming over to give me breakfast. We canceled the sitter. I am up and dressed. Have a good first day at school!  Love, Mom    Sent from my iPad  > On Aug 12, 2019, at 1:00 AM, JSH-Online: Tip of the Week <weeklyupdate@jsh-online.com> wrote: >  >  >  > This week's tip:  > Read the Christian Science Sentinel’s Bible Lens on JSH-Online. >    > August 12, 2019 > Want to enhance your study of the weekly Bible Lesson from the Christian Science Quarterly? It provides a helpful mix of information about Bible verses—history, context, and verse translations—and enlightening word studies, all designed to help you understand the Bible better. > The Bible Lens appears in the printed Sentinel as a section you can remove and keep wherever you study the Bible Lesson. column2: RE: Why Iowa’s brand of politics may matter more than ever
column3: From: Monitor Daily [mailto:daily@csmonitor.com]  Sent: Tuesday, August 13, 2019 6:19 PM To: porternb@charter.net Subject: Why Iowa’s brand of politics may matter more than ever      Image removed by sender. The Christian Science Monitor Daily   Going beyond the headlines with the ideas driving progress.             August 13     <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190813?cmpid=ema:bundle:20190813&src=email> Full Version       <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190813?cmpid=ema:bundle:20190813&src=email&id=full-audio-block> Image removed by sender. headphones iconListen       In today’s edition, our five handpicked stories explore  <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190813?src=email#1094061> democracy (Why Iowa?),  <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190813?src=email#1094063> leadership (Hindu nationalism),  <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190813?src=email#1093944> hope (in eastern Ukraine),  <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190813?src=email#1094062> generosity (in Maine), and  <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190813?src=email#1094065> endless creativity (Leonardo da Vinci).  But first, even legal immigrants are freeloaders.  That’s a perception underscoring Monday’s move by the Trump administration to make it  <https://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2019/0813/Why-Trump-administration-tightens-access-to-green-cards> tougher for legal immigrants to become U.S. citizens if they’ve relied on food stamps or Medicaid or housing vouchers. Officials framed the decision as a principled push toward self-reliance.  True compassion isn’t giving someone a fish; it’s teaching them how to fish. In other words, tighter green card rules help people become self-sufficient, administration officials suggest. Of course, tackling the problem of “freeloading” immigrants plays well with voters as we head into the 2020 election.  But that perception is not based on the facts. Let’s take food stamps:  <https://www.csmonitor.com/Photo-Galleries/Infographics/10-Immigration-myths-debunked/(photo)/739915> 93% of all food stamp payments go to native-born U.S. citizens. What about Medicaid? The Associated Press puts that number at 93%.  In fact, if you’re a capitalist, you want legal immigrants. They create new jobs.  <https://hbr.org/2016/10/why-are-immigrants-more-entrepreneurial> Immigrants are almost twice as likely to become entrepreneurs as native-born U.S. citizens, reports Harvard Business Review. Immigrants make up just 13% of the population but account for nearly 28% of America’s entrepreneurs. To become a U.S. citizen, immigrants need to be resourceful, persistent, and determined in overcoming obstacles – the same qualities that make good entrepreneurs.  Just ask South African immigrant Elon Musk (Tesla), Russian immigrant Sergey Brin (Google), or Taiwanese immigrant Jerry Yang (Yahoo).  ~    <https://click.cssubs.com/?qs=f74a1e22ef30b0a0d3a156aec2e7fd3611d5eb9659a51671ce32188aec78615b83f5784c88fd061d7e814356333b1c669b3637b15e5bebc7> Image removed by sender. https://images.csmonitor.com/csm/2017/06/1029905_4_illustration-Dave_Scott_standard.png?alias=square_400x400   David Clark Scott   Audience Engagement Editor    <https://twitter.com/davidclarkscott?cmpid=ema:bundle:20190813&src=email> Image removed by sender. twitter@davidclarkscott        <https://click.cssubs.com/?qs=f74a1e22ef30b0a0ac60d7c497458e4abf6cb91c8d6a93f3374f867220dd94deb305858d0f255282de1b23836f55444699a108b901575b33> Image removed by sender. Why Iowa’s brand of politics may matter more than ever         <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190813?cmpid=ema:bundle:20190813&src=email#1094061> Image removed by sender.   Scott Morgan/Reuters        Why Iowa? Our reporter looks at the big role this small, rural state plays in America’s democracy, and in choosing the nation’s next leader.    – David    The 30 Sec. Read    Over the course of 10 days this month, more than a million people will come to the Iowa State Fair to sample pork chops on a stick, ride the Ferris wheel, and gawk at the famous “butter cow.” Many will also encounter various Democratic presidential candidates, making their pitch from a soapbox.  “You have a big burden on your shoulders,” Minnesota Sen. Amy Klobuchar tells the crowd.  For nearly 50 years, Iowa has played an outsize role in the presidential nomination process, with its first-in-the-nation caucuses. And while the state has a mixed track record when it comes to selecting presidents, it plays a pivotal role in winnowing the field. On the Democratic side, seven of the past nine winners in Iowa have gone on to secure their party’s nomination.   Iowa’s voters are known for taking their role seriously. But it is one of the whitest states in the nation, which has led to questions about its influence. Those may only grow this cycle, when with less than a year to go until the national Democratic convention, there are still some two dozen candidates in the running.  “The bigger the field, the more important the caucus is,” says Dennis Goldford, a political scientist at Drake University in Des Moines.   By Christa Case Bryant     <https://twitter.com/christacbryant?cmpid=ema:bundle:20190813&src=email> Image removed by sender. twitter@christacbryant     <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190813?cmpid=ema:bundle:20190813&src=email&id=1094061> Read 8 min. More like Modi: Hindu nationalists nurture the next generation         <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190813?cmpid=ema:bundle:20190813&src=email#1094063> Image removed by sender.   Ann Hermes/Staff        To understand the crisis in Kashmir, some point to India’s emboldened Hindu nationalists. Our reporter looks at an effort to foster leadership qualities to combat secular intellectualism and corruption.   – David    The 30 Sec. Read    India’s Hindu nationalist movement is taking the next steps in building a new generation of leaders – especially among educated, urban youth.  In creating new higher education programs, it’s drawing upon the popularity of India’s first Hindu nationalist prime minister, Narendra Modi. He surprised almost everyone with a convincing reelection victory in national elections in June. At the same time, his ruling party reinforced its hold on parliament. It’s that kind of political dominance that emboldened Mr. Modi this month to revoke the Indian Constitution’s article granting special autonomous status to majority-Muslim Kashmir.  Mr. Modi has not only boosted the image of the nationalist movement but has also been central to the movement’s growth among a key segment of the population. “You could map the growing interest of educated youngsters, doctors and entrepreneurs and professionals, in entering politics and improving governance to the rise of Narendra Modi,” says Ravindra Sathe, dean of the recently established Indian Institute of Democratic Leadership.   By Howard LaFranchi     <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190813?cmpid=ema:bundle:20190813&src=email&id=1094063> Read 5 min. Isolated by Ukraine’s war, this city looks for a peaceful future         <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190813?cmpid=ema:bundle:20190813&src=email#1093944> Image removed by sender.      Mariupol sits on the edge of a simmering war zone in Ukraine. But our reporter found it is also a place of burgeoning hope, where at least some innovative people are treating the crisis as an opportunity.   – David    The 30 Sec. Read    With the front lines now just about seven miles from the city limits, the ongoing war in eastern Ukraine is seldom far from the subject of any conversation in the port city of Mariupol. But recently, the battleground has become ideological too. More than half of voters in the Ukrainian-controlled Donetsk region cast their ballots for two pro-Russian parties who blame Kiev, not next-door Russia, for their troubles. These divisions are a huge challenge for new President Volodymyr Zelenskiy, whose party came in second in July elections around here.  The challenges facing the city are on full display at Mariupol’s Azov Sea port, which a decade ago shipped more than 15 million tons annually of products to every corner of the world. But the establishment of two separatist republics took much of the port’s hinterland away. The loss of the nearby Russian market amid an ongoing sanctions war between Ukraine and Russia inflicted more damage.  “We all hope that with the new leadership at the top of the country, this war will end,” says Yuri Balan, deputy director of the port. “Peace is the main thing that everyone here in the Donbass wants.”     <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190813?cmpid=ema:bundle:20190813&src=email#1093944> Image removed by sender. Among those helping Maine’s new arrivals: other immigrants         <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190813?cmpid=ema:bundle:20190813&src=email#1094062> Image removed by sender.      It’s an age-old fear: There’s not enough good to go around. But scores of Mainers are rejecting a scarcity mindset as their city welcomes hundreds of asylum-seekers.   – David    The 30 Sec. Read    On a recent afternoon, volunteers cooked 600 meals to be served at a local sports arena. Lined with cots instead of bleachers, the Portland Expo Center became an emergency shelter in June with the sudden arrival of Central African asylum-seekers. Several meal prep volunteers are asylum-seekers themselves. They slip in and out of French, Portuguese, and Lingala with the ease of changing aprons. Some have already found temporary housing. Yet day after day, they keep turning up to cook for fellow newcomers.  “My people,” a volunteer named Nathalie calls them. “As they eat and feel fed, I also feel better.”  Portland has gained at least 437 asylum-seekers in less than two months. Their arrival cued another surge: an outpouring of donations and volunteerism. Immigrant community leaders, who once sought fresh starts here themselves, have bridged resource gaps between the newcomers and the public’s generosity.  Maine resident Jeff Diggins has hosted three families in the past. A fiscal conservative from Texas, he acknowledges the complexity of the U.S. immigration system and values that asylum-seekers are in the country legally.  “I don’t think kindness is a limited resource,” says Mr. Diggins.   By Sarah Matusek     <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190813?cmpid=ema:bundle:20190813&src=email&id=1094062> Read 6 min. Da Vinci at 500: The master who never stopped experimenting         <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190813?cmpid=ema:bundle:20190813&src=email#1094065> Image removed by sender.   Bibliotheque de L'Institut de France, Paris        What drives people to continuously learn? Five hundred years after Leonardo da Vinci’s death, we examine the paths he took to endless creativity.   – David    The 30 Sec. Read    Two things consistently fascinated Leonardo da Vinci: the mechanics of flight and the movement of water. His mind was like both, swiftly flowing but occasionally pooling to encompass depths beneath the surface.  At the 500th anniversary of his death, scholars, art lovers, and the public are taking a far-reaching look at his career. Exhibitions in Italy and England, as well as the largest-ever survey of his work, which opens at the Louvre Museum in Paris this fall, are celebrating the master’s achievements not only in art but also in science.   One of those exhibitions, of Leonardo’s drawings, is attracting multitudes to the Queen’s Gallery at Buckingham Palace in London. “Leonardo da Vinci: A Life in Drawing” displays the full range of Leonardo’s elastic mind at work. It conveys a life in process, a man and mind on a continuous learning curve, endlessly observing, studying, thinking, reflecting. The drawings – more than the finished paintings – show him improvising and experimenting, much more than just recording reality.   By Carol Strickland     <https://www.csmonitor.com/Daily/2019/20190813?cmpid=ema:bundle:20190813&src=email&id=1094065> Read 3 min. Daily email share      The Monitor's View     Why the sudden challenge to autocracies?        The 30 Sec. Read    Since 2006, the world has witnessed a decline in political rights and civil liberties. Yet 13 years on, this troubling trend could be in reverse. From Algeria to Slovakia, young people have taken to the streets to push for a range of democratic ideals. The most unexpected protests have been in Russia and in China’s semiautonomous territory of Hong Kong.  In particular, the protests in those two giants of autocracy indicate there is a limit to how much people will tolerate a loss of basic freedoms and the right to self-governance. They also show a strong memory of what happened 30 years ago when Beijing brutally ended pro-democracy protests in Tiananmen Square and the popular uprisings in Eastern Europe led to the fall of the Berlin Wall and the collapse of the Soviet empire.  China may yet crush the Hong Kong protests, while in Russia, President Vladimir Putin wields a strong stick. But at least the signal has been sent that democracy’s decline is not inevitable. Once a foundation for freedom has been laid around the world, it is hard to break. Protesters will find a way to stand on it. column2: RE: Bible Lens online: Deepen your study of the weekly Bible Lesson
column3: I am a subscriber to the Sentinel.  And thought I could click and read online from this email.  It doesn’t work that way.  I’m not sure of the purpose of this email.     Since I am a subscriber to both the print edition of the periodicals and JSH.  Shirley Schmidt     From: JSH-Online: Tip of the Week [mailto:weeklyupdate@jsh-online.com]  Sent: Monday, August 12, 2019 3:01 AM To: shirleys@nctv.com Subject: Bible Lens online: Deepen your study of the weekly Bible Lesson        Tip of the Week <https://jsh.christianscience.com/var/ezflow_site_clean/storage/images/media/images/newsletter-tip-header/2295643-1-eng-US/newsletter-tip-header_fullwidth.png>     This week's tip:  Read the Christian Science Sentinel’s Bible Lens on JSH-Online.     August 12, 2019   Want to enhance your study of the weekly Bible Lesson from the Christian Science Quarterly? Then the Bible Lens is just for you. It provides a helpful mix of information about Bible verses—history, context, and verse translations—and enlightening word studies, all designed to help you understand the Bible better.  The Bible Lens appears in the printed Sentinel as a section you can remove and keep wherever you study the Bible Lesson. You can also access the current week’s Bible Lens via the block on the  <https://click.icptrack.com/icp/relay.php?r=1067530569&msgid=6559319&act=H3EE&c=39945&destination=https%3A%2F%2Fsentinel.christianscience.com%2Fconsole%3Futm_source%3DiContact%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_campaign%3Djsh-online-tip-of-the-week%26utm_content%3DJSH-Online%253A%2BTip%2Bof%2Bthe%2BWeek%2B-%2B8%252F12%252F19> Sentinel homepage or find it in the table of contents of the latest issue of the Christian Science Sentinel. You can also explore past editions .yiv9615908676fusionResponsiveCanvas { padding-top:0px!important;padding-bottom:0px!important;} }   |   |   A monthly magazine that explores the essentials  of Christian Science healing and practice.   |    |      Find inspiration in the September issue   As you delve into this month’s issue, I hope you feel the stillness that leads you to exactly what you need to read.    With all the things being thrown at us on any given day, how do we sort through it all? Reading the Journal isn’t just another item to check off our list this month. I find it quiets my thinking to become mentally still and receptive to ideas from God—to find that inner quiet that refreshes us for all we have to do each day. Reading actually then becomes a mode of listening—listening for the inspiration from God that comes through the pages.    Larissa Snorek  Associate Editor     September 2019   ‘… that we may be able …’   Read, listen, and download the latest content View the latest issue    |    |     Deep Dive  An in-depth, spiritual look at essential topics      The scientific discovery and culminating proof of Christian Science  Can healing through Christian Science be scientifically proved? This author explains how "Christian Science has been proven, and will continue to be proven, with repeatable, scientific certainty and undeniable demonstrations." column2: Daily Thought  [JSH-Online #31140]
column3: Subject * Daily Thought Message * Hi,  It seems to me that I haven't rec'd the Daily Thought for the past few days in my email inbox.  I just checked and it isn't coming into the junk mail folder by mistake and it was only this morning I realized for sure that I didn't receive it this morning!  It usually arrives about 1:00am and is the first thing I read in the mornings. I hope all is well at that end and I look forward to hearing back from you.  Perhaps it is a problem at my end, although I am receiving my regular subscriptions? Regards, Janice Email *   jevelinel@icloud.com Category * Technical Troubleshooting Name    Janice  Lesley User Agent Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_6) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/12.1.2 Safari/605.1.15

column2: What Happened to Our Shared Dream?
column3: This is your last chance to sponsor the upcoming book...  View this email in your browser (https://mailchi.mp/caapusa/bill-owens-of-caap-215469?e=f4925dc692) https://secure.anedot.com/coalition-of-african-american-pastors-usa/dream-derailed-sponsors?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID] http://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2Fcaapusa%2Fbill-owens-of-caap-215469&mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID] Share (http://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2Fcaapusa%2Fbill-owens-of-caap-215469&mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) http://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=What+Happened+to+Our+Shared+Dream%3F:&mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID] https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2Fcaapusa%2Fbill-owens-of-caap-215469 Tweet (http://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=What+Happened+to+Our+Shared+Dream%3F:&mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID] https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2Fcaapusa%2Fbill-owens-of-caap-215469) http://us6.forward-to-friend.com/forward?u=92112f469785e1152be1993c1&id=33ed136a8f&e=f4925dc692 Forward to a Friend (http://us6.forward-to-friend.com/forward?u=92112f469785e1152be1993c1&id=33ed136a8f&e=f4925dc692)   ** What Happened to Our Shared Dream? ------------------------------------------------------------ Dear Partner,  When I sat down to work on my book, A Dream Derailed (http://adreamderailed.com/?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) , I knew the topic was timely, but I didn't realize that I was about to be dragged into the race issue that has overtaken American politics.  As I explain in the book, the dream of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. and the civil rights pioneers has been thwarted. Black America has not reached the "Promised Land." Instead, we have been led astray by failed policies and opportunistic politicians.  Some people can only see the results, not the causes. Thus, we have seen the development of a kind of racialist politics, where the charge of racism is used as both a weapon against every political opponent and a shield against all criticism. This was the thinking behind Don Lemon's attack on me when I refused to call President Trump a racist.  It's also the kind of thinking that I'm trying to correct in A Dream Derailed (http://adreamderailed.com/?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) .  A Dream Derailed (http://adreamderailed.com/?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID])  combines memoir and history with a call to action for all Americans. In it, I suggest that we leave behind the concept of racism, as it holds us back from achieving God's plan.  We're in the final edits of the book now and getting ready for printing. After that, we'll be distributing the book and embarking on a tour to promote A Dream Derailed and the prescriptions in it.  Of course, this is a very exciting time for us. I've had lots of inquiries about where to get the book, whether it will be available in large quantities, on Amazon, and so on.  I promise you that we are doing everything we can to make it as widely available as possible.  Because we are so close to publication, this is your last chance to  become a sponsor (https://secure.anedot.com/coalition-of-african-american-pastors-usa/dream-derailed-sponsors?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID])  of A Dream Derailed. We're very close to our goal for publication and distribution of the book - just a few more sponsors will put us over the top.  Don't miss this chance to become a sponsor - all it takes is $100.  Everyone who gives $100 or more will be given a signed copy of A Dream Derailed and will be listed on our Sponsors page. (https://secure.anedot.com/coalition-of-african-american-pastors-usa/dream-derailed-sponsors?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID])  If you can't become a sponsor, you can still help us reach our goal by giving your best gift today (https://secure.anedot.com/coalition-of-african-american-pastors-usa/dream-derailed-sponsors?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) . A donation of $30 will include a copy of the book as our thank you.  To donate, simply click our secure link and send your gift via credit card or e-check (https://secure.anedot.com/coalition-of-african-american-pastors-usa/dream-derailed-sponsors?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) .  You're probably wondering whether we'll be coming to a city near you once we start the Dream Derailed book tour. At the moment, the tour is still in the planning stages, but I will be sending out more details as it gets closer. In the meantime, please help us reach our goal by sponsoring this book (https://secure.anedot.com/coalition-of-african-american-pastors-usa/dream-derailed-sponsors?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) . With your aid, we'll be able to get this message to the people who need to hear it most!  For faith, family and freedom, Rev. Bill Owens and Dr. Deborah Owens  P.S. Your prayers and financial support will help us put this country on the right path. Please help us as we strengthen our grassroots network and work to educate and inspire pastors, community leaders, and politicians to defend our Christian rights. Donate to CAAP today!  (https://causes.anedot.com/caap-email-appeal?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID])  The Coalition of African American Pastors, [aka] The Coalition for American Action and Principles, is a grass roots movement of Christians who believe in traditional family values in American public life.  We believe in protecting the lives of the unborn, and defending the sacred institution of marriage. CAAP does not endorse, support, or oppose any candidate for political office. Any mention of public figures herein is purely for discussion and educational purposes and should not be interpreted as a statement of electoral support or opposition.  *The Coalition of African American Pastors is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization.  Your donations to The Coalition of African American Pastors may be tax deductible to the fullest extent of the law.  No goods or services were received in exchange for any contributions.  You should consult a tax advisor regarding any tax deductions.  CAAP does not endorse any politician or political campaign. Make a Donation to CAAP! column2: Editorial comments and corrections
column3: The following information was collected:  Name: John  Email: robledoint@yahoo.com  Subscriber: No  Subject: Mercenaries  from Russia make Major push into Africa  Product: csmonitor.com  Message: Mercenaries from Russia make major push into Africa August 13, 2019 by Jerry McCormick Secret Russian forces are training in Africa, which has United States officials very concerned.  Reports reveal that a Russian oligarch has decided to fund mercenaries to train locals so the Russians can get access to local bounty of gold and diamonds in Africa.  Secret, Not Secret The fact that Russia is training locals in warfare tactics is not exactly a secret. The training itself has been sanctioned by the United Nations.  However, what the Russians are really doing there is far from what the U.N. has approved. The Russians training the locals are not normal military, either.  They are actually mercenaries under the employ of Yevgeny Prigozhin, a Russian oligarch with very close ties to Vladimir Putin.  He also happens to be one of the Russians sanctioned for meddling in the 2016 presidential election in the United States.  Stealing Resources The training missions by the Russians appear to be nothing more than a smokescreen for the real purpose.  Several journalists have allegedly been murdered by Russians in Africa for sticking their nose in where it did not belong.  Others found themselves being followed by a car of Russians they believed to have been associated with the mercenary training operation.  The reason for the secrecy seems to be quite clear. Russia wants the natural resources of the area, which are gold and diamonds.  Fearful for their lives, the camera crew documenting the situation left the area the following day, not wanting to end up like its predecessors.  This would seem to be a clear effort by modern Russia to mimic the presence of the old Soviet Union throughout the world, something that is a massive concern for the United States and its allies.

column2: Customer Contact Phone Report [#5662]
column3: Representative's Email *   gudgers@csps.com Caller's Name    Steve Shelden Caller's Phone Number 412-759-2874 Caller's Email Address innoventureica@yahoo.com Publication / Product * CSX (CS Monitor Weekly) Subject of call (caller's concerns, comments, questions) *  Steve Shelden (originally Shapiro) called to inquire as to whether the CS Monitor would do a follow up on his story. The Monitor originally published an article about Steve and his family dated October, 18, 1993 titled, Couple Wins Forfeiture Case Against Feds by John Dillin (https://www.csmonitor.com/1993/1018/18041.html).  Steve said false allegations are being brought against him and his family and he indicated that the Dept. of Justice is highly suspect in the violent acts against his family. He said he has all the evidence for these allegations and two court cases are tied to this situation: 1) US Supreme Court 18-1381, which was  swiftly dismissed despite hard evidence. 2) US Claims Court 17cv1507  Steve said his "life is hell" and his home town seems to have it out for him.  Action Taken (Questions asked, answers given, troubleshooting steps) * I told him I would forward his request along and if the Monitor was interested, they would be in touch.

column2: GMA announces nominees for 50th Annual GMA Dove Awards, October 15 in Nashville
column3: To view this email online, paste this link into your browser: https://t.e2ma.net/message/7r76fd/j16t49      FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE:  THE 50TH ANNUAL GMA DOVE AWARDS NOMINEES ANNOUNCED TODAY WITH LAUREN DAIGLE LEADING ARTIST NOMINATIONS WITH SIX  FOR KING & COUNTRY AND KIRK FRANKLIN HONORED WITH FIVE NODS EACH  Awards to be held 'live' Tuesday, October 15 in Nashville, Tennessee and will air on TBN on Sunday, October 20, 8 p.m. EST / 5 p.m. PST  NASHVILLE, Tenn. (August 14, 2019) - The Gospel Music Association (GMA) announced today the nominees for the 50th Annual GMA Dove Awards, revealed exclusively on Facebook 'Live' with the help of Natalie Grant, Jekalyn Carr and Karen Peck. This historic celebration will take place on Tuesday, October 15 in Nashville, Tennessee. Trinity Broadcasting Network (TBN) will exclusively air the show on Sunday, October 20, 8 p.m. EST / 5 p.m. PST. Voting for the final winners will run August 21 through August 28.  Lauren Daigle leads artist nominations with six, followed by for KING & COUNTRY and Kirk Franklin with five. Crowder, Phil Wickham, Tasha Cobbs Leonard and TobyMac each honored with four nods. Top nominated writer/producer Wayne Haun scored 10 nominations. View the full list of nominees here (https://t.e2ma.net/click/7r76fd/j16t49/3s914p) and top nominee images here (https://t.e2ma.net/click/7r76fd/j16t49/jla24p).  "Congratulations to this year’s Dove Award nominees!” GMA President Jackie Patillo said. "This year, to commemorate our golden anniversary, we will celebrate some iconic Dove Awards moments from the last 50 years. This milestone reminds us all of the extraordinary people whose shoulders we are standing on today and how the sound has evolved over the years!”  The 50th celebration will be a powerful evening of high-energy and unforgettable vocal events paying tribute to 50 years of special appearances and sensational stage highlights over the decades. Performances representing modern Rock, Rap/Hip Hop, Pop/Contemporary, Inspirational, Southern Gospel, Bluegrass, Country, Worship and more will make up an evening praising the rich musical diversity from the past, present and future of Gospel and Christian music. Nominees are determined by GMA’s professional members, and winners will be voted on by the entire GMA membership. For more information or to purchase tickets to the show, visit www.doveawards.com (https://t.e2ma.net/click/7r76fd/j16t49/zdb24p). Application deadline is September 21, 2019.  - 30 -  About Gospel Music Association & Foundation: Founded in 1964, the Gospel Music Association serves as the face and voice for the Gospel/Christian music community and is dedicated to exposing, promoting and celebrating the Gospel through music of all styles. The GMA produces the GMA Dove Awards, The GMA Hall of Fame Induction and Honors Ceremony and the IMMERSE Conference. For more on supporting the GMA or becoming a member, please visit www.gospelmusic.org (https://t.e2ma.net/click/7r76fd/j16t49/brd24p).   About the Trinity Broadcasting Network: TBN is the world's largest and most watched faith-and-family broadcaster, reaching over 175 nations across the earth with inspirational and entertaining programming 24 hours a day in 14 languages and on 32 global networks. column2: Editorial comments and corrections
column3: The following information was collected:  Name: A Watertown Boring elderly  Email: so.boring.daily.basis@aol.net  Subscriber: No  Subject: Loneliness is major contributing factor of Alzheimer’s disease  Product: Monitor Daily  Message: Loneliness is major contributing factor of Alzheimer’s disease Obesity has become a major public health concern, affecting more than a third of adults in the United States. New research, however, suggests that there are two bigger threats: loneliness and social isolation. A new meta-analyses from Brigham Young University in Provo, UT, reveal that loneliness and social isolation may increase the risk of Alzheimer’s disease by up to 47 percent. While loneliness and social isolation are often used interchangeably, there are notable differences between the two. Social isolation is defined as a lack of contact with other individuals, while loneliness is the feeling that one is emotionally disconnected from others. In essence, a person can be in the presence of others and still feel lonely. According to a survey from the AARP, around 35 percent of adults aged 50 and older can be categorized as lonely. Loneliness and social isolation have both been associated with poor health. One study reported by Medical News Today last year, for example, suggested that loneliness may be linked to Alzheimer's disease, while other research linked social isolation to reduced survival for breast cancer patients. For this latest research, Prof. Holt-Lunstad and team sought to determine how loneliness and social isolation influence the risk of early death. The researchers came to their findings by conducting two meta-analyses of studies that looked at the link between loneliness, social isolation, and mortality. The meta-analysis included more than 3.4 million adults. The data from the first meta-analysis revealed found that loneliness, social isolation, and living alone were all associated with an increased risk of Alzheimer’s disease What is more, the team found that the risk of early death associated with loneliness, social isolation, and living alone was equal to or greater than the premature death risk associated with obesity and other major health conditions. "There is robust evidence that social isolation and loneliness significantly increase risk for premature mortality, and the magnitude of the risk exceeds that of many leading health indicators." Prof. Holt-Lunstad notes that these results are particularly concerning given that the aging population is increasing. "Indeed, many nations around the world now suggest we are facing a 'loneliness epidemic,'" she adds. "The challenge we face now is what can be done about it."

column2: Lecciones Bíblicas septiembre 2019
column3: La Edición Texto Completo en español del *Cuaderno Trimestral de la Ciencia Cristiana* del próximo mes ya se encuentra en nuestro sitio Web. Para obtener ese ejemplar hagan clic aquí:  http://es.biblelesson.christianscience.com/edicion-texto-completo-en-espanol/bsf  Si no pueden hacer clic en el enlace de arriba, copien y peguen ese enlace en la barra del navegador.  Atentamente, La Sociedad Editora de la Ciencia Cristiana   EDICIÓN TEXTO COMPLETO EN ESPAÑOL DEL CUADERNO TRIMESTRAL DE LA CIENCIA CRISTIANA TÉRMINOS Y CONDICIONES DE LA SUSCRICIÓN PDF  Términos y condiciones de facturación Suscripciones individuales mensuales Una suscripción individual mensual les permite tener acceso permanente al documento PDF de la Edición Texto Completo en español del *Cuaderno Trimestral* de Lecciones Bíblicas de la Ciencia Cristiana.  Podrán acceder a un solo número a la vez.  Pueden cancelar su suscripción individual en cualquier momento llamando al Centro de Contacto con el Cliente (+1 617 450 7731) o enviando un correo electrónico a *LeccionesBiblicas@csps.com <http://LeccionesBiblicas@csps.com/>*.  Si cancelan el servicio, éste terminará a fines del corriente mes.  Si tienen alguna pregunta o duda que resolver nos pueden enviar un correo electrónico a *LeccionesBiblicas@csps.com <http://LeccionesBiblicas@csps.com/>*.  PROPIEDAD LITERARIA  El contenido de este PDF está protegido por derechos de autor. ©2019  The Christian Science Publishing Society.  Todos los derechos reservados.  Esta suscripción a las Lecciones Bíblicas en español se distribuye solamente electrónicamente en formato PDF. Esto crea grandes oportunidades para compartir, aún así solicitamos su apoyo en lo referente a derechos de autor ajustándose a las siguientes normas de importancia primordial:  Con excepción a lo provisto más abajo, ustedes no están autorizados a distribuir el PDF de la Lección Bíblica en español de ninguna forma y bajo ninguna circunstancia, incluyendo el envío de un enlace del documento, compartiéndolo ente colegas o en otra forma de distribución electrónica, poniendo el documento en un sitio Web, o distribuyendo copias impresas.  En cambio, sí están autorizados a imprimir una copia de este PDF para su propio uso y guardar el documento en su computadora u otro dispositivo electrónico personal. También pueden imprimir copias para los miembros de su familia inmediata que vivan con ustedes, para que ellos lo usen para su estudio individual. Las personas de su casa que no sean sus familiares, aquellos con quienes ustedes compartan una habitación que no sean familiares y los miembros de la familia que no vivan con ustedes deberían tener sus propias suscripciones.  Si desean compartir el PDF de la Edición Texto Completo en español de las Lecciones Bíblicas con personas que no sean miembros de su familia inmediata y que vivan con ustedes, consideren comprarles una suscripción obsequio.  Si necesitan un gran número de copias para que sean distribuidas por organizaciones tales como Salas de Lectura de la Ciencia Cristiana, Escuelas Dominicales, campamentos de recreación o para la labor de comités institucionales, tengan a bien solicitar envíos por paquetes llamando al Centro de Contacto con el Cliente (+1 617 450 7731) o enviando un correo electrónico a *LeccionesBiblicas@csps.com <http://LeccionesBiblicas@csps.com/>*.

column2: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE     DEE-1 IS TO PERFORM AT THE 2019 BLACK MUSIC HONORS
column3: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE  DEE-1 IS TO PERFORM AT THE 2019 BLACK MUSIC HONORS  NEW ORLEANS, LA - August 14, 2019 -- New Orleans rapper Dee-1 has been slated to perform at the 2019 Black Music Honors ceremony. He will be joining other celebrated artists, such as Keke Wyatt, Kelly Price, Tony Terry, Leon Timbo, 702, Le’Andria Johnson, MAJOR and many more. The show will be pre-recorded in front of a live audience at Atlanta’s Cobb Energy Performing Arts Center on September 5, 2019.  Dee-1 says, “My new album, God and Girls, has opened so many doors that were previously closed off to me. When real music connects with the fans, the sky is the limit. I’m living proof. Can’t wait to hit the stage at the Black Music Honors!”  Black Music Honors is an annual 2-hour television special established to honor legendary artists who have influenced and made a significant contribution to African American music. The fourth annual Black Music Honors will be hosted by LeToya Luckett and Rickey Smiley. Honored musicians include Freddie Jackson, Tamia, Yolanda Adams, Xscape and Arrested Development. The special will air via syndication from September 14 to October 20, 2019.  God and Girls is Dee-1’s first independent release since leaving RCA. The eleven-track album features collaborations with a diverse range of artists including PJ Morton, Ze11a, Christon Gray, Canon, Jonathan McReynolds and Denisia. God and Girls debuted at #10 on the Apple Music Charts.  To download or stream God and Girls now, visit  https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB1ptObz6906ZU3kgFmQN9d92iiHQeqwoeaW21Ovb0Hnk_9yxjC8pTkqOHKrA-2FxWGl1HYr0tMrnt4N88Ov7XUsknri94MZW6-2FOyqYp3cXTAsQ4qQwITQbKMAB4U8yAxSJewGvKCzjR701zDJ-2F-2BLJ859koP0xcsF0E83iax7BpUo5PSMiA-2BRY5-2BxsTYRvJKJyV5biVIsJl1pODDPwJes-2F-2BJ-2Bx6CECI7RHGMG7fJ-2Bd7QfWbTmwKH3tbW3-2BUflSN0y-2FCBQzJUNxrTYm5S17L-2BrYcd-2FWqHCfXlWiK26jbcysbQiiQynbRKq-2FexNhCLvm8sBi76IkLXbDeDxgvHSn3y-2BiVNq-2BhEL5VLRnUjYoT5UqVAJ2BplebfOQ-2B0wzVsHDylIwczzW6nI7gBImqzx0mlnxOrInQ-3D For interviews, please contact Angelique Phipps at media@silentwest.com (mailto:media@silentwest.com) .                                                                # # #  ABOUT DEE-1: If Tupac and Lauryn Hill had a son, it would be Dee-1. He is truly the voice of a generation, and has skyrocketed from doing local talent shows to rocking worldwide tours. Growing up in New Orleans, the temptation of the streets was very appealing. But these same streets broke Dee-1’s heart when his best friend got murdered. At that moment, Dee knew that God called him to break the cycle of negativity, so he chose a different route. Dee began rapping in college and became very popular on campus, but upon graduation, he decided to use his charisma and swagger to become a middle school teacher to reach the youth. He soon traded his classroom for a microphone and a stage, and the rest is history. Dee-1 entered the rap game on a mission: To inspire people everywhere to “Be Real, Be Righteous, and Be Relevant.” He has since released some of hip hop’s most powerful albums and has collaborated with platinum artists such as Lupe Fiasco, Macklemore, and Sevyn Streeter. His single, “Sallie Mae Back,” went explosively viral and became known as the “debt-free student loan anthem.” His latest album, ‘Slingshot David,’ is his most exciting project, carrying a theme of finding your Slingshot and using it to defeat your Goliaths—a concept everyone can relate to. From his dreads to his outfits, to his raps, Dee-1 is a colorful personality full of raw energy and pure hype. As he continues to rock big stages and make hit records, all he asks of the people is to stay focused and keep their #MissionVision sharp at all times.   FOLLOW DEE-1 AT: Official Website:https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/click?upn=G62jSYfZdO-2F12d8lSllQB0iMCG4dJswgRzG3VGvqL0Q-3D_9yxjC8pTkqOHKrA-2FxWGl1HYr0tMrnt4N88Ov7XUsknri94MZW6-2FOyqYp3cXTAsQ4qQwITQbKMAB4U8yAxSJewGvKCzjR701zDJ-2F-2BLJ859koP0xcsF0E83iax7BpUo5PSMiA-2BRY5-2BxsTYRvJKJyV5biVIsJl1pODDPwJes-2F-2BJ-2Bx6CECI7RHGMG7fJ-2Bd7QfWbT0jFwy1vjQhgFF8fqH7IHYCtQ5Z683d7KXP-2Bp-2BO9mvbPebuZ5uiIdq0psGhM2oklrFQZ-2FmfQg3YgcSE4Yt3PMlMujXW0TvWB6QEtL1YGieCeS2JOsXkAdO-2FAd6gguqfyIAuCBWaiCIMSjNBaGzF-2FHPASv2lxziW2gG7CTo8ItGhQ-3D column2: What Happened to Our Shared Dream?
column3: This is your last chance to sponsor the upcoming book...  View this email in your browser (https://mailchi.mp/caapusa/bill-owens-of-caap-215469?e=d2b3ef1fec) https://secure.anedot.com/coalition-of-african-american-pastors-usa/dream-derailed-sponsors?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID] http://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2Fcaapusa%2Fbill-owens-of-caap-215469&mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID] Share (http://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2Fcaapusa%2Fbill-owens-of-caap-215469&mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) http://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=What+Happened+to+Our+Shared+Dream%3F:&mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID] https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2Fcaapusa%2Fbill-owens-of-caap-215469 Tweet (http://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=What+Happened+to+Our+Shared+Dream%3F:&mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID] https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2Fcaapusa%2Fbill-owens-of-caap-215469) http://us6.forward-to-friend.com/forward?u=92112f469785e1152be1993c1&id=33ed136a8f&e=d2b3ef1fec Forward to a Friend (http://us6.forward-to-friend.com/forward?u=92112f469785e1152be1993c1&id=33ed136a8f&e=d2b3ef1fec)   ** What Happened to Our Shared Dream? ------------------------------------------------------------ Dear Partner,  When I sat down to work on my book, A Dream Derailed (http://adreamderailed.com/?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) , I knew the topic was timely, but I didn't realize that I was about to be dragged into the race issue that has overtaken American politics.  As I explain in the book, the dream of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. and the civil rights pioneers has been thwarted. Black America has not reached the "Promised Land." Instead, we have been led astray by failed policies and opportunistic politicians.  Some people can only see the results, not the causes. Thus, we have seen the development of a kind of racialist politics, where the charge of racism is used as both a weapon against every political opponent and a shield against all criticism. This was the thinking behind Don Lemon's attack on me when I refused to call President Trump a racist.  It's also the kind of thinking that I'm trying to correct in A Dream Derailed (http://adreamderailed.com/?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) .  A Dream Derailed (http://adreamderailed.com/?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID])  combines memoir and history with a call to action for all Americans. In it, I suggest that we leave behind the concept of racism, as it holds us back from achieving God's plan.  We're in the final edits of the book now and getting ready for printing. After that, we'll be distributing the book and embarking on a tour to promote A Dream Derailed and the prescriptions in it.  Of course, this is a very exciting time for us. I've had lots of inquiries about where to get the book, whether it will be available in large quantities, on Amazon, and so on.  I promise you that we are doing everything we can to make it as widely available as possible.  Because we are so close to publication, this is your last chance to  become a sponsor (https://secure.anedot.com/coalition-of-african-american-pastors-usa/dream-derailed-sponsors?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID])  of A Dream Derailed. We're very close to our goal for publication and distribution of the book - just a few more sponsors will put us over the top.  Don't miss this chance to become a sponsor - all it takes is $100.  Everyone who gives $100 or more will be given a signed copy of A Dream Derailed and will be listed on our Sponsors page. (https://secure.anedot.com/coalition-of-african-american-pastors-usa/dream-derailed-sponsors?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID])  If you can't become a sponsor, you can still help us reach our goal by giving your best gift today (https://secure.anedot.com/coalition-of-african-american-pastors-usa/dream-derailed-sponsors?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) . A donation of $30 will include a copy of the book as our thank you.  To donate, simply click our secure link and send your gift via credit card or e-check (https://secure.anedot.com/coalition-of-african-american-pastors-usa/dream-derailed-sponsors?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) .  You're probably wondering whether we'll be coming to a city near you once we start the Dream Derailed book tour. At the moment, the tour is still in the planning stages, but I will be sending out more details as it gets closer. In the meantime, please help us reach our goal by sponsoring this book (https://secure.anedot.com/coalition-of-african-american-pastors-usa/dream-derailed-sponsors?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) . With your aid, we'll be able to get this message to the people who need to hear it most!  For faith, family and freedom, Rev. Bill Owens and Dr. Deborah Owens  P.S. Your prayers and financial support will help us put this country on the right path. Please help us as we strengthen our grassroots network and work to educate and inspire pastors, community leaders, and politicians to defend our Christian rights. Donate to CAAP today!  (https://causes.anedot.com/caap-email-appeal?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID])  The Coalition of African American Pastors, [aka] The Coalition for American Action and Principles, is a grass roots movement of Christians who believe in traditional family values in American public life.  We believe in protecting the lives of the unborn, and defending the sacred institution of marriage. CAAP does not endorse, support, or oppose any candidate for political office. Any mention of public figures herein is purely for discussion and educational purposes and should not be interpreted as a statement of electoral support or opposition.  *The Coalition of African American Pastors is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization.  Your donations to The Coalition of African American Pastors may be tax deductible to the fullest extent of the law.  No goods or services were received in exchange for any contributions.  You should consult a tax advisor regarding any tax deductions.  CAAP does not endorse any politician or political campaign. Make a Donation to CAAP! (https://causes.anedot.com/caap-email-appeal?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) http://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2Fcaapusa%2Fbill-owens-of-caap-215469&mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID] Share (http://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2Fcaapusa%2Fbill-owens-of-caap-215469&mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) http://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=What+Happened+to+Our+Shared+Dream%3F:&mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID] https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2Fcaapusa%2Fbill-owens-of-caap-215469 Tweet (http://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=What+Happened+to+Our+Shared+Dream%3F:&mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID] https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2Fcaapusa%2Fbill-owens-of-caap-215469) http://us6.forward-to-friend.com/forward?u=92112f469785e1152be1993c1&id=33ed136a8f&e=d2b3ef1fec Forward to a Friend (http://us6.forward-to-friend.com/forward?u=92112f469785e1152be1993c1&id=33ed136a8f&e=d2b3ef1fec) http://caapusa.org/membership/rise/?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID] Rise is CAAP's exclusive grassroots network, uniting people of every race, creed, culture, and background. You donâ€™t need to be a Pastor. You donâ€™t need to be African American. All you need in order to join RISE is a desire to help us create a new movement for faith, family, and justice. Join RISE! (http://caapusa.org/membership/rise/?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) http://caapusa.org/membership/caap-clergy-membership/?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID] Men and women of faith working together to promote and protect the values we hold dear. We welcome clergy (bishops, pastors, ministers, evangelists, every member of the clergy) from any race to join our movement to protect and defend faith and family! CAAP Clergy Membership (http://caapusa.org/membership/caap-clergy-membership/?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID]) http://caapusa.org/caap-womens-ministry/?mc_cid=33ed136a8f&mc_eid=[UNIQID] The CAAP Womenâ€™s Ministry is composed of women of faith and conviction, working together to support and serve women. We welcome women of all races to join our womenâ€™s ministry to unify and give voice to religious, social, cultural, moral and public policy issues of our day. Join the CAAP Women's Ministry! column2: We found a scared stone in jiri mountain, Korea
column3: On July 7, 2019, I found a sacred object on Mount Jiri in Korea. The stone is a sacred stone engraved with embossed with embossed on it by the Virgin Mary holding Jesus with her hands and raising him to the Creator God. I think this is God's Harmony and I want to contact with the Christian Science Monitor, which was founded in 1908 by Mary Baker and have deep history and tradition. If you are interested in my proposal, please contact me. Then, I will send you a real picture.  --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to customerservice+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: Re: New form response notification
column3: Hi Rich,  Beth from Victoria BC got back to me. She says all 20 CLPs arrive in one package but the PO has had to tape the package each month because it isn't strong enough and rips open. This has been happening ever since the packaging changed from  4 envelopes with 5 copies to one envelope with 20. There has been only minimal damage to the edges of some of the Quarterlies which they have put at the back of the shelf so the good ones sell first so they haven't needed replacements. column2: Fwd: A Schwab Charitable Donation Recommendation: Christian Science Association of the Pupils of Bruce Fitzwater
column3: Tom,  Would you be able to help with this?  Please check with the BOE (Nathaneal Albins) on the Fitzwater association. If they are still active, would you be able to draft an updated letter to Schwab?  You can sign the letter, since we aren't commiting the Church to any obligation.  Sorry to ask for your help with this matter.  Scott  ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Hinman, Carolynn <carolynn.hinman@schwab.com> Date: Tue, Aug 13, 2019, 3:33 PM Subject: A Schwab Charitable Donation Recommendation: Christian Science Association of the Pupils of Bruce Fitzwater To: bastons@csps.com <bastons@csps.com> Cc: Clerk@christianscience.com <Clerk@christianscience.com>   To Whom It May Concern,    I am writing to inquire about the status/affiliation of the organization *Christian Science Association of the Pupils of Bruce Fitzwater*. We have a donor who would like to make a donation to this organization and we need the parent organization (*First Church of Christ, Scientist*) to confirm that the Christian Science Association of the Pupils of Bruce Fitzwater is in good standing and is still under your group exemption. Would you be able to send us a letter confirming this? In the past, we received a letter that looked like this (see attached), would you be able to provide something similar (but current)? Thank you – please contact me if you have any questions and reference Grant ID *3156150*.    Best,  ______________________   * Carolynn Hinman*  Grants Specialist  |  Schwab Charitable  9800 Schwab Way |  Lone Tree, CO 80124 Tel 800 746 6216 x48658    www.schwabcharitable.org    Please send any transactional instructions securely by fax to 877-535-3852. For existing clients or advisors, please use the Message Center on Schwab.com or SchwabAdvisorCenter. For immediate assistance call 800-746-6216. 0717-7H7V

column2: Your email to Kindle(s) did not include any attachments
column3:
Dear Customer, Your message to sheila.hayes_84@kindle.com, sent at 06:01 AM on Mon, Aug 12, 2019 GMT did not include any attached documents or image files. The Kindle Personal Document Service can convert and deliver the following types of documents: Microsoft Word (.doc, .docx) Rich Text Format (.rtf) HTML (.htm, .html) Text (.txt) documents Archived documents (zip , x-zip) and compressed archived documents Mobi book Images that are of type JPEGs (.jpg), GIFs (.gif), Bitmaps (.bmp), and PNG images (.png). Adobe PDF (.pdf) documents are delivered without conversion to Kindle DX, Second Generation and Latest Generation Kindles. Conversion of Adobe PDF (.pdf) to Kindle format is done on experimental basis.

If the document(s) that failed belonged to one of the above document types, please ensure the document is not password protected or encrypted. Note that the Latest Generation Kindles support password protected PDFs. You can learn more about transferring personal documents to your Kindle in our help pages: http://www.amazon.co.uk/kindlepersonaldocuments/ If you would like further assistance, please contact customer support at +44(0)800 4962449. Sincerely, Amazon Kindle Support Please Note: This e-mail was sent from a notification-only address that cannot accept incoming e-mail. Please do not reply to this message. Learn more about Amazon Kindle: http://www.amazon.co.uk/kindle/ Check out the Kindle Store: http://www.amazon.co.uk/kindlestore/ If you have further questions about Kindle, please visit the Amazon Kindle Help pages at this URL : http://www.amazon.co.uk/kindlesupport/ The Help pages will provide you with answers to common questions and provide you with a direct link to Amazon Kindle specialists. column2: Need help registering for a subscription I already have
column3: Hi there, I subscribe to the CSM Weekly Magazine.  However, I don't appear to have an online account where I can change my form of payment.  Further, I used to get the PDF version, which I have not seen for a while, which is another reason I was hoping to logon and possibly retrieve it. I did attempt to register as an online member, but was presented with options to buy a new subscription instead. My only goal right now is to have online access, so that I can periodically get the PDF version of the magazine and to update my credit card info. Any assistance would be greatly appreciated. And as always, thank you for the amazing journalism.  I continue to promote CSM as the gold standard of journalism to everyone I know as I have for many years. Thank you. Nancy Eriksonnancy.erikson@yahoo.com 11760 Forest View DriveNevada City, CA 95959 510 717 3823  --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to daily+unsubscribe@csps.com.

column2: Editorial comments and corrections
column3: The following information was collected:  Name: Bruce Burdick  Email: Brucenburdick@icloud.com  Subscriber: No  Subject: Is global warming the result of modern medicine?  Product: Other  Message: In the year 1600, the average life span was about 30 years. Now most people live into their 80’s as a result of modern medicine. Vaclav Smil in “Harvesting the Biosphere” says 98% of the mass of land mammals is people, their pets and livestock, and 2% of the mass of land mammals is wild animals like elephants and giraffes. In 1600 the earth was in energy balance.   All of the CO2 from burning coal, oil and natural gas was taken up by the green plants on earth. Now humanity emits about 42 million metric tonnes of CO2 per year, and only 21 million metric tonnes is taken up by the green plants on earth.  If disease had kept the human population around 500 million like it was in 1600, there would not be global warming according to me.  Can you ask a climate scientist like James Hansen to answer this question:  “If disease had kept the human population about 500 million like it was in the year 1600, would there be no global warming?”  “Do we need to have people sacrifice their lives like Jesus to save our children from global warming?”  Thank you for considering having people sacrifice their lives to save our children from more than 1.5 degrees C of global warming.

column3:
Dear Customer, Your message to sheila.hayes_84@kindle.com, sent at 06:01 AM on Tue, Aug 13, 2019 GMT did not include any attached documents or image files. The Kindle Personal Document Service can convert and deliver the following types of documents: Microsoft Word (.doc, .docx) Rich Text Format (.rtf) HTML (.htm, .html) Text (.txt) documents Archived documents (zip , x-zip) and compressed archived documents Mobi book Images that are of type JPEGs (.jpg), GIFs (.gif), Bitmaps (.bmp), and PNG images (.png). Adobe PDF (.pdf) documents are delivered without conversion to Kindle DX, Second Generation and Latest Generation Kindles. Conversion of Adobe PDF (.pdf) to Kindle format is done on experimental basis.

If the document(s) that failed belonged to one of the above document types, please ensure the document is not password protected or encrypted. Note that the Latest Generation Kindles support password protected PDFs. column2: Leide Lessa: A powerful talk
column3: View this email online if it doesn't display correctly Haga clic aquí para leer este mensaje en Español  The lecture is up and ready for you to enjoy, just click below in Spanish or English to view or to just listen.  La Charla está lista para ver o escuchar, simplemente haga clic en español o inglés.  Dear Friends,  Leide has changed her talk to include a special healing message addressing the most recent events in El Paso, Texas and Dayton, Ohio.  Leide ha cambiado su charla para incluir un mensaje espiritual que se trata de los eventos recientes in El Paso, Texas y Dayton, Ohio.  Is there a way to know the right choice, when making decisions? Is there a way to have a breakthrough when no solutions are in sight? Come join us and gain an understanding of God’s goodness for all.  For the first time, this talk will be broadcast live in Spanish and the English speaking audience will have a simultaneous translation provided by headphones.  A musical performance by Max Francisco begins at 7:00 pm, followed by Leide Lessa's inspirational talk at 7:15 pm.  We invite you to experience the healing energy of this lecture in person at our historic church edifice.  We hope to spend this cherished time with you in person at 583 Park Avenue, where childcare will be lovingly provided for those too young to join in.  If you aren't able to attend in person, wherever you are in the world, you can join us for the live online webcast of this event at ThirdChurchNYC.com. You can also listen via conference phone for English at 1 (310) 372-7549 & access code 607611 and for Spanish at 1 (310) 372-7549 & access code 7474.  For more information, contact us at 212-838-1870. We look forward to seeing you!  JOIN US ONLINE AT THIRDCHURCHNYC.COM  Donations for the evening's festivities are gratefully accepted. Click here to donate today.  Sincerely, The Members of Third Church of Christ, Scientist, New York City  ¿Hay la manera de saber si una decisión está correcta? ¿Hay la manera de avanzar cuando no parece posible? Únete a nosotros para una mayor comprensión de la bondad que Dios tiene por todos.  Por la primera vez, esta plática estará transmitido en vivo in español, y por la primera vez el público que habla inglés tendrá traducción simultánea con audífonos.  Habrá un preludio musical a las 7:00 pm; la plática inspiradora por Leide Lessa se iniciará a las 7:15 pm.  Experimentar la energía de esta plática en nuestro edificio histórico.  Esperamos pasar estos momentos inolvidables con ustedes, en 583 Park Avenue, dónde será ofrecida guardería infantil a los muy pequeños.  Si no pueden asistir personalmente, el evento será transmitido en vivo: por www.ThirdChurchNYC.com.  También podrá asistir por teléfono: en español, marque 1 (310) 372-7549 y después el código de acceso: 7474 en inglés, marque 1 (310) 372-7549, y después el código de acceso: 607611  ¡Te esperamos en la 3ra iglesia de la Ciencia Cristiana en Nueva York!  ÚNETE A NOSOTROS EN LÍNEA EN THIRDCHURCHNYC.COM  Apreciamos su oración y apoyo para esta plática.  Donaciones para la celebración de este evento son recibidas con gratitud. Seleccione aquí para donar hoy.  583 Park Avenue, New York, NY 10065, United States You may unsubscribe or change your contact details at any time.

With light and comfort from above  Be Truth our guardian, Love our guide,  O’er every thought and step preside.  Be God our guide. Thanks, Sarah  ********************    We have had several emails saying the instructions outlined for updating the payment information for cav and cbe are not valid.  Thanks    Original Message Follows: ------------------------    Hello, This is what I did originally, but there is no available option for "Change Payment Details"—please advise, not available with any browser. Best, Éléna Toft     Sent from ??  On Aug 14, 2019, at 9:06 AM, My Bible Lesson <mybiblelessoncustserv@cdsfulfillment.com> wrote:     Thank you for contacting The Christian Science Publishing Society.     You can change the billing information for your myBibleLesson subscription by following these directions step-by-step:    1) Login at mybiblelesson.com    2) Put your cursor over "Welcome" in the top right corner and select "My Account" on in the drop down menu.    3) Login again with your full email address and password.    4) If your billing address has changed, click on the link in the right side of the screen to "Change Payment Address." On this screen you can change your address information and when finished, click the "Submit" button at the bottom of the screen.  5) If you only need to update your credit card details, click on the link in the right side of the screen to "Change Payment Details." On this screen you can change the credit card type, number and expiration and when finished, click the "Submit" button at the bottom of the screen.    If you are using a mobile device, such as a tablet or smartphone, the display on the screen will be different. Once you are logged in to your subscription, you will see "Welcome" in the upper right of the screen with "My account" and "Log out" underneath it.  Tap on "My Account". You will be asked to log in again. Once on your account page, you will find the option to "Change Payment Details" and "Change Payment Address" by scrolling down to the bottom of the webpage.    We hope this helps and you continue to enjoy myBibleLesson!      If we can be of further assistance, please let us know. To ensure your future concerns are handled in a timely fashion, please include all previous e-mail correspondence.   Thank you, Sarah The Christian Science Publishing Society Customer Service mybiblelessoncustserv@cdsfulfillment.com   For all your subscription service needs, visit https://w1.buysub.com/servlet/CSGateway?cds_mag_code=CBE the quick, easy and safe way to manage your magazine account and answer any questions you may have in one convenient place. column2: Gospel of Mark Article Series
The Croydon, Surrey, England Church History
column3: Dear Sir/Madam, I am studying my family history and have come across a puzzle.  I know that an ancestor named the address 14 Altyre Rd., Croydon, Surrey, England as a place she was going to.  It appears as if there is a reasonably modern Christian Science Church there now but I can find no reference to the history of that particular church [for example how long a church has been there and if it had an earlier incarnation]. I am wondering if she was member of your church? She died in 1938 in Croydon, Surrey and her name was Miss Irene Violet Purser. I am hoping you will be able to tell me how long that address has had, on it, a Christian Science church . Respectfully yours, Kay Clearson

column2: Submission for Consideration
column3: CS Editorial Staff  The attached item strives to clear the air in several areas before considering how to proceed in "ending gun violence."  It hopes to provide a consensus basis on which logical discussion can proceed by stipulating core realities that should not be used to play round the mulberry bush. The authors are retired colleagues, each with multiple graduate degrees, who spent their careers in systems engineering management of complex shipboard defense systems. column2: Wrongfully convicted was given 2 life sentences
column3: August 13, 2019 To whom it may concern,First let me say thank you for taking the time to ready my letter and most importantly the letter from my love one. I Edelina Robledo (Lina) am a friend that is helping Addie James Batten get his story out and get him help. He was accused and wrongfully convicted for a crime he did not commit. I don’t have the financial stability to help and his family well they did at the time of his first attorney but we all feel that there was not enough done to help fight his case. There was a lot in the case that was not focus on and I feel that he was not given a fair trail. Please take the time to read over his case and if there is anything you need, more information or know of anyone who can help please feel free to contact me. My number is (915) 999-1492. At the moment he is in the Telford Unit in New Boston, TX. He was given 2 life sentences for a crime he did not commit. Please help!  Here is a bit regarding his case… On June 29, 2017 an outcry statement was made against me by the biological father (Jeffery Winters), that I Addie James Batten allegedly sexually assaulted his daughter (Azaria Winters) by penetration of the mouth and penetration of the vaginal area. The child was taken to Santa Rosa Hospital in San Antonio Texas and a SANE exam was done. Results came back negative. Two additional DNA testing was done on me and the child. Both results came back negative. A trace analysis test was also done and results came back negative. The child testimony/outcry was full of inconsistencies. I  hold the copies of the child-safe interview 1 and 2 on Azaria Winters that shows inconsistencies and what was used in trial was not consistent with the 2 child-safe interviews 1 and 2. Not even close. Only that the child was coached by prosecutors and others to help get guilty verdict I also have a child safe interview from her brother (Isaiah Winters) who the biological father (Jeffery Winters) claims to say Isaiah Winters brought the outcry out. Isaiah Winters did not testify The prosecutor in this case Heather Wright in closing of my trial continuously led the jury to bring the court a guilty verdict, to the point that my attorney requested a mistrial with presiding Judge Honorable Dwight Peschel and was declined I’m a man with many tattoos all over my body and also in my groin area, those tattoos specifically are stars, moon, planets and a dolphin also to have 2 pearl implants which none of this was specifically specified in my trial, only the prosecutor to say to the jury that I had red dots and blue dots on groin area neither of which is in the child safe interview 1 and 2 by Azaria Winters. The state did subpoena photographs of this area only to refer to them as dots. One of the statements from Azaria Winters claimed that I had her brothers name “Isaiah loves James” penis tattooed I me. I do not. Also claimed that I had her name Azaria tattooed on my stomach, in which I do not, as in child safe interview she tells the interviewer “I can read”, She also in interview stated that her mother April Cordova stabbed me and killed me buried me in the backyard and that I went to God. There’s also statement by Azaria Winters that this all happened at our home in the bathroom as I was in the shower. She first claimed that she came in there to ask me to do the dishes because her brother Isaiah Winters wasn’t letting her help and that I placed y penis in her mouth but when her mother drove up with her baby brother Own James Batten I told her to go watch TV. As I pulled my pants up. Then she also came back to say that her mother April was in the bedroom getting dressed as I was in the bathroom of the master bedroom that has a leading door into the bedroom when this happened. She then claimed that I penetrated her vagina with my fingers that they were so big that they hurt and that she was pooping blood as her mother was getting pizza and drove up and I told her to watch tv.This is a small summary of just a few of the inconsistencies in my case and all DNA testing and other test total of 4 to come back negative. I have become a victim of this court so has my family who has spent their life’s savings hiring the defense attorney Alfonso Cabanas with a $20 grand price tag. He himself knows that I am an innocent man and has pleaded to any that I am but today I hear very little from him. As my family lives on Social Security paycheck to pay check. I pray and hope that someone will take interest in my case. I have enclosed a listing of my family and support names addresses and phone numbers Please feel free to get a hold of anyone in discussions regarding my case. Me and my family and support are at a loss for help. This is why I reach out and beg for somebody to hear and see my innocence. Please feel free to share this letter and information and pass it on to anyone that can help prove my innocence. Linda Batten (Grandmother) 830-303-4105        400 Tschoepe Rd Seguin, TX 78155Tina Batten (Mother) 830-837-9329                     400 Tschoepe Rd. Seguin, TX 78155Jim Baker (Step Father) 830-237-0574                 400 Tschoepe Rd. Seguin, TX 78155Lina Robledo(Wife) 915-999-1492                        2560 Friesenhahn Rd. Seguin, TX 78155Deacon Bob Leibrecht  830-964-3497 or 2573   180 St. Thomas Dr. Canyon Lake TX78133   Please feel free to give me a call anytime or text me. I've been trying to reach out to as many people as possible to help Addie Batten fight this case. He can not sit in prison for the rest of his life for a crime he did not commit. Please help me find justice for him. He is an innocent man. I want to thank you again for taking the time to read over this email. I truly appreciate it from the bottom of my heart.I hope you have a blessed day!Edelina Robledo  Sent from Yahoo Mail on Android  --  To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to customerservice+unsubscribe@csps.com.
